review_text:
=== Sunday roast ===
We had the traditional Sunday lunch today and were extremely impressed by the well cooked food, courteous and friendly service and lovely ambience.
Other diners also seemed to be enjoying the atmosphere and there were many empty plates being collected from neighbouring tables.

=== Birthday lunch ===
Excellent birthday lunch for our son
We didn’t book,  they were full and managed to squeeze us in 
The food was perfect, wonderful service Elise was amazing, the prawns were delicious! 
Ruben sandwich excellent 
Glad we are members of this wonderful hotel
We will be coming back regularly!

=== Amazing Team at Stanwell House, can't wait to come back ! ===
I can not fault this beautiful boutique hotel, the staff are incredible, the food is amazing and the interior design warm and homely with a dash of elegance. The team are so helpful and will arrange the countless activities that can be found on the doorstep of the hotel including a rib to the se the needles around the Isle of White to foraging the new forest. The beds are super comfy with the most softest pillows, each room individually styled with amazing showers and stan alone baths. Can't wait to return.

=== Exceptional boutique hotel. ===
Second visit to this stunning hotel and we loved it even more second time around. The staff team are super professional, helpful and attentive. The decor is colourful, relaxing and unique. The food and cocktails are delicious too. There isn’t anything to fault!

=== A perfect Xmas break in a perfect hotel ===
An absolute perfect Xmas break in an amazing hotel. 
All staff were brilliant & all very helpful. The room was really decorated beautifully & the whole hotel was stunning!
The food & drink was delicious!
Would definitely recommend to anyone !

=== Lovely Hotel ===
I booked the “basic”grade of room which was on the top floor so a bit of a slog up many steps (very upsy downsy being an old building) but a really delightful bedroom - cosy, beautiful decor, comfortable bed, a view over rooftops to the river and Isle of Wight ferry point and a small but immaculate shower room.  A good location for us in the High Street.  The special offer I booked included a cocktail in the bar.  There was a good choice and it is evidently a popular spot locally as it was busy.  The only disappointment was breakfast which wasn’t worth the cost.  The items we ate tasted rather cheap, nor did we get quite what we ordered.

=== We'll be back! ===
We stayed at Stanwell  House Hotel to celebrate an anniversary.

It’s a delightful hotel in the heart of Lymington amidst shops cafes pubs and restaurants. Our warm quiet  room  was very well furnished and decorated, with attention to detail. It overlooked a garden terrace, well lit and quiet in  stormy December

 Staff were very warm friendly and welcoming. The pride with which our room was cared for by  housekeepers was noticeable. All that we used was  refilled each day. Delivering fresh milk to our room each morning was a lovely touch.

 The breakfast menu was large and varied and again staff were very attentive to guests needs. We were able to linger and avoid the storms,  as there was plenty of space to accommodate all residents.
The bars were busy early in the evening but once casual dinners departed the hubbub subsided. We  enjoyed drinking in The Salt bar with its  log  burning  stove, although prices were on the high side.
Over our long weekend we only dined in the hotel once. The meal was excellent and the portions substantial. Good value for money given the quality on offer.

We loved our brief say in Lymington and plan to return to the excellent Stanwell House Hotel  in the year to come.

=== Great Hotel in a Great Village ===
We had a mix up with our booking ( we were 2 weeks early due to my online booking mistake) but it was immediately sorted by the excellent staff.
Great room of high quality with the best bathroom 'smellys' of any hotel.
Francesca made us very welcome in the restaurant as did Eva for an excellent breakfast.
The only weekend disappointment was a visit from Storm Darragh that prevented the Saturday Market going ahead

=== Great hotel in central location ===
Excellent hotel with friendly service and great  food in central town location with free parking. We have stayed at Stanwell  House on several occasions and at different times of the year. We always enjoy our stay and the hotel and look forward to returning again.

=== Country style hotel in the town with some exceptional aspects ===
Hotel was straight forward to find but as many have noted finding and getting into the car park is a bit of a challenge.  The staff try their best to guide you but the map provided could do with being more focused on the local area.
The overall vibe of the hotel is a posh country style, open and light with great wallpaper and overall decor scheme is lovely.  Although am sure we booked an 'attic' room we were given the key to a garden room over looking the side view / garden.  Room was furnished well - fantastic and comfortable large bed, small wardrobe, seating with a table and dresser.  Bathroom was well appointed in an 'edwardian' style of fittings with a large walk-in shower.  The room though was very warm initially and we tried the air-con which didn't seem to work and the window had restricted opening.  The supplied beverages and shortbread were of a very high quality and fresh milk supplied.  Minor note, like many hotels, there were no plates for the biscuits and prefer to be able to drop the tea bags onto a small dish vs the bin (really personal preference).  The side window also let in the direct sun, which was strong and low and the room would have benefitted from a roller or other type of privacy blind). The curtains were luxurious too but too early to close them!

Had a quick look around the High Street before returning for another cuppa and getting ready to go out (had booked at a local restaurant for a special event but would have liked to try out the hotels menu too).  As we had the inclusive cocktail package we indulged in the Salt bar with two lovely made cocktails by the bar staff and provided with a small snack of pop-corn too.

With such a comfortable bed and quiet location had a good nights sleep.  The shower had quite a limited flow - not sure if that was just our room or a general issue.

We were quite late to breakfast but this overall was a really good spread.  The buffet part had some good selections (although we didn't see any of the homemade granola - but there was enough other choice).  The coffee ordered was just about perfect - so much so we had some later in the day....

Hot food choices were good and other guests seem to say the same.  My wifes poached eggs were perfectly runny on the avo / sour dough bread.  Full English was excellent and in particular the black pudding was not a type had before - so we asked our server to find out the supplier and will be using this in the future.  Some aspects of the breakfast service was a little slow but Tina did a great job and it seemed they were a little under staffed.

Checkout all went well and we left the car in the parking place to explore a but further.  Before we left we couldn't resist some further cake and another of the excellent coffee and the luxury hot chocolate.  Will be planning a return trip for more than one night!!

There were a few issues the hotel need to address - would say 4.5 stars really - hoping you can get to 5 next time.

=== Faultless Stay! ===
We enjoyed an overnight stay at Stanwell House this weekend, taking advantage of the Autumn offer. What excellent value for money it was!!

The Hotel has been renovated since our last visit, and everything - from the stunning decor, to the welcoming and efficient service was fantastic!

Don’t get me started on the cocktails - Zachary the bar manager is a maestro! 🍸The list is delicious and inventive, and would not be out of place in a 5* London Hotel.

We didn’t dine at the Hotel on this occasion, but if breakfast is anything to go by, you’re in for a treat.

Absolutely faultless stay, and looking forward to returning! 😊

=== Stanwell House House Hotel is the epitome of a Boutique Hotel ===
Stanwell House Hotel is the absolute epitome of a Boutique  Hotel.
Perfect location in the heart of Lymington High Street.
Fabulous decor , interior design, furniture and furnishings , great attention to detail and  of a very high standard .
The most comfortable bed, duvet and pillows, like sleeping on a cloud.
Service was second to none, high standard of cleanliness .
Excellent Breakfasts  and Restaurant Food
Cosy Bar.
Car Parking available nearby.
Very highly recommended, will definitely return in the future, our go to place to stay when visiting The New Forest

=== Great Lunch at Stanwell House ===
I have just enjoyed a great lunch. We were welcomed by the newly appointed General Manager,  and given a lovely table in the Conservatory. Both the quality of food and level of service were exemplary, and I particularly enjoyed The Fish and Chips as a main course.  I would have no hesitation in recommending Stanwell House for a superb lunch !!

=== Amazing staff through and through ===
Stopped off for a quick lunch and enjoyed it so so much! Renata served us and she was absolutely amazing, as was Eva, Jemima, Enzo, and James. It was very clear that the staff were highly trained- the manager should be very proud! :) Food was delicious as well.

=== English Wine Dinner ===
Congratulations to  Stanwell House on their first Wine Dinner since the hotel’s refurbishment. It was wonderful evening of quality food/service and expert advice from Gusbourne Wine Ambassador Steve Kirkham.

The fish course felt like it would test my boundaries! My only previous experience of cockles has been of  an intense vinegar and gritty morsels served in a paper cup at the beach.  However, The Turbot, squid ink linguine and cockle cream dish was absolutely delicious. 

Looking forward to seeing which wine is featured next.

=== Great Stay at Stanwell House ===
Spent a night at the Stanwell House Hotel for our Wedding Anniversary. The hotel is lovely, really nicely appointed & they kindly upgraded us to a better room, which was nice. Maria on reception is excellent & Emily helped us find their Car Park (which is not easy to do). 

We had dinner in the restaurant, which was good, the service was slow due to two members of staff being off sick & no replacements being available. The restaurant supervisor however was brilliant (sadly forgotten her name) & did her best to make up for this.

The Salt Bar was lovely too, but the barman was clearly having a bad night as seemed to find our simple order an inconvenience, which was a shame. 

The full English breakfast was probably in the top 5 of those I have ever had in my life (& I’ve had a lot) simply cooked to perfection. A credit to the breakfast team, which is always an underestimated part of any hotel. 

Book this hotel, it’s a great place to stay, just needs a few more staff to get 5/5.

=== Fab little bar in gorgeous setting ===
We popped in for tea and caje and absolutely loved the area through the arch beside the main hotel. Staff weerfub and attentive. Would love to go back and stay, will keep it on radar for the next time we are in Lymington.
Cocktails looked dab as dud thr food

=== Weekend stay in a town centre haven. ===
Just returned from a two night stay in Stanwell House.  We went away for a weekend break with our two married daughters.  The first time we had been on holiday together as a four for over thirty years!  We loved the hotel’s decor, the whole feel of the place, but the best thing about it was the staff, who were without exception efficient, friendly and cheerful.  Our every need was catered for.  Beds were exceptionally comfortable and our rooms were spotlessly clean.  We had two rooms on the first floor overlooking the pretty courtyard garden.  Would love to go back there some time.
,

=== Loved it. ===
It was our first visit to this pretty small town which acts as one of the ferry ports to the Isle of Wight . The hotel is situ. on the main high street (which is a hill at the hotel end)  and the town itself is charming, with a quaint 5 min walk from the hotel to the quayside. 
We loved this boutique hotel as it had an intimate feel. The staff service was efficient, professional and friendly.  Our room (1st floor - no lift) and the food was 'quality'.  We booked this hotel for 4 nights B&B (offer 4 nights for 3) after visiting the hotel reception 10 weeks earlier and inspecting the type of room we then chose to book. All the staff were very friendly and happy and the decor. of the hotel (which we loved) clearly reflects a full and extensive refurbishment 2 yrs prior (as told by the locals).  We did have one meal out to a popular and recommended restaurant, which made a nice change, but the food wasn't as good as the hotels. There is a 12% service charge for the evening meal, but you get what you pay for. My only learn from the visit is that if you like to keep a track of your 'spending' whilst at the hotel, always ask for a copy receipt (which is not normally provided), as the total invoice presented at the end of our stay was not 'user friendly'!
The hotel car park close by is a bit of daily gamble, as there are only 12 car spaces available on a 'first come' basis. However, there's a council long-stay car park literally adjacent.  We enjoyed free parking whilst there, but in the summer months, that would be unlikely. 
Will be returning again - absolutely - 'can't wait'!

=== A big plus. ===
We have just completed a five week tour of the south of England, staying in similar priced hotels. Stanwell House excelled and was head and shoulders above other hotels where we stayed, in all aspects, staff, accommodation, restaurant and service.

=== Just right! ===
A lovely escape. Friendly and attentive staff throughout the hotel. Relaxing with a drink  in front of the log fire.The highlight was dinner in the Beresford restaurant. Totally delicious! Excellent massage. Great location for seeing the new Forest.

=== Check Availability of Leisure Facilities Before Booking!! ===
Booked a three night stay as a Spa Break. Lovely Hotel with pleasant staff but ... Gym has been out of use since begining of January, Unable to use Spa facilities on first day due to high Chlorine levels. Day Two - no showers working in Male changing rooms ... directed by signs to poolside shower ... poolside shower sign stated it was not working either. Very dissapointed as no communication received prior to visit or on arrival of these omissions. Didn't even bother going to Spa on Day Three.

=== Pleasant and enjoyable stay ===
Stayed in superior room with my wife and little Cockapoo (who was spoilt by everyone)
The room was spacious with views over garden and even a bed for the dog complete with welcome note from Winnie (hotel dog)
Considering there was a large birthday party occupying the main restaurant, and very busy , the staff were excellent in looking after the remaining guests.
The dinner was in a class of its own and a great choice on the drinks menu (even their hotel brewery)
We are now on their mailing list, so another visit will be made.
Thanks to everyone

=== WOW HIDDEN GEM ===
We booked this for 2 nights bed breakfast and dinner via secret escapes for an unbelievable deal so safe to say we where rather dubious! But oh my god how wrong where we! First impressions driving in at night to the lovely lit hotel to the spacious well cleaned room with a fantastic comfy bed to having dinner in Beresford's which was absolutely stunning l! Had the chicken satay squid bread soup goats cheese hake gurnard burger and fish chips over the course of the 2 nights and everything was delicious! As for the breakfast all fresh piping hot and local ingredients!! What an amazing find and we can't wait to go back! Always a massive shout to all of the staff we spoke from the receptionist to the cleaners everyone so so friendly and lovely thank you all for an amazing stay!

=== A great experience from arrival to departure ===
I have become a regular visitor to this hotel. I like the atmosphere, the staff, the layout, facilities and the location. I have lost count how may times I visited in 2024, having found and visited several times in 2023. I have already booked for March 2025 and will doubtless book at least two more weekends, possibly more.

=== Second visit in a week ===
Our room was spacious and well-equipped and the huge bed was super comfy. This was our second visit in a week and we were delighted with the little welcome treat that was waiting for us. The reason for such a quick return to the hotel was the quality of food in Beresfords restaurant.  Last week my husband enjoyed a perfectly cooked loin of venison but when he tasted my  braised ox cheek, he suffered from food envy, so we had to return just so he could enjoy the dish himself!! We both had it this time and the meat just melts in the mouth and had perfect accompaniments.  The location is excellent with pleasant walks in the forest close by. The staff are well-trained and help provide a welcoming experience from the moment you walk through the door. Of particular note are Chloe and Tracy. Chloe served us in the bar and restaurant on both occasions and was knowledgeable about the menu and had a fun personality. Tracy served us at breakfast both times and dealt well with an issue we had with the breakfast on the first visit. The young lady (Amy?) who checked us in yesterday took a lot of trouble in checking that ox cheek was on the menu! The lady on reception today told us about a 3-mile walk in the forest directly from the hotel so we will definitely return to do that as well as to enjoy the excellent food and peaceful location.

=== Great place for a break ===
We love the surroundings and relaxed environment. Dog friendly which is a must for us.
All the staff are friendly and couldn't be more helpful.
The food from breakfast all the way through to dinner are delicious and couldn't ask for more.
We will be back!!

=== Lovely Stay in the Beautiful New Forest ===
We absolutely loved our stay at Balmer Lawn and it felt so lovely,  homely and comfy.  The rooms were great and the staff were quick to change our room when we arrived as when we were given the key as it hadn’t been serviced.
The bar was very cosy and has a lovely wood burner and the food in the restaurant was absolutely delicious.
There is room for improvement in the serving of food at breakfast as my breakfast was given to another table so I had to eat mine after the rest of us but the breakfast itself, when it did arrive, was exceptional.
Also the bathroom in our room was a bit tired and could do with the shower door seals and silicone being redone but, the room itself was lovely with a balcony looking out on to the grazing new forest ponies.
Despite the above I would love to be able to go back for more than a night as it has such charm, lovely staff and we really enjoyed our stay.

=== Best hotel in the New Forest ===
Another fantastic stay at our favourite hotel in the New Forest. Had a lovely big room with a very comfortable 4 poster bed and huge bathroom. Breakfasts were always delicious, all the staff are friendly and welcoming. Had a great meal in the bar on our first night. We used the pool and sauna and we’re looking forward to coming back when the renovations to that area are complete. Thank you very much in particular to Tom and Briony for making us once again feel so welcome.  As Arnold Schwarzenegger said ‘I’ll be back’. 😊

=== fantastic hotel in the New Forest ===
Fantastic stay in the always welcoming Balmer Lawn. great setting for walks and cycling and generally exploring the forest.
we had a fantastically comfortable room, with windows that open for the lovely fresh forest air! great size bathroom with good strong and hot shower.
we had a lovely cocktail pre dinner before a wonderful dinner in beresfords.
my wife and coeliac and I am gluten intolerant and everything was dealt with without issue and we felt no risk of contamination from gluten.

breakfast was also exceptional with breakfasts being cooked separately to order for our needs.

we cannot wait to be back with the new spa area

=== Short but very very sweet. ===
My husband and I have just returned  from a night at Balmer Lawn. This was our 4th visit and it didn't  disappoint.
I purchased our stay as a black Friday deal and as our Christmas 
Present and payed a great price.
We have had a tough few months and then, the day before  we were due to arrive, had to rearrange because of illness so we were really desperate to have time away and to just relax together.
The hotel was fantastic at rearranging our stay and very kindly upgraded our room....we were so impressed  with their kindness.
The room was absolutely  beautiful....luxury 4 poster room with a lovely bathroom and gorgeous  smelling accessories. We were able to simply  relax in comfortable surroundings, indulge in the leisure  facility and spend time in front of the fire just reading and reconnecting.
We ate in Beresfords restaurant and enjoyed a beautiful meal. The staff were attentive and efficient. We also enjoyed a cooked breakfast....plenty of choice and cooked to perfection.
Although our stay this time was only a short one it was perfect and  we  left feeling relaxed and pampered.
We love this hotel for it's  elegant but relaxed feel where the staff are super efficient and friendly.  We will definitely return. 
Thank you to all the hard working staff at Balmer Lawn for another memorable stay.

=== A night away with my husband. ===
The whole experience was as excellent as ever.  We have stayed on a number of occasions over the years and never had a bad experience.  Staff wonderful, food great, rooms great. My only slight 'complaint' is the quality of the sliced bread at breakfast.

=== Balmer Lawn ===
The staff were very friendly, helpful and attentive. The rooms, overlooking the cricket pitch were fantastic and comfortable. If I was going to have one issue it was that the rooms were to hot but given the age of the hotel this is minor. The breakfasts were fantastic but a few chopped fruits and nuts/seeds would have made it even better.

=== Warm, friendly and relaxing weekend break ===
We had a wonderful stay at Balmer Lawn. The staff were friendly and helpful, service was quick, food was delicious and the atmosphere was warm and relaxing - no stuffiness! The spa area relaxation room had plenty of space, but the pool side lacked loungers so we weren’t able to get a seat until some people left even though there were only 3 couples / small groups there.

=== The very BEST ===
I love this hotel. We sat by the fire in the lounge and had fantastic Vodka martini’s. Later we sat by the fire with fish and chips. The batter was so crispy and it was a large portion. The room was spacious and spotlessly clean. In the afternoon I went to the Spa. Hot tub , swimming and a sauna. I felt so relaxed. Breakfast was very prompt service and an extra pot of coffee was offered. January is a good month to visit The Balmer Lawn as it is not too busy. 5th time I have stayed here and love it each time.

=== New Years bash to remember. ===
The hotel location is ideal for walks and being a dog friendly hotel is an extra benefit.
We found the staff to be really helpful and friendly.
The rooms could do with an update, showing wear and tear in places and the shower was awkward to get in and out of. Bed was large and comfortable though.
Our New Year’s Eve stay was memorable, probably the best New Years celebration we have attended, even the hard working staff seemed to enjoy the evening. The pre dancing dinner was probably on the small side (6 course taster) so without the midnight bacon rolls I doubt I would have made it through the night without snacking.
Overall we had a great time and like many others would do it all again.

=== So welcoming ===
Second time we visited....a cold and wet day walking in the New Forest, we needed a break. It was so friendly and welcoming, warm and cosy. We only went for a warm up drink but they couldn't have been friendlier..lovely staff and great service, plus cosy and comfortable surroundings.

=== Excellent as usual ===
Lovely room, excellent food and friendly and efficient staff, just as we have come to expect at Balmer Lawn.
From the moment we arrived in reception until the moment we left every aspect of our brief stay was exceptional and great value for money. Thanks to everyone.

=== A very relaxing stay. ===
We wanted time to personally recharge after the Christmas/New Year celebrations. That is what Balmer Lawn offers, it is a welcoming and friendly hotel, in a great location, with excellent food and wine, and superb staff. 

It also offers wonderful Spa Treatments, with very experienced staff. For us it is a "home from home", and we look forward to a return visit very soon.

=== Fantastic hotel ===
What a fantastic hotel in the heart of the New Forest,  we ate in the hotel restaurant on the Saturday evening & cannot recommend it highly enough,  superb food with great service,  a really nice atmosphere throughout the hotel,  all the staff at the hotel are a credit to it,    a special "well done" to Hilton the barman,  made us feel extremely welcome & his local knowledge was extremely helpful.....well done to the whole team at the Balmer Lawn,  we will definately be back again....

=== One of The Best hotels we have ever stayed in ===
This was one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in. Beautiful Accommodation, great food and friendly attentive staff. The hotel makes good use of its various spaces   with a formal but relaxed restaurant, a casual dog friendly dining space, bar and a garden that is perfect for any occasion.

=== Loved it so much we stayed an extra day ===
We came for 3 nights and loved everything: fab decor, friendly but professional staff, great room, perfect location. Food all locally sourced and high quality, delicious produce. Beautifully and recently renovated, no expensive spared. Breakfast up there with the best. Menu good, only small thing would be to have 3 starters with Sunday lunch as little on the daily menu offers small starters. Small thing. Loved our stay and considering we came for a rest from a tough time and family loss, this hotel has made us feel so relaxed, welcome and valued customers. Will be back.

=== A fantastic 4 night stay ===
A fabulous 4 days at Stanwell House. Everything was perfect.  The staff in particular were so pleasant and friendly and couldn’t do enough to help you.   Food was delicious and we loved the breakfasts. The rooms were lovely - clean, beautifully decorated and had everything we needed even down to toiletries. Stanwell House is convenient for everything. We will definitely be returning.

=== Really enjoyable stay ===
We came here for 3 nights and booked it because it was a dog friendly hotel.  Staff are great and really welcoming,  we had breakfast each morning (and great variety and nicely served).  We had dinner one night and that was delicious- menu was interesting and the lamb shank curry with cashew nuts was just fabulous.   Our room was nice, quite dark and very warm (but two fans in the room) and while there’s a terrace it’s more like a corridor looking out on the main terrace area.  Bathroom small and not really functional with the shower over the bath being so low it was difficult to use.  But guess that’s the compromise for being in a dog friendly room

=== Characterful hotel in the centre of Lymington ===
We have just had a lovely four night stay at the Stanwell House Hotel staying in a house room facing the main high street. There is a small car park adjacent to the long stay car park but spaces are very limited. Whilst our room was very cosy and comfortable the windows are single glazed so even when shut we could hear traffic and people talking outside well into the night/early morning. We could also hear people in the room above us. The hotel has loads of character and we found all the staff to be very friendly and welcoming. We had dinner in the Samphire Restaurant and the Salt Bar. The food menu is the same throughout the hotel and the dishes we had were well presented and very tasty. The fish pie was particularly good and the gnocchi.  The breakfast was excellent with plenty of choice and good quality ingredients. We would also recommend the Kings Arms in the old part of Lymington and The Haven Restaurant overlooking the marina. We very much enjoyed our stay but would probably not have a room at the front of the hotel if we visited again.

=== Thank you Bethan ===
We had a fantastic family lunch in The Orangery. Beautiful setting and wonderful food. The service provided by all the staff was excellent, especially from our waitress, Bethan. The dining experience was all the better for Bethan’s caring nature and sparkling personality. Nice garden area too!! We look forward to returning again soon.

=== Great place to eat ===
We are frequent visitors to the fabulous orangery restaurant, Francesca and her team of great staff are very attentive and very friendly, nothing is to much effort, they make the whole experience just perfect!  

Added to the great service, the menu is varied, the food is great, the surroundings are A1, absolutely love the garden and they are dog friendly!

=== Exceptional menu, lovely setting, smiling staff. ===
We visited on a Friday late lunch with a group of friends, our table wasn’t booked (turned out I had booked it for the day before ). This was absolutely no problem for the girls in front of house.  They found us a lovely table with smiles and warm welcome.  
The menu here is so interesting with choices to suit everyone and fresh and exciting flavours.  
The starter tapas choices are lovely and I always have chicken satay which has tender chicken and a delightful sauce.  
The service was excellent.  3 young ladies served us and were polite , attentive and efficient.   
Well done stanwells with such a great setting / menu / staff you are my favourite place in the area !!!

=== A warm welcome at the weekend.. ===
Since relocating to East Dorset we have fallen in love with Lymington and one of its greatest assets - Stanwell House. Most weekends we'll have breakfast in the beautiful Orangery (dog friendly) and bask in the relaxing, contemporary and peaceful surroundings. The whole team are always friendly and welcoming - especially Renata and Max. We can't recommend the Stanwell House highly enough!

=== Best place to eat in Lymington. ===
We popped into Stanwell House Hotel whilst in Lymington for a quick lunch and were escorted into the gardens as we had our litle dog with us. We were not disappointed; the garden was beautifully  set out with tables and chairs and sun umberellas. The staff were very pleasant and efficient.

=== Drink with friends ===
I went to Stanwell House yesterday just for a drink in the garden. This place is gorgeous inside and out, we had cocktails and wine with nibbles - battered samphire, peppers with chilli and halloumi fries with delicious dips, the garden is extremely pretty, seating is comfortable, staff are attentive. They have live music on Fridays which unfortunately we could not stay for but we will be back, we recommend!

=== A little bit of heaven in Lymington ===
Beautifully appointed rooms. Perfect position on the High Street just 5 minutes walk from the quay. Lovely peaceful garden with plenty of seating and a bar. Nice restaurant. Great staff. Highly recommended, we will be back here again soon.

=== Great Hotel, the upper floors require Air Conditioning though. ===
The Stanwell House Hotel is a beautifully refurbished hotel in a great Town Centre location. The breakfast was lovely with locally sourced foods. With all the money that has been spent refurbishing the Hotel the only downside is that there is no Air Conditioning to the top floor rooms.

=== Great hotel on main street. ===
An excellent hotel ideally situated on the High Street. Rooms were very comfortable.
Breakfast and Dinner were to the highest standard and nothing was too much trouble for the employees. Parking is not adjacent to hotel but in own car park opposite the hotel on other side of street. Do get instructions as further that it appears and you have to pass through general car parks for access. Bus station is within 800 yards and easy to catch bus to Milford on Sea if going to Hurst Castle. We had garden room which did not create problem with noise.

=== Very long lazy lunch ===
Lunch for 4 on a sunny Saturday.  Hotel interiors are wonderful and the restaurant & terrace area are extremely inviting and relaxing.  The tables stretch out the back for quite some way and there is another bar at the end of the property.  Loved the colourful furnishings - such a change from the standard neutrals found nearly everywhere these days.  Good very food but perhaps a little pricey.  Our ‘nibbles’ were delicious but we felt that ‘black’ (actually brown) mayonnaise was a mistake (use your imagination).   Mains were superb - 2 of our party said the fish pie was the best they had ever eaten. My lobster macaroni was delicious and the risotto excellent.  Dessert menu did not have anything we fancied - nothing chocolate based, lemony or toffee based to tempt us.  Great coffee though.  We sat down at 1:30, long waiting times meant that our main courses came out at 3:30 which was later than we would have wanted - but we didn’t really mind.  Anyone on a schedule would have been a bit fed up with the timings though.  Overall excellent - staff were all very knowledgeable, polite and well trained.

=== Cramped, airless rooms ===
Promised a dog-friendly room with patio access and king-size bed. The room was tiny. The bed not king-sized. The ‘patio’ was actually an outside extension of the bar, crowded and with live amplified music. The only ventilation was the door to the patio which couldn’t be opened for obvious reasons. So the room was airless, claustrophobic and stuffy. There was no room for a wardrobe, just some pegs on the wall. Truely one of the worst hotel rooms I have stayed in…
The bed and breakfast rate includes only a rather mean buffet. If you want anything cooked you pay a flat rate extra of £15.95 even for porridge.
The parking is stressful and cramped.
Will not be back.

=== Nice Hotel (if you don’t want to sleep) ===
We arrived at this hotel and were impressed by the gorgeous decoration and welcoming staff. The location is great and the car park was an extra benefit. We booked a garden room as were advised they were quieter as at the rear of the hotel and have A.C.

The trip sharply went down hill…

Firstly, the bed was horrendous, rock hard and lumpy. We asked for a mattress topper but the night manager couldn’t find one. Secondly, It was so noisy! We could hear the people next door, word for word as there is no noise insulation. The air conditioning unit rattled and the hot water made noises on and off through the night. Needless to say we did not sleep, which, as someone who can usually sleep anywhere, is saying a lot.

We were so disappointed as we had come away as a birthday treat and to have a proper night sleep away from two little ones. Instead we came away exhausted! 

We spoke to the lady on reception in the morning, who was unapologetic and said it was obviously just us. There was no attempt to apologise or suggestion they’d look into it. What a total waste of money! 

Great if you want somewhere smart and clean - terrible if you are after some sleep.

=== Lovely location, but overpriced. ===
I have previously provided private e-mail feedback to Stanwell House, but It appears they have ignored it, so it’s fair game to now post a public review with my abridged comments:

Overall we enjoyed the hotel, particularly the location and the high quality of dinner (we didn’t make a fuss about the spider on our shared starter in case everyone else wanted one).

Our room (37, a ‘loft room’) was very small, and so hot & stuffy it made sleeping uncomfortable (the window was prevented from opening more than a crack).

In addition, we found that the shower did not drain faster than it filled up, limiting shower time. I also found a previous guest’s loose tablet medication in a bedside drawer.

Overall, we are minded to choose Stanwell House again for reasons including dinner quality, parking availability and location. However, with some of the issues we discovered (including the failure to acknowledge my e-mail feedback), I think Stanwell House falls just short of its premium price-point.

=== Lovely stay, tiny room improvements. ===
Four day stay here for a break and it didn’t disappoint.  Welcome and check in was professional, friendly and exactly right, not too stuffy, not too over familiar and this was the standard throughout.  The hotel is very pretty, very floral and feminine in decor in the restaurant and orangery.  The bar has a great vibe and staff here are upbeat and chatty.  Room was comfortable although the armchairs and sofa probably could be squishier to allow for a bit of sinking in at the end of the day. Bed, lovely, good linens and a nice soft topper on a quality mattress.  Bathroom good.  Could do with a magnifying mirror though (especially for contact lens wearers) and the floor needs a bit of a bleach as it’s a little bit grey now.  We mentioned at reception that the room (17) also needs soundproofing where there is an adjoining wall. Our neighbours were not noisy at all but you could hear them talking quite clearly at times.  
Breakfast is quite delicious and good choices.  A simple buffet for granola, English ham and cheese etc was available, not a huge choice but enough. The best staff I’ve have experienced in a very long time.  Well done!

=== Absolutely fabulous hotel.... ===
Really fabulous hotel. Staff brilliant...room amazing..food and cuisine first class great ambience and very clean indeed. Lovely garden and conservatory to dine. I could not fault in any dept well done everyone involved 11/10 Neil Winstone Alfriston East Sussex

=== Voyage Prive deal ===
We stayed overnight in a Superior room overlooking the cricket pitch. (B&B) Staff are friendly and helpful but the hotel is badly in need of a refurbishment. The spa treatment rooms and relaxation area looks good but the swimming pool and changing area are very poor. Only 1 shower working in female changing room and no shower working in male room. The poolside shower isn’t working so guests are not showering before swimming or after using the sauna. The gym is closed. Some of the lockers don’t have workable locks. The lighting is inadequate around the pool. No poolside towels were available when we visited.
Our room was unbearably hot - no thermostat. One of the robes didn’t have any fastening. The bath sink was partially blocked. The safe was broken.
Breakfast was average. One half tomato, one half mushroom, one hash brown, one vegetarian sausage, one poached egg. Lots of additional pay items. Again the staff were friendly and helpful.
We paid £219 which I didn’t really feel was good value. 
Limited seating around bar area - folk on laptops working/meeting afternoon and evening - maybe Balmer Lawn is most used for work conferences (both days we were there). 
Such a shame - I’ve

=== Lovely birthday get away ===
Lovely one night stay for my birthday at this gem of a hotel . Staff really lovely and approachable. I took my little dog Layla and the staff loved her! 
Food was great  and  I had a great gin and tonic prepared by a really attentive waitress. Great feel about this place - just what I needed. 
Sleep wise - I was woken at 4am by movement/ furniture sounds from another room( not the hotels fault) but apart from that the bed was huge ,  comfortable and had a nice vibe. Great coffee machine , powerful shower and facilities. 
Really interesting to find out that the place used to be a field hospital in the First World War - definitely going to return in the warmer months to sit outside with a glass of wine. Thank you :-)

=== Cosy overnight stay in the forest ===
We loved our stay. The staff were excellent, food very good and very central in the forest. Small enough to be personal and big enough to have facilities like the indoor pool. Great decor too - they've created a great ambience. Fabulous giant christmas tree, cosy lounge area and elegant dining area.  Super comfy room too.

=== Relaxing weekend stay. ===
Friendly and efficient staff. Warm and comfy dog friendly hotel with good facilities in lovely surroundings.                            Exceptional food for evening meals and buffet breakfast. Looking forward to going back to Balmer Lawn Hotel later in the year.                                                                                 .

=== Great Staff. New Year meal dissapointing ===
Did a 3 night New Year Break. Booked five rooms for the family. Rooms ok but a couple with dated furniture and one (15) could not turn the heating down so had to sleep with window wide open. Reported it, nothing done. New Years Eve was a good night, let down by disappointing meal. All the staff were excellent, very friendly and helpful. We will return but not for New Year as meal was  poor for the money we paid. Best thing we ate was the bacon roll after midnight. Lots of other guests said the same thing.

=== Lovely old hotel. ===
Superb hotel and customer service. Fab location in the Forest and walking distance (20 mins) to the village. Standard rooms perfectly acceptable. Fab breakfast sadly let down by the number of dogs where we ate our breakfast. We weren’t told the area we were seated was dog friendly. Had we been told we wouldn’t have sat there. Appreciate it is a dog friendly area but guests should be advised before being seated.

=== Fab New Years Eve Package ===
We visited the Balmer Lawn Hotel for the first time ever this NYE - having driven past it many times when we were younger and always wondered what it was like inside. Overall we really could not fault the evening and had a wonderful time. We arrived a little early but were welcomed at reception and given a map so that we could do a quick walk in the forest direct from the hotel whilst our room was being prepared. This is a great bonus - the walk is around 90 mins if you do it all and so beautiful! We were allocated a room with a lovely forest view on the third floor - it was spacious and comfy (the receptionist moved us to this floor at our request there is a lift so only one step to navigate!) We made a cuppa in our room (all provided by the hotel) and then changed into swimsuits and robes to go and enjoy the leisure pool/jacuzzi/sauna. There were a few others in there and I had to pop back to reception to get towels and to the spa to get slippers, - but all staff were very happy to help with this, so no issues. On our way back up to our room later we completed a wine and fizz order on specially prepared leaflets which we posted in a post box. Great idea and so organised! The evening started with champagne and candles at 6.30 - and we met other diners all dressed up in black tie and sparkles etc. There wasn’t enough seating out at this point- but actually this forced us to chat to other people which was really good. There was a great atmosphere. We then had a delicious relaxing meal - lots of courses and very tasty food. Well done to the chefs for getting out so many meals on time and perfectly cooked! By the time we finished eating it was around 9 ish and we then had seats around a dance floor with a DJ playing lots of nostalgic music. There was now lots of seating out, a Photo Booth (brilliant fun with lots of hats glasses feathers etc to parade in whilst the camera counted down and snapped away) and a room with casino games in. We whiled away the time to midnight by dancing / spending our ‘monopoly’ money and taking pics. The time flew by with lots of laughter and fun and fizz. Such a fab night and then bacon rolls were bought out to keep us going till 1 am. The staff were brilliant throughout and really well led by the manager Tom who was very hands on and helpful ( even finding me party poppers when I left mine in the restaurant!) overall a 10 out of 10 - and topped off with a good breakfast in the morning. We will definitely return to this hotel - after March when the manager shared the spa will be renovated and extended with new facilities.

=== Love BLH&S .....just one 'but' ===
We have stayed here many times and love the place. 
Friendly welcomes at the front desk and always good service. Food is good and the breakfasts excellent. 
Breakfast...talking of which.......at the risk of triggering Mr Wilson, when did the last sitting get brought forward to 09.45 with last orders at 10.00? We are not milkmen and don't remember those early timings in previous years. It seems somewhat early especially on a weekend. 
Forest Park Hotel and The Huntsman put the sausages away at 10.30 and 11.00.
We even ordered in room breakfast for the 09.30 - 10.00 slot and it came at 09.15!!
It was good to get home, only for a lie in......

=== Lovely stay ===
What a beautiful hotel with character and charm. My husband and I stayed for just one night. We went for a lovely walk in the forest around the hotel and then came back and had a couple of drinks in the bar. Our standard room was clean and modern. The only thing was that we didn’t find the bed very comfortable.. a little a hard. But we will definitely return.

=== Brilliant Birthday Treat ===
We were treated by our children for my wife’s Big Birthday, and boy, what a treat it was!
The staff were brilliant with our little toddler grandson, who’d just started walking and making the most of the large spaces available to him. They were very fleet of foot! 
The family rooms were spacious, the beds comfortable, the food delicious and a wide variety of drinks available at the bar and with meals. Staff were very accommodating at all times. 
The pool was lovely for all of our grandchildren, children and ourselves, towels provided in addition to our room towels. 
The hotel is ideally situated for exploring the New Forest, which we did thoroughly over the weekend. 
All in all a fabulous weekend treat for us from our children! 
Highly Recommended!

=== A wonderful experience. ===
Stayed from Xmas eve to 27th on Xmas package. Absolutely delighted with the warm welcome by all the staff and the delicious meals the chefs created .
From manager , waitresses to those creating wonderful cocktails…. nothing was too much trouble.
We thoroughly enjoyed everything and look forward to returning next year!

=== Fantastic festive break! ===
We stayed at Balmer Lawn from Christmas Eve to 27th as part of their Christmas package.

We had a lovely time, ate and drank far too much but mostly just relaxed which was a great way to spend the festive break. 

There was an issue with our daughter’s interconnecting room but they sorted it immediately and she found herself in a very lovely room of her own just over the corridor from us which she thought was great. My husband managed to stop the leak as maintenance were not working and we left the inter connecting room drying out so all was sorted nice and quickly. 

The rooms were lovely, being at the end of a corridor was ideal although those stairs after dinner felt like a workout ;-)

The food and drink were exceptional! As someone with a food intolerance I cannot fault the team, so much attention to detail, a call in advance from the restaurant manager to check in with me and follow up emails to make sure I had the right options. Throughout our stay the staff knew I had an intolerance so knew to bring me oat milk and came and found with me with a tray of dairy free canapés which was a lovely touch. 

The manager (I think his name was Tom) was great, made sure he checked in with every table on Boxing Day and stopped to chat with all the guests. 

The staff were all lovely, really great team! I did feel for them on Christmas Day as a couple of guests were not that kind to them but they just kept smiling! Well done to them all.

The night porter was fabulous, my daughter had an asthma attack on Christmas Eve and despite being busy resetting the hotel after a fire alarm he took time to get stuff I needed and came and checked she was ok the next morning. 

This was our second festive break at Balmer lawn and we hope to be back again for another. 

Thank you!

=== Exceptional ===
I have been a number of times and never disappointed. We had dinner there with friends and both The NFH Ball and Boxing Day meet were held there. 
Service is impeccable, thoughtful, kind and friendly.
The food delicious…the bar cosy and cocktails just perfect. Location idyllic.
Highly recommend.

=== Boxing Day lunch ===
The welcome was a little sharp, not warm. Welcome drinks dwindling - poured my own for some of the party. The table allocated had to be made bigger for the party size and was not low level as I’d asked for a few times with disabled parents when
booking. Food tasty but not like the amazing buffet two years back when we last came or service. Sadly the buffet area was not looked after, so no bowls or extra cutlery and food bits everywhere especially on the fruit salad / bread area. 
Male toilets not cleaned regularly and towels dropped on floor still there two hours later. I removed a blockage from the sink. 
Despite the fact I had spent nearly £550 on the buffet and drinks, two of the party tried to get coffee at the end in a smaller table area, after the buffet finished whilst waiting for the EV charger. Eventually taken to the snug by a waiter which was empty, but then informed by another waiter, as they were not guests they couldn’t order?? Gave up and sat in the car. 
Sadly this will be our last year. Even though staff friendly, the service and delivery didn’t meet the expectations from previous visit, which is a real shame. The hot food was tasty.

=== Great place, great people! ===
Such a cosy night spent at the hunt ball.
The rooms were great, the party was brilliant and the staff were all so patient and lovely. 
Especially in the morning when we were quite late for breakfast but we were still treated nicely and really enjoyed the breakfast!

=== Amazing ===
Amazing work xmas do! catered for a variety of dietary preferences and endless wine! fantastic DJ and attentive staff. i wish id paid to stay the night as the spa looks worth a visit.  All of us said it's the best venue and work do weve ever had ❤️.

=== Great coffee ===
Tasty coffee here often served with a welcome treat eg shortbread cookie.  Very comfortable surroundings with welcoming friendly service. Car parking easy too. Combined with a walk in the forest or into the centre of the village where there is a super bakery, florist, butcher and general stores, a perfect morning.

=== What is likely to be a one-off visit. ===
Had a light family lunch - we felt rushed by the person seating us at the table despite there being only two other people seated in the restaurant. Food was excellent however the side dishes ordered by one of our party were very small, plain and overpriced.
We were charged an astounding £32 for 4 Luke warm coffees and a further £12 for 2 bottles of water capped off by a disproportionate service charge as a result. Without going into detail this was a very expensive one course lunch.
The restaurant was lovely, and tastefully decorated for Christmas but the over priced billing on some items left something of a sour taste to our first experience of the Balmer Lawn

=== Lovely Ambience Disappointing Food. ===
Called in after a walk for soup and a coffee. Loved the ambience in the lounge. The coffee was great. 
Unfortunately , it took 45 minutes for the soup to come and it was pretty  lukewarm and lacked flavour and the focaccia  bread was disappointing - tasted stale. Judging by the ratings, I think we just hit the restaurant on an off day , so would give it another try.

=== Nice location in New Forest ===
I thought the room rate was competitive for a four star hotel in the New Forest. My bedroom was spacious and the bed was comfortable, and the en-suite bathroom was well supplied with toiletries. Although the quality of the food was good in the restaurant, service was a little slow.

=== Birthday Week In Lymington ===
We have now visited the Stanwell Hotel twice since it opened and both occasions have been super. We are already booked in for next year🙌  The rooms are very clean and beautifully decorated and the Salt bar and restaurant facilities are lovely. The food is excellent and the staff ..Housekeeping as they do a super job and as said keep the room very clean best I have ever seen in a hotel. so well done you all 🤩Renata and Nieave in the restaurant and bar are super and they keep the wine flowing and James at the front desk ensures all is perfect for you! Lucy and Kiera are excellent front house as well ensuring all runs smoothly! See you all next year in June 2025! -Let's hope the weather is better then! ☀️

=== Service goes the extra mile ===
I went for lunch today and omg... what a beautiful experience from start to finish. Service and food were smooth and professnal. However, I would like to draw extra attention to Sharon.  The housekeeping manager(I think). Her knoweledge and the time she gave was second to none. So much so I will be booking multiple trips back personally and putting the hotel forward for professional bookings. Thank you for bringing back professionalism back to hospitality.

=== Wonderful dog friendly dining experience ===
Booked a table in The Orangery for Good Friday as we were staying in The New Forest over the Easter weekend and had our dog with us. Food was absolutely delicious - can recommend the Lobster Macaroni! It was so nice to dine in  stylish surroundings with our dog, drinking nice wine and eating great food. Will definitely return.

=== Worthy of 5 stars, great value. ===
Struck lucky with this hotel.  Not expensive but good quality service and rooms. One of the rooms has double bed and a room off it with bunk beds.

Good sized bathroom and wardrobes, restaurant and bar pleasant, taxi ride into Lymington…………..

=== Excellent boutique hotel, small and friendly with great service ===
We are regular visitors and enjoy our stay on each occasion with friendly and courteous staff, whether at reception, bar,breakfast or dinner. In addition rooms are spotless and great beds/linen. Free parking is available across the road. Food is excellent and dining available in main restaurant, conservatory, bar or if lucky with weather the patio area outside.

=== Not to be missed.... ===
A very well thought desined boutique hotel and pub with an excellent restaurant. All staff are very well trained. We were greeted in the bar area by a professional young man who showed us our seats (unreserved) and took our order. Cocktails were very well made and very good polite service. We then went to the restaurant for a very well appointed area, great service and lovely food. Well done to the management for employing and training such good staff. It is DEFINITELY well worth the visit.

=== Great, dig friendly, stay ===
I am terrible at being critical in reviews and try to concentrate on positives. However, my wife, myself and our dog have had a lovely stay at Stanwell. In particular the staff are polite, engaging and keen to accommodate. The hotel is very well appointed and rooms have everything you could want, down to USB charging from socket outlets. The dining areas and bar get very busy and are clearly popular with non residents so booking is recommended. Our thanks to Stanwell staff.

=== Special birthday treat ===
We went to Stanwell House for a meal with friends to celebrate my husbands birthday.  We started with cocktails in the bar then went through to the restaurant.  The food and service were excellent, lots of choice and really nice,  I had the venison which was outstanding.
Special mention  for Spencer the waiter who was a complete star.  We are local so will definitely be returning.

=== Tasty cocktail. ===
Delish pornstar (cocktail) made by John and Jack despite ordering a bit late and it's an annoying cocktail to make. Luvs it. 10/10 would recommend. Lovely atmosphere and the fluffiest of pillows. Big up the marble tables, very smooth, plus nice hand towels in the bathrooms!!!

=== Fabulous ===
Absolutely loved Stanwell House. From the call before we arrived, to the hotel team, our room and the food, everything was perfect. We got upgraded to a suite with a lovely terrace which would be great in summer. The sitting area was comfy and the little bottles of fresh milk delivered in the morning were a nice touch. The Salt Bar is buzzing with gorgeous cocktails. We ate in Samphire on the first evening which was excellent. Breakfast on both mornings had good choices and the overnight oats are a must. Ten out of ten!

=== Perfect Find ===
We could not fault a thing ! The staff were all excellent and very welcoming. The rooms were delightful with every amenity. 
The food was all great and the cocktails perfect . We will definitely be back in the summer and enjoy some of the beautiful walks etc in this delightful area .

=== A real diamond of a hotel ===
This is an exceptional hotel.
With new owners and an amazing refurbishment this is a gem of a hotel.
Firstly the staff lead by Lisa are the nicest team ever. Nothing is too much trouble. Jack runs a really great bar with some wonderful cocktails. 
We had two meals in the bar and they were excellent shred platers.the piece de resistance was the restaurant. The Lobster was huge and so fresh. I had the sirloin steak. So tender it was like fillet.I am very fussy however it was perfectly cooked.

Niamh who also looked after us in the bar and for breakfast was so attentive, remembering my wife’s special allergies as well as our favourites.
The room had great views of the river Lym and the yachts. The bed and pillows were so good we slept well. 
They do not leave long life milk but deliver a small sealed bottle of cold fresh milk at 6 every morning. 

The decor is beautiful and very tasteful .Elegant.

Thank you Lisaand the team for making our stay outstanding.

=== Sunday Lunch ===
Our grandaughter bought us  a monetary voucher (for a cream tea, I think. This is her favourite!) We chose a Sunday lunch instead. The dining room was beautiful with the tables being well spaced with very comfortable chairs. The young staff were exceptionally polite without being gushing. (Chewton Glen quality). We chose our beverages and courses easily and I asked for my meal to be modified because of an intolerance. The trout starter was small but the quality of the trout was outstanding. A great introduction to the main course. The main courses were outstanding. As good as I have ever tasted. The beef was rare, just as I had requested and more than that, it tasted like beef of my childhood. It was delicious! The whole carrots were just cooked (correct) with a light butter glaze as were the parsnips. I chose not to have roast potatoes and Yorkshire but my husband had plenty and he reported that the Yorkshire actually tasted 'home made' All of this was accompanied by fresh cabbage and cauliflower cheese. Even the gravy was full of taste. My husband's plate was groaning with well cooked food and even he had a little trouble 'putting it away' and definitely required a brisk walk after. I did notice that all the diners around the dining room cleared their plates with alacrity. The service was discrete but excellent. We came out vowing to make a point of going there for the occasional Sunday Lunch again. (Mains, roast beef from £19) We do pop in for coffee and delicious homemade shortbread whenever we are in Lymington

=== The final bill ===
An excellent experience and delicious meal, but necessary to flag up two concerns as courteous feedback, intended to be of value. We explained at the point of booking and again on arrival, that we would be using a Christmas voucher.  We handed the voucher to the receptionist.  At no point did anyone suggest that we needed to use the full credit for that meal.  When the bill arrived, the calculation was £29 more than the correct amount.  The couple on the next table had the same experience.  The bill was returned corrected, but it was £19 below the value of the voucher.  We were then informed for the first time that we would lose this credit.  After a short discussion, having been told by our delightful, smiley waiter that 'it was management policy' we were given two choices. Either pay the full bill ourselves or lose the £19.  We chose to pay and were told that we could return at any time to use the full amount on the voucher.
Obviously, it was a disappointing end to a lovely birthday treat from our family.  During covid there had been another difficulty with a voucher which was about to run out because the hotel had been closed for a long period.  The young Polish lady on that occasion was very reluctant to extend the date.  That was a while ago and the new staff are all absolutely delightful and most helpful. We do hope that it will  be third time lucky!!

=== Exceptional Sunday! ===
We visited Stanwell House for Sunday lunch and whilst our friends are frequent visitors this was our first time since the refurbishment.  We found the whole experience to be exceptional.  The roast beef lunch was amazing, perfectly cooked vegetables, fluffy roast potatoes and tender sirloin.  Even the Yorkshire pudding was edible, something that is difficult to find in a hotel setting, in fact I would go as far as to say we couldn't have done better.  The staff members of duty were professional and friendly.  I can highly recommend the experience and it offers excellent value too.

=== Lovely stay ===
A brilliant hotel, very spacious rooms with every detail thought of. Good staff who were always there as well as being knowledgeable about the local area and things to note. 

A shame the car park is small and people park inconsiderately. 

Will definitely be back

=== Couldn’t recommend more! ===
I booked a room at Stanwell House for 1 night as a surprise for my partner for his birthday. I couldn’t have chosen better. Every single staff member was so welcoming and friendly it really made a difference. We were lucky enough to be upgraded to the most beautiful room. The room was spotless on arrival and had the most beautiful bath. The breakfast was amazing too. I couldn’t recommend more and will definitely be back!

=== Afternoon tea in the orangery ===
We booked for an afternoon tea for 3 adults between Christmas and New Year as a treat.  We were delighted by the experience. The orangery is a lovely space, comfortable and stylish.  It was a lovely day so being able to gaze up through the glass ceiling at blue skies was wonderful. Staff were attentive and friendly and went out of their way to accommodate requests.  The tea was excellent quality (food and beverages).  We opted for the champagne upgrade and were not disappointed by the quality.  We definitely hope to return.

=== The beautifully refurbished Stanwell! ===
My girlfriend and I enjoyed a wonderfully romantic stay at the Stanwell right in the heart of Lymington. The hotel has recently been refurbished to a very high standard. The staff were all very helpful and attentive. We enjoyed an evening drink and breakfast in the hotel which were both well presented and served. We stayed in the garden room which was beautifully appointed. We were even called an hour before our check in time to be told our room was ready, a really nice touch.

=== Christmas Day Lunch ===
Our first visit since Stanwell's reopened under new ownership. Beautifully decorated. On arrival we were greated by the reception team, it would have been better if there was a reception desk in the entrance and not in the conservatory were drinks were also being served. A bit chaotic with booking in, being given a drink, waiting around for someone to show us to our table and trying to find somewhere to sit to enjoy our drink.
Once seated I noted how low the seating was, thankfully there was a cushion to sit on, if you're short you might struggle.
We had a tasty array of nibbles to start with, were presented with the wine list and it did take some time for wine to arrive. Our pre-ordered starter arrived and it was very tasty and beautifully presented. We opted for the duck cooked three ways. I chose the monk fish for the main and I'm glad I did. Light and served with a sauce that was a bit rich but tasty in all. My partner opted for traditional turkey and he was pleasently surprised by the portion size (needless to say we ended up bringing leftovers). Had the panna cotta to finish with and despite it being light I was sated and couldn't manage to finish it. Sadly we were too full for coffee.
All in all we did enjoy it and we're glad it didn't last for hours. Christmas meals under previous owners have seen us trying to leave after five hours.
Sadly lacking in disabled fascilities. I appreciate this is a listed building but arrangements could be made to accommodate.
Quite expensive at £95 a head but worth it as a treat.

=== This hotel is quite simply exceptional ===
Had a pre-arrival phone call a few days before arrival to check whether any additional needs were required. 

Arrived an hour early, but checked in and taken up to our room – now that’s service!

Room – overlooking the rear garden, beautifully decorated with comfortable lounge and spacious bedroom. Bed exceptionally comfortable. En-suite large with separate bath and walk-in rain shower.

Public rooms busy with great atmosphere and enjoyed a cup of Dorset brew and coffee.

Breakfast was leisurely, with good choice of continental [self-serve] and full English [table service]. Staff attentive and friendly.

Check out friendly and left with great memories of a restful birthday break.

Location – on the main high street and close to the old quay and harbour.

Car parking is limited, but the main car park is only £5 for 20 hours.  

This hotel is quite simply exceptional having recently been refurbished. Great service; friendly professional staff and nothing too much trouble.       

Highly recommend and look forward to another visit.

=== Wonderful romantic get away ===
Just spent a wonderful romantic couple of days at this delightful hotel.  Beautifully and tastefully decorated we stayed in a spacious suite, parking was a little tricky to find as we arrived on a dark winter’s evening but everything was perfect. From the welcoming professional staff to the delicious evening meal; a real treat

=== Fabulous! ===
Fabulous stay for 2 nights, staff couldn’t be more helpful on arrival and throughout our stay.

Room was very nice and stylish to say the least, very clean throughout too! Food was a 10/10 for breakfast and evening!

We will be back again for sure😊

=== CURIOUS  ===
Spurof moment decision to pop in for a coffee to see what it was like. Stayed for light lunch... Sandwich n fries.. More than light!!! Excellent...... Staff very polite and attentive. Will be back for main lunch or dinner or both...

=== Perfect ===
We had a little drink in the Saltbar.  Oliver and his team were so welcoming and the Prosecco and seafood sharing platter were the perfect way to spend a Saturday afternoon. Arrive was fab,  Thank you .  It was so lovely and such a lovely place to sit for a while x

=== My fantastic stay at Stanwell House Lymington  ===
First time staying at the Stanwell House Hotel in Lymington and will certainly not be my last. 
Had a wonderful time with staff, food and room all first class. 
I understand it has recently had some upgrades done which were clearly evident throughout. 
Decor, bedroom and even the en-suite were first class. 
Highly recommend to everyone if looking for beautiful rooms and excellent food in the Lymington area. 
Keep up the great work.

=== Exceptional staff and beautiful rooms. ===
Just home from a night at Stanwell Hotel to celebrate our 25th Wedding Anniversary.  It was fabulous in every way.  Our room (luxury) was stunning - one of the nicest we've ever stayed in, the communal areas were beautifully decorated and the food in the restaurant was tasty and well priced.  However, the jewel in this hotels crown is it staff.  Everyone went above and beyond and I must mention Spencer who is a superstar.  We only live a few miles away in a neighbouring village, but we are already looking at a date to return.

=== Outstanding ===
We had the pleasure of staying at Stanwell House to celebrate my husbands 40th birthday. What a beautiful hotel. Elegant and contemporary in style. From the moment we checked in, we were greeted by a very welcoming member of staff at check in. We arrived early and were pleased to be told our room was ready. And what a room it was. We stayed in Room 29, a stunning room overlooking the lovely garden to the rear with its own private balcony. We booked in for dinner at the Samphire restaurant and were very much looking forward to a wonderful dining experience and we were not disappointed! We shared a mixture of ‘nibbles’ from the menu to start and we both went for the Venison saddle for our main. Absolutely amazing! And we made sure we saved room for dessert after reading so many positive reviews and we were so glad we did! My husband chose the Treacle Tart, his favourite dessert, and he absolutely loved it- best one he’s ever tasted apparently! I went for the warm chocolate cookie with salted caramel ice cream- just wow! My husband was then treated to an extra dessert as a surprise for his birthday, very thoughtful indeed. 
A special mention to the lovely member of staff that served us at dinner, Abbie,  who was very attentive throughout and who also gave us a complimentary bottle of wine as a Happy Birthday from the hotel. 
We couldn’t have asked for a better experience. Thank you to all staff at Stanwell House Hotel who made our stay so special. We highly recommend the Samphire restaurant and always make sure you save room for pudding!!

=== Perfect! ===
Gorgeous, romantic dinner with outstanding food and service!! Stanwell has the best ambience out of any restaurant I’ve ever been too and I cannot recommend enough! Can’t wait to come back again and again. The deep fried samphire, mussels and fish were each amazing x

=== My favourite hotel. ===
I love this hotel, my second visit and it won't be my last. The place immaculate with incredible attention to detail, staff a brilliant. Highly recommend to everyone. I only ate breakfast there, which was spot on.

=== Execellent Hotel & Staff ===
This is a lovely hotel in the centre of Lymington , immaculate conditions after a really nice refurb .

All the staff are so friendly and helpful , always with a warm smile - they make you feel so welcome .

We had a 2 night break and found the walks nearby great for a leg stretch in a wonderful seaside - Hurst castle walk along the spit will get your steps up .

The food was very tasty , we especially like the full english .

We did have an issue at dinner , but it was resolved with fuss and very quickly - I only mention it to say how well they dealt with it - brilliant 

We really did enjoy our short break at Stanwell and will definatley look to return .

Paul

=== Excellent food and service  ===
We celebrated our 32nd wedding anniversary at the Stanwell restaurant this evening and really enjoyed our evening. Service was warm and friendly, the restaurant is decorated in a traditional style which suits a town hotel/restaurant. We were not rushed (there was no 1.5hr limit on our table as in some places). We shared a selection of nibbles to start which were tasty, then had a main each which were delicious without being pretentious. Desserts were innovative and delightful, we shared two between us 😋. Altogether a pleasant experience - we’ll definitely eat here again on our next visit to Lymington.

=== Beautiful place and wonderful staff ===
Visited in September - a last minute booking as my plans had changed quite suddenly whilst on holiday. I had stayed in Lymington for a few nights - in another hotel - but had visited Stanwell House on all three evenings for pre and post dinner drinks. I used to come to Stanwell House all the time before it closed for a refurb as it was always friendly, good food, good acclimation and very dog friendly.
It was lovely to visit the new refurbished Hotel and I have to say it is beautifully done! The bar which my initial visits took me too is really nicely done out. A full range of drinks including cocktails etc and a nice relaxed atmosphere both at the start of the evening and end.
When my plans changed and I needed somewhere to stay for the night I immediately tried Stanwell House. The receptionist couldn’t have been more helpful and got me booked in quickly. I was quite late arriving as had to make my way back from the Isle of Wight and it was dark when I arrived. This on top of me being a bit flustered meant I couldn’t find the car park that she had explained to me. I called her from the car and she guided me in. She couldn’t have been nicer telling me not to worry and that she’d be waiting for me as would a stiff drink if it was needed - which it was!!!!!
I had my dog with me - so dog bed and suitcase in tow - the car park is the other side of the road to the hotel. Super easy once you get to it. The receptionist (sorry should have got her name) greeted me and quickly checked me in, took my case to my room and was just so sweet to me as I was having a stressful time!!!!
The room was beautiful and as soon as I got in there all my worries drifted away!!! Beautiful decor and the bed was so comfy!!!! Dog treats were also supplied as well as a bowl and I think there would have been a bed if I hadn’t brought my dogs own one with us. 
After a quick freshen up I headed back to get something to eat. Sadly I was too late and the kitchen was closed. The receptionist was very apologetic but no one’s fault as I had arrived very late in the day. I headed to a local place to eat and came back for a nightcap in the bar. It’s just a nice place to sit and relax.
I slept really well and the bed was just lovely. The tea tray had some lovely treats too and a nice cuppa in bed in the morning was great!
Breakfast for me was in the orangery as I had the dog with me, which is fine, I don’t expect to be in a main restaurant with a dog. The orangery is lovely anyway. Lovely selection for breakfast, cooked, continental and even fish with a buffet spread of fruits, cheeses, meats. 
All in all I had a wonderful stay. My plans had changed and I found myself in quite a stressful situation but once in Stanwell House all of that disappeared. Can’t wait to come back and enjoy again but with the addition of an evening meal as the menu sounds delicious.
Special thanks to the receptionist who really did make all the difference, a very kind lady.
Highly recommend visiting and staying here.

=== A must dinner in hotel ===
Very beautiful surroundings. The room was allocated on ground because we brought our dog with us. Everyone was very friendly towards our mutt and she was impeccably well behaved. Our dinner was superb. The seafood platter shared with two was one of the nicest platter I had. Fish and chips was very good. Fresh haddock and delicious chips. And I don’t eat chips!!!!
The breakfast was equally good. A full English had delicious and beautifully fried bacons and everything on the plate were cooked with care , attention and love. Will definitely come back here when we visit lymington again.

=== Fabulous breakfast with wide selection ===
recommended by a friend to try and do we booked for a Sunday breakfast. Fab service from the moment we walked in. Great selection of continental- fruit, pastries, yoghurt, cereal, juices and of course tea and proper coffee. The hot menu was extensive, our waitress said if it’s on the menu we can prepare what you’d like. So we did. Full breakfast, 2 eggs royale and 1 eggs Benedict. Lovely, with 4 clear plates. Would thoroughly recommend and fir £16 per person very good value. 
The atmosphere, setting and decor make Stanwell House a new breakfast favourite for us and it’s the place we now head to when friends and family stay.

=== Lovely stop for a bit of lunch ===
My family and I live in Lymington and have always be meaning to try out the new Samphire restaurant at Stanwell House so we went for lunch on Friday afternoon. The decor in the restaurant is lovely, but the table was a little high for myself sat on the booth. 

We ordered three of the nibbles and shared them between us as a starter. The fried Samphire was delicious along with the lemon aioli. The humus and bread was nice, but the bread was very crunchy.

All of us enjoyed our main courses, the salmon in the sandwiches ordered was very generous. The steak was out of this world and the chicken burger was delicious too.

The pudding was nice too, the Panna Cotta was fresh and zingy. The treacle tart was nice, but needed a bit more refinement.

The staff were charming and the atmosphere was lovely. We will definitely visit again.

=== Outstanding in every way ===
We had such a fantastic dinner in the Samphire restaurant, that we came back for a second (and sadly last) night on our break. The decor is considered but cosy, the lighting ambient but bright enough on each table to see what is being eaten. The menu offers the best of the best local produce, the fish and seafood are particularly excellent. The wine is a well thought-out list to accompany faultless food, served by Spencer and the team, who made us feel so welcome. I would (and will) recommend Stanwell House to anyone and everyone who visits Lymington. Thank you for having us and we hope to visit again soon.

=== Lovely Lunch ===
Two of us met in their  Conservatory for lunch, as we used to before their refurb. It looked beautiful. We both chose three of their starters: fried samphire, popcorn mussels and padron peppers/hoummous. They were nicely presented and plenty for lunch. Service was friendly and efficient. We’ll be back.

=== Sleepless in Stanwell House ===
We've just returned from a two night stay at Stanwell House. We would not return due to significant issues with noise from the running of the hotel.

Positives - room was nicely decorated, with a comfortable bed and good quality linens. Hot and efficient shower. Standard of cleanliness in our room was very good. We ate at the Samphire restaurant for dinner on the first night and the food was good, as was the standard of service. Overall we found the staff team to be friendly and helpful. 

The Big Problem - Noise. We stayed in Room 26 (suite with balcony) and it very quickly became apparent that there was a significant noise issue caused by being directly above the kitchen. From approx 17:00 to 23:00 we could hear crashing of pans, extractor fans, glass washing equipment and a generally very high level of noise, directly underneath the bedroom. Some of the crashes and bangs were so loud that they made the room physically shake, and it was unrelenting. At approx 22:30 on the first night we called down to reception and asked when the noise would stop, expressed our concern and requested a call from the manager the following day. After a brief overnight interlude, the noise started again the nexr morning at 6:30am, waking us both.
