When we spoke to manager Lance, he suggested that the issue was that we are light sleepers - we are not, and one of us was wearing earplugs and still woke! We were offered a room move, however this was to the room of another couple who were being moved due to another noise issue from a neighbouring premises. Fortunately we had heard them discussing it at breakfast so declined. After negotiations, Lance eventually agreed to deduct £70 per night from the room rate having initially offered to deduct £40 per night. Considering we had paid over £300 per night this didn't feel particularly fair but by this time we were too weary to challenge any further. The following evening we were out but we were again woken at 6:30am on the second morning. The adjoining room also had an extremely loud extractor fan in the bathroom against bedroom wall which added to the sleep issues. I cannot accurately express how loud the kitchen was, and we are both city dwellers used to traffic noise etc. Just to be clear, this isn't at all a criticism of the hard working kitchen team, but about the layout and lack of insulation/understanding of how noise can travel. For a luxury boutique hotel, this place has some serious work to do on delivering a truly luxurious experience, which is a shame when the rooms and restaurant are really pleasant. We would strongly suggest that a member of hotel staff spends 24 hours staying in Room 26, to gain a full understanding of the extent of the kitchen noise.

=== Lovely boutique hotel in central location ===
Wonderful 2 nights at this centrally located boutique hotel.
We have stayed on a number of occasions and again enjoyed our experience .
Excellent bedrooms and beds/linen etc are fantastic. 
There’s a pleasant bar, separate coffee/lunch area, lovely terrace at the rear, south facing. The restaurant is excellent and breakfasts with a range of hot/cold menu. 
Staff are all attentive, kind, courteous and helpful. 
Car park is small, you’ll need to park with care but at least there is a carpark (!) as private parking in central Lymington is hard to find.
The hotel is a short walk from a number of restaurants and close to the marina and IoW ferry terminal. 
We have stayed in other hotels/B&B/AirBNB etc in the town and this is by far our favourite place.

=== Mike - the cocktail king! ===
Fantastic cocktails. Went there for a drink after dinner - shoutout to Mike. He made the most fantastic Old fashioned, and Long Island iced tea I’ve had in a long time. A true professional. Will be back!

=== A Gem of a Hotel ===
A really lovely gem of a hotel. Right in the heart of Lymington but with a feel that you have escaped the hustle and bustle of life. The hotel is beautifully decorated and the rooms are spotless with quality bedding and fluffy towels. The garden is just amazing, and with the nice weather we sat outside for breakfast and dinner enjoying the wonderful food. I would really recommend this hotel.

=== A Must Visit.  ===
Absolutely fabulous boutique hotel. Stunning interiors amazing restaurants and fabulous very long garden and patio, chairs and tables parasols galore. Staff are all wonderful. Our bedroom had been upgraded to the best one in the hotel!

=== Beautiful garden setting in Lymington ===
Such a pleasant place to call into on a beautiful summers day . There is a large ,beautifully kept garden at tge rear of hotel. We popped into the hotel for a quick cup of tea and toasted tea cake. I was vey impressed by the up market ambience and prettiness of the setting. Could not fail to notice that the rest of the hotel looks very smart and is tastefully decorated in a modern yet timeless style. Spot on .

=== Hotel with a can-do attitude ===
This is an old fashioned town centre  hotel which has been beautifully and thoughtfully modernised and refurbished to a very high standard.   The rooms are laid out on different levels, some of them quirkily shaped,  and all well furnished with luxurious bathrooms and very comfortable beds.   The Samphire restaurant has an excellent menu and the food is well cooked and presented.    But what gives Stanwell House its edge is the staff:   all young, enthusiastic, cheerful and with a refreshing can-do attitude.    We will certainly be checking in again.

=== Fantastic!! ===
Back again for a 3 night stay. We love this Hotel. The re-vamp is fantastic, and definitely worth the wait. Unbeknown to us we stayed in Brockenhurst a few weeks ago and ate at Albero. We said at the time that was our favourite Italian. Have since found out its got the same owners. Win! Win! Keep up the fantastic work! Thank you 👍 Martin & Lou Trusler 👍🙂

=== Dissatisfied ===
The hotel is beautiful with a glorious interior staff attentive excellent.
We visited for lunch v excited it’s a treat we have probably once a month and we always look for high standard cuisine and are happy to pay the price .
So it is with regret that I have to tell you that the food was to my taste very very average .
I ordered half a lobster grilled simple clean food it came however with a thick glutenous sauce plastered all over the lobster.  My husband ordered sea bass but that came with the same sauce all over it . We did try it we should have sent it back but i always want to give restaurants a chance . We did mention to staff they seemed nervous to approach the chef . The fries were soggy I think frozen .
What a shame I’ve spoken to several friends who also had negative experiences.

=== Excellent five ⭐️ ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ ===
Beautiful restaurant and bar we went twice in one day for bar meal then dinner , gorgeous building , fantastic cocktails the staff in the bar couldn’t do enough for you , special mention for Mickey who was so helpful nothing too much trouble would highly recommend this place and will definitely be going again 👍🥂

=== First time visit  ===
My family and I popped into Stanwell House for a quick lunch. It was a lovely day and we sat outside as we also had a little dog with us. The last time I was in Lymington, the establisment was closed for reconstruction. I have to say the reconstructions has been carried out very well. We were not disappointed. The food that I had was superb - smoked salmon sandwich with fresh salad. The portion was large!

=== Amazing anniversary! ===
Wow!!
What an amazing place! 
We had a family anniversary dinner in the beautiful private dining room - which was absolutely superb in every way. We were lucky enough to have Spencer as our private butler for the evening - incredible service from this lovely young man - he couldn’t have done more for us.

Everything was done beautifully-
I can honestly say I enjoyed every mouthful! 

Well done Stanwell house and thank you for making a very special occasion incredible!!

=== Great base for 4-night New Forest stay ===
Situated on the High Street, the hotel is a short walk from Lymington Town train station and the Quay. Lots of care has been taken over the decor and the staff were very professional. Our room was at the top of the house. Worth noting there are quite a few stairs to get there so those rooms may not suit everyone. The room (and en-suite bathroom) were nicely presented. No fridge in the room but you can choose to have milk delivered daily. The room was uncomfortably warm on the first night but the receptionist was quick to provide a fan the next day that made things much better. We had dinner in the Samphire restaurant. Three courses with wine made it a little on the pricey side but the food was good. We didn’t make use of the Orangery or Bar ourselves but these looked like great spaces that were popular throughout our stay.  We’d definitely consider a return visit in future.

=== Great Afternoon Tea Celebration.  ===
I recently went for afternoon tea to celebrate a birthday. It is excellent in every way  with great service and superb quality. I would recommend to everybody to visit. We sat outside in the courtyard and the recent investment has made it a perfect venue for every occasion.

=== Excellent place if slightly money grabbing ===
Had dinner here in their restaurant which really is excellent in terms of quality of food & friendly service. The scallops were truly wonderful and the pan fired turbot was amazing. We had a great bottle of Montrachet. All in all superb. Only 4 stars because it feels really mean to charge for the tap water because its filtered and also for the bread…really when we are paying so much already?

=== Could not fault the food and service ===
Had a family meal here as local residents in the Samphire area. From start to finish we could not fault the food or service. We were attended by Spencer who was excellent. I had the Pea and Ham Risotto and then the Lobster Macaroni, both were generous portions. Cannot wait until my next visit, how about a locals loyalty scheme.

=== Beautiful Restaurant & highly recommended menu and food ===
Used only the Restaurant, but twice in a month. Loved it so much and the Restaurant setting inside and out is outstanding. That also applies to the food. The menu is very comprehensive and vert reasonable in price. I am not really a burger person but I tried the aged brisket and bone marrow (?) burger. Just incredible and the BEST burger I have ever tasted.

=== Jewel in the Crown of Lymington. ===
Wonderful visit to this glorious Hotel, Great service from booking - arrival - room - food and service. 
The jewel in the crown of this Hotel - [besides the tasteful furnishing and decor] is the staff - caring, attentive and so helpful
Special thanks to Emily on reception and Spencer in the Restaurants [there are great selections in all three] 
Lovely outside space to enjoy a glass of something fizzy, or simply read a good book.
Well located for browsing around the high street shops, some quirky and individual. Short walk to the historic quayside. Nearby to The New Forest 
Full marks to a hotel that has got to grips with what visitors need. 
Bravo

=== Poor customer service with misleading information  ===
We booked a room overlooking the garden with a king size bed. Our window overlooked a huge awning which completely blocked the view of the garden. The bed was a double but definitely not king size. We complained at the time and was advised by the general manager that the issue of the view would be addressed when we checked out. We hadn’t slept in the bed at that point. The matter was ignored when we checked out probably as we had already paid in full prior to arriving. I emailed twice regarding the issues before I received a response which denied we had a garden view stating it did overlook the garden and said they do not have smaller beds so ours was a king size which made no sense at all. Our bed definitely was not 6’ wide which a king size bed should be. Customer satisfaction clearly is not important to the management and their website is definitely misleading

=== Great Hotel, bar and Restaurant with even better staff. ===
Having been recently refurbished please ignore any reviews upto 2022. Stanwell House is a great hotel, beautifully appointed with great quality food and drinks but even those do not compare with the quality and attitude of every single member of staff. We spent 2 nights at Stanwell House for my wifes birthday and it could not have been better. Go!

=== Disappointing  ===
Very disappointed. We ordered the seafood sharing platter. What a let down compared  to the last time we ordered the same dish in May. Totally put off ordering that again. Wasn’t comfortable where we were sat, too close to other tables so much so that we couldn’t talk because we were over powered by the conversation on the table next to us! Bar is small with slow service. Lots of staff wandering around!!!

=== Superb staff, food, and atmosphere.  ===
Four of us arrived at the Hotel at 8:15pm, desperate to find somewhere nice to eat, after being badly let down by a well-known quayside pub.
The Hotel restaurant & bar was packed, but after hearing our "tale of woe," Emily, who was in charge of reception, found us a table. She went to a lot of trouble to make us feel welcome, as did our waiter, Mike. We had a fabulous meal and a memorable evening. Can't recommend this place enough. Thank you so much. We will be back!

=== Disappointing stay ===
Disappointing stay. We had stayed here before its updating and thought the staff were superb, they still are, but that is all that was good about stay. We had specified a ground floor room with a walk in shower for my husband who has walking problems but on arrival found the room had an over bath shower.  We had planned to have next door rooms with my husbands brother as both rooms opened onto a courtyard.  We ended up having to have a first floor to get the walk in shower.  No towels in the room and the window only opened about 6inches.  There was air con but we could not find out how to work it.    The food was a disappointment too, expensive in the Samphire restaurant and although we were sat in the Orangery we were told we all (4 of us) had to order from the same menu i.e. if one person chose from the Samphire menu then we all had to.  The food was not, I feel, as good as the description or the price.   The bacon as part of the English breakfast was incinerated on both mornings and we had to send the toast back to get it toasted, instead of just limp.   The car park is close (250m) on the other side of the road but no porterage so I had to carry luggage myself.

=== Fabulous birthday weekend celebration!  ===
I had a fabulous birthday weekend celebrating in Lymington staying at Stanwell House Hotel.   The food, service and ambience was just perfect.  Thank you to everyone who made it such a special weekend during our stay.

=== Fabulous! ===
Amazing customer service, food and surroundings, a memorable experience for all the right reasons, an absolutely perfect afternnon tea. Gorgeous decor and  nothing to fault at all we will be back, and soon!!!!

=== Fantastic ===
'We enjoyed a lovely early evening Birthday meal at Stanwells. We were made very welcome, the advanced ordering idea worked perfectly, the food was delicious and the venue light, airy and very comfortable. All of the staff from front desk to waiters to chefs did a great job for us and allowed us to enjoy a very happy birthday dinner. We shall return I'm sure. Thanks Stanwell's !

=== A wonderful two night break in delightful surroundings. ===
The decor is so tasteful, relaxing and pretty, after the recent refurbishment and we couldn’t fault the hotel in any way.  The staff were totally charming, and attentive, without being overbearing, and nothing was too much trouble.   The garden area is peaceful and comfortable and the fact that the large bifold doors opened onto the garden from the restaurant was a bonus.  The food was of good quality and well presented, with a choice of menus.
The hotel is central to all that lymington offers, and has the advantage of a private car park nearby.

=== Excellent customer service in restaurant ===
Went for lunch in the garden patio and the staff led by Mike were excellent, attentive and very friendly.  This included Ben and Matt.
Local crab open sandwich was delicious.
Seating was open and comfortable.

=== Great stay ===
We had a lovely bank holiday weekend. 
The Breakfast was very good with a wide choice of continental and cooked breakfasts to choose from. The bar staff Mike and his college sorry can’t remember his name were very welcoming and professional. Ben who served us at breakfast was also excellent. 
I would highly recommend.

=== Outstanding cocktails ===
We came for my wife's birthday as we are local and always enjoy our visits. Unbelievable service from Mike, incredible cocktails - especially the chocolate orange martini - yum.  A really beautiful venue. Love it and would recommend to all! ❤️

=== Great Lunch ===
Stopped for Sunday lunch at the Stanwell.
Staff were fantastic, friendly and engaging.
Lunch was lovely and very well priced !!
The Lemon Collins delightful !!
Was very impressed with the deco, had a great afternoon.
Thank you

=== Delicious afternoon tea, lovely surroundings and excellent customer service - recommend! ===
Went her for afternoon tea to celebrate my friend’s Mum’s birthday and it was wonderful. 

We had a delicious assortment in our afternoon tea - and I’ve been to my fair share of them over the years! We were seated in lovely surroundings, there was a nice atmosphere, and we experienced excellent customer service.  

Highly recommend!

===  Excellent 1 night stay ===
We enjoyed an excellent one night stay. This is a beautiful hotel. We loved the decor.
The staff provided excellent service and the central location (with parking) was perfect.
The room was well equipped & spotless.
We really enjoyed the breakfast.

Highly recommended.

=== Such a fabulous hotel! ===
We (6 of us) spent two nights at this beautiful hotel. 

It was superb in every respect. Simply gorgeous decor throughout. Wonderfully appointed bedrooms - very thoughtfully designed to a very high standard.

Charming staff throughout the hotel. 

We had an excellent evening meal on Thursday evening in the Salt Bar. Great cocktails too! Excellent freshly cooked breakfasts. 

We really could not recommend this hotel enough.

=== Mediocre - over hyped as a "fine dining experience"  ===
A disappointing lunch. 
We shared the lobster macaroni and then the duck egg tart for dessert.  
The macaroni and the lobster in it were both slightly overcooked.  The dessert was quite nice.    The sauvignon blanc by the glass had seen better days.  
Service was not ideal.   Accidents happen and one glass of wine was spilt.  fortunately the wine went onto the adjacent table and missed our party.  There were profuse apologies.
We arrived at 1230 but made a point of saying the we had to be out by 1420 - one of our party had to get the 1500 ferry back to Yarmouth.  But it took a long time for our main course to be cleared and so our dessert didn't arrive until 1415.  We asked for the bill as soon as we ordered dessert but whilst paying a duty manager interrupted our waitress in the middle of taking payment and would have delayed matters if I hadn't been quite blunt.  
There are a lot of steps in the hotel and not all of them have handrails to hold onto - we all had disabilities of one form or another.  There was no warning.  
I found the bench seats to be quite uncomfortable. 
Shame - we won't rush to go back.

=== Best hotel in Lymington ===
Awesome hotel…..the decor is just magnificent and the staff all so very friendly and helpful. The rooms are amazing and beds so comfortable. I was asked if I thought anything they could do to improve the hotel and my answer was you can’t improve perfection.

=== Amazing hotel  ===
We stayed for the Kings coronation weekend also celebrating my birthday, what an amazing hotel very clean, staff were absolutely brilliant they can’t do enough for you and so good with our dog Diesel. We loved our stay that much we re-booked for New Year’s Eve stay. Can’t wait to come back

=== Horrendous experience ===
Absolutely awful customer service. Promised a refund by manager (Damien) when there was a misunderstanding with room. We were then left stranded in a place we didn’t know with a young baby. 

On calling back after noticing no refund the manager Amelie was extremely patronising and rude on the phone and refused to take anything we were saying into account. Even though it had already been agreed that a refund would be taking place with another manager! Avoid at all cost.

=== Perfect ===
First time to this hotel and we were not disappointed. Our room was beautiful and tastefully decorated. We ate in the bar as the menu suited me better, and we enjoyed the food very much.
The biggest asset to this hotel,however, is the staff. All of them.  They were polite efficient and so helpful. I would highly recommend this hotel and will return.

=== Lovely stay ===
Booked a room and dinner for a night for my birthday. 

The hotel is very nicely decorated and is welcoming. Emily on reception was brilliant, really friendly and chatty. 

We had dinner and cocktails in the bar (because we had our dog with us) and food and service was excellent. We had dinner and a desert. 

The room was lovely, comfortable bed and spacious. As mentioned, we had our dog with us and there was a bed and treats in the room for her which was a lovely touch. 

Slight issues with the room, it was boiling hot in there! When we checked in, we turned off the radiators but it was still incredibly warm. And then at 4am there was a loud ticking noise, which I discovered was related to the bathroom radiator. I turned the radiator off and it stopped. 

Breakfast was included and there was a lot of choice. Service was a little slow, but still friendly and welcoming.

=== Unhygienic ===
Arrived with friends for afternoon tea,whilst we understood dogs are allowed,we were very disappointed to see a number of dogs sitting on the fabric seats in the afternoon tea area, Very unhygienic,not to mention one of our parties coat was covered in dog hair. Please keep dogs on floor level. We will not return

=== A Very Comfortable Boutique Hotel ===
This Hotel has apparently re-opened recently after a £4m make-over. The accommodation is fresh and very well appointed, The Service in the bars and the restaurant was first class and very welcoming - it was obvious that the Management are devoting time and attention to proper training and team building.
The Restaurant menu was adventurous and wide ranging with plenty of local fish and many other New Forest produce.  This place will be heavily subscribed once the Summer Season gets underway !

=== Beautiful Boutique Hotel, Restaurant and Bar ===
1st visit to Stanwell today, a warm friendly professional welcome and a little tour of their beautiful business. The decor is amazing and lots of quirky corners to explore and the team are very friendly and attentive and I would highly recommended.

=== A wonderful stay in the heart of Lymington  ===
We stayed here last weekend with a group of friends and had a wonderful experience from start to finish. The staff who greeted us were warm and friendly, and we were very impressed with our room which was spacious, beautifully furnished and spotlessly clean, with a large bathroom. The decor of the hotel is stunning throughout, and we enjoyed a delicious breakfast the next morning. Staff were obviously busy but were all very accommodating to our group. Next time I would request a room with a courtyard view as it was quite noisy facing the high street. The hotel is in a great location in the heart of Lymington with free parking for guests close by. I wouldn’t hesitate to stay here again and have already recommended to others!

=== Excellent service in beautifully refurbished hotel ===
We stayed for 3 nights and thoroughly enjoyed it. Comfortable rooms, nice bathrooms and great decor, with everything looking new. The service was superb. Everyone was attentive and polite whether it was at reception, in the restaurant or out in the terrace/courtyard/garden. We had specified dietary requirements and they bent-over backwards to accommodate us. (Thank you, chef). Nothing was too much. The service was excellent at all times.
The vodka martini was the best ever. 
There’s parking nearby, but it is limited.
Don’t expect slippers and a dressing gown.
The rooms have tea/coffee making sets, tv and a digital radio.
The place is very well managed with a great team.

=== Superb cocktail ===
Best margarita ever thanks to Mike 
I don’t give praise lightly all too often cocktails are sweet syrupy wannabes of the real thing and a decent margarita outside of a proper cocktail bar is often hard to find so I am delighted to find someone locally to #lymington who knows his stuff 
10 out of 10 to Mike,

=== Nice but slow  ===
We came here to celebrate a friends birthday. The food was good when it arrived, unfortunately the side dishes arrived after we finished our main meal. The issue seemed to be staff shortage. The ambiance was nice.

=== Inadequate room ===
Beautiful old building in the High st that we understand was recently refurbished.

Staff are professional and engaging.

The problem we had was that the water temperature in the room was dangerously hot; both of us were scalded by the separate hot tap which, by the way, rotated in a clockwise direction to turn it on. Most unusual. This is an accident waiting to happen! 

In general, the room was small, but the spaces in the bathroom were worse and did not permit comfortable use of the facilities by anyone with wide shoulders.

Milk delivery at the door was nice, but a fridge would have been better. Of course, there is no room for one! Even 2 roll on suitcases were a struggle to accommodate.

We can’t return because at the £175 price point, without breakfast, a fully functional room is mandatory.

=== Nightmare ===
A celebration lunch with 2 x nonagenarians was a huge disappointment, no welcome to the hotel, no staff seemed to acknowledge our booking. After a very long wait we were served really poor meals, the so called triple cooked chips were soggy but the fish was undercooked with extremely thick tasteless batter, the fish pie was not a pie and had a very thin layer of orange coloured potatoes on top. When we eventually found a member of staff to complain to they just suggested they would not add the service charge, not a good solution. The puddings were lovely but no cutlery was provided and coffee arrived before them. 
There were a catalogue of errors which I could mention but feel so cheated by this appalling occasion I wish to forget the whole very expensive nightmare. 
Definitely will not be returning.

=== Lovely friendly expereince. ===
Had one night stay there on Saturday evening (25th) with my husband.  The staff were so professional and friendly, nothing was too much bother.  Fantastic dinner in the Bistrol breakfast.  Would highly recommend.

=== Most dissapointing dinner ===
Most dissapointing dinner.
Decor very smart.
Waiting staff very professional.
Menu very limited both for starters and main course.
My wife had trout for starters, trout was OK but attachments dissapointing.
She had sea bass for main course but said portion too small and add on unedible.
My beef Ravioli was poor and difficult to find beef. Belly of pork v poor.
Best part was side dish chips.
We complained and spoke to restraunt manager.
Her offer was to remove service charge from Bill. We pointed out she was punishing the staff for quality of food. Her response they like to get feed back and kitchen staff would also suffer.
What a way to treat your staff when they were no culpable.
Restraunt manager was most unimpressive impressive.
There was an extremely noisy table behind us and we could hardly hear ourselves.
All in all  a very dissapointing visit to a beautifully refurbished hotel.
Will not be rushing back.

=== Simply superb ! ===
Lunch at Samphire was truly delicious ….we shared as a starter the Smoked Trout Ceaser Salad which was exceptional, delicious smoked trout fillets with Smokey blackened baby gem lettuce and truly delicious dressing …. Really good…

Mains were the lobster macaroni and half lobster . Both were divine .  

So lovely to be in the restaurant and  delight in the interiors but the real stars of the show were the staff!  Sam, Lily and William, Bogden. you are a credit to the hotel ! Thank you !!!!

=== Well deserved praise ===
Well done Stanwell HR department for creating bar staff with personality and ability, a very rare find in Lymington. Consistently attentive staff ensure the Stanwell bar becomes the go to place. Refurbishment has transformed the Hotel.

=== Excellent Samphire restaurant ===
Review of Samphire Restaurant. We booked at the restaurant for my partner's 70th birthday. Amazing decor - warm, vibrant yet cosy! The staff were very welcoming and helpful. We were tempted by the tasting menu but eventually decide to eat from the à la carte. Excellent red shrimp risotto to start and I thoroughly enjoyed the gurnard (delicious sauce), with a side of some of the best chips I've had! My friend's asparagus starter and half-lobster were equally good. A good wine list, with the wines well-kept. A lovely evening and we shall return when next staying in the area.

=== Lovely break ===
The hotel has had a major refurb and has been beautifully done.  The staff are outstanding.  In particular Emily in the reception team for whom nothing was too much trouble.  Also speaking to Marie and Maria on the phone who were very warm and cheerful.  So a great first impression.  In the restaurant Tiger was very attentive, professional and great team member.
Room 16 is very good with a larger bed than the standard rooms and separate sitting room with roof window.  The bedroom has a view across the garden with glimpses of the sea in the distance.

=== Ticks all the boxes ===
Decor, service and quality food. Very comfortable bed. Shout out for Spencer who looked after us dinner and breakfast, proffessional and knowledgeable service. Food is competively priced and the quality is clear to see. Cocktails and service in the bar was also excellent. Memorable stay. We will return. Many thanks

=== Saturday evening ===
Excellent  food  in salt bar. Mike the bar manager looked after us very well, assisted by the the lovely Tiger. All in all a great evening, relaxed atmosphere,  and we will be back for sure although not quite local we would go out of our way to visit.

=== Sunday lunch for 10 ===
The food was not cold but luke warm as we're the plates,the roast beef was rare to the extreme,blood running on plate,the selection of veg was poor for the cost,and the sweet selection limited,the caramelised walnut tart was unable to be broken with out really digging in with the cutlery,we had such high hopes but left disappointed,the decor is lovely,but the food poor and not worth the price point,we won't be visiting again

=== Josephine ===
We had a fabulous time on our recent visit .
The staff in particular the bar manager were brilliant . 
He was very friendly and attentive and although very busy made us feel special. 
The food , fantastic cocktails and overall atmosphere in the bar area make it a lovely place to spend an evening . 
We will be telling all our friends and returning as soon as possible .

=== Style over substance ===
I left this hotel slightly confused. Confused as to what had I actually just experienced. 

Looking at the surroundings, I don’t think this hotel knows what it is. Is it a pub? A bar? A bistro? An afternoon tea hall? A fine dining restaurant? The answer is it’s trying to be all of these things but not quite pulling off any of them. 

The food was disappointing. A seafood platter that was not presented well (it was all plonked on the plate), where everything was creamy or full of mayo. Good fish does not need creamy sauces. A very over cooked turbot with chewy pancetta with two carrots placed next to it, red mullet that was served with a quite pleasant salty coquette but a very sweet sauce. All served lukewarm and in small portions. The service was SLOW. Our server was very pleasant but she was the only one who showed any interest and was left to manage the room by herself. Most people in the restaurant looked as disappointed as we felt. 

May I suggest you move the afternoon teas into the lovely Samphire room, keep the food for the Salt bar only and use the rest of the space for cocktails. I think then this place could stop all the confusion and the flow would benefit all.

=== Lovely Lunch in the Salt Bar ===
I met a friend here for lunch - the first time since their refurbishment. The hotel looked beautiful with lovely new  decor. We had a simple lunch in the Salt Bar, Beetroot Soup and Chicken and Sweetcorn Croquettes. Service was excellent. We’ll be back …

=== Relaxing escape ===
We have been a fan of this hotel for years.  This was our first visit since the hotel was completely refurbished.  We love what they have done to the hotel itself and the team that run it are just brilliant.  Super friendly but very professional. We had coffee and cake in the Orangery and dinner in the Salt Bar. Both were just wonderful. Our room overlooked the rear garden and was luxurious and spotless. 

The location of the hotel is just perfect for us. Very central right on the High Street with a car park just across the road.  We will certainly be back and next time will stay a little longer.

=== Visit after refurbishment ===
Very nice boutique hotel in the lovely town of Lymington. Had a walk down to the marina in the morning - only 5 mins away. Our meal for 12 people was fabulous - far better than Limewood (that we have basically stopped going to because of poor food quality). Staff were attentive and interested in what they were doing.
My only dislike -  our bedroom had one of those interconnecting doors to the room next door and no matter how well you design the doors noise travels between rooms !

=== Monday birthday meal ===
So pleased to revisit this hotel after its revamp
Really impressed with ambience and decor
Buzzing bar for Monday early evening and fabulous meal
Staff attentive and professional 
Cannot wait to go again

=== A lovely afternoon well spent at Stanwell House ===
I thoroughly enjoyed my lunch at Stanwell House, the atmosphere was very relaxed, the staff really lovely and the food was SO good. I would highly recommend this beautiful place in a perfect spot of Lymington.

=== Birthday afternoon tea ===
Visited Stanwell House for the first time for a birthday afternoon tea and couldn’t be more impressed. The food was superb, great atmosphere and staff were not only friendly but extremely attentive, we finished our tea and made our way through to the bar area for birthday cocktails where we were looked after by the bar manager Mike, who was not only friendly and helpful but really went above and beyond to make sure our visit was great! Couldn’t recommend enough and will definitely be returning.

=== Beautiful dinner followed with fabulous service ===
Beautiful dinner and fabulous service, we ate at Stanwells as a family of 6 from the moment we walked in we were made to feel welcome. The conservatory was beautifully decorated which made the perfect spot for a pre dinner drink, we then made way into the Samphire restaurant where Sam Coad was looking after us I have to say as someone that works in the industry she was absolutely amazing. The food was the best I’ve had in a very long time I had the sirloin which I’m amazed wasn’t Filet it’s was so tender and just a beautiful dish, I think as all 6 of us had the caramel fondant for desert it was a clear winner. We then made way into the bar where we had Michael looking after us, he has the most amazing personality followed by the most amazing and creative cocktails. 
Thank you once again for the most special of evenings.

=== A warm comfortable restaurant serving great food and cocktails ===
From the time we stepped in to
The hotel until the time we left we were treated with such professionalism and courtesy, Samantha and her team couldn’t do enough for us! We had arranged to eat in the restaurant but changed our minds and chose the salt bar instead they went out of their way to accommodate us. 
Unfortunately whilst we were there   Eating a fantastic meal, a alcoholic man decided that he wanted to come in to the restaurant and basically create a a bit of nuisance of himself! Although this chap attended with a foul mouth Samantha managed in the most calm and collective way ejected him from the restaurant with minimal fuss to other diners and eventually with some active encouragement ejected this foul mouth person from the bar. She apologies about his behaviour to all
The diners, (although this was not the fault of the hotel) and we carried on with our meal. The food that was served was fantastic the chefs surly use their full potential, and the waiter Ben was charming attentive and a pleasure to chat too! 
This is such a welcoming relaxing place too be. If your local go of your just passing through go! You won’t be disappointed! Thank you Ben, Samantha and the team!

=== What a wonderful break! ===
We stayed for a couple nights and we have been so impressed by the customer service from the moment we arrived. All of the staff are so incredibly friendly and helpful. In particular Sharon and Mike went above and beyond. We have had a fabulous stay and will be returning again - we highly recommend it. As for the interior - it is absolutely stunning! Food is delicious too - particularly the breakfasts and the chicken Kiev! We've had the most wonderful stay.

=== A fine addition to Lymingtons choice of restaurants. ===
Only been open since December after a full refurbishment, but the Samphire Restaurant was full.
And with a beautiful dining room, lovely service, and quality cooking of choice ingredients it will remain busy….you better book for a weekend table. 

Our choices of the starters were shrimp risotto and venison carpaccio; both excellent. We had hoped for the fish of the day to be special but as it was lemon sole we opted for the turbot; nice fish, but served with underwhelming potatoes and carrots…a shame. 
The cheese selection was delicious and with a good red wine memorable. 

We will certainly return; and can’t wait for the warmer days when dining on the patio area will be such a treat.

=== Amazing hotel! ===
This gem of a hotel did not diss appoint. Every detail of the decor was stunning and flawless. The room was well equipped and so clean and comfortable. The food was amazing and service great despite being so busy. Can’t wait to return as soon as we can!

=== Stunning Stanwell House,  what a gem for Lymington. ===
Our first visit since refurbishment.  Wonderful, beautifully upgraded.
Superb Sunday lunch.
So relaxed but first class service.
 Even our dog was welcome (in certain areas). 
Can't wait to visit again.

=== Excellent meal  ===
Was in for a wonderful meal with colleagues just before Christmas 
Excellent service and food outstanding 
Very attentive and courteous staff who could not do enough for us
Hotel absolutely amazing and looking forward to my next visit when back in the area

=== A bit disappointing ===
Went in for catch up drinks and went to the Salt bar. Going into the bar I was informed it was table service. Ordered a bottle of wine, just over an hour later said bottle was finished. Noone had to check in to see if I wanted anything else, so I went to the bar to pay my bill. It would've been very easy to walk out without paying. Great atmosphere/ decor but service is a tad lacking for a 'table service ' bar .

=== Disappointingly ignored for service ===
We called in the bar hoping for a pleasant drink and were  it was informed table service, so sat down and waited - and waited. 
We became invisible as staff rushed in and out through the bar area ignoring us. After 20 minutes we gave up and left.  
Very disappointing for a venue that looked well kept and welcoming - only to be let down in such a way.

=== Great atmosphere in dog friendly bar & conservatory ===
Great service at the bar and in the conservatory. We went to have a £7 coffee and cake in the conservatory on Friday. Very dog friendly waiter,nice back ground music, lovely decor in both the conservatory and bar. The bar was buzzing with a great atmosphere even at 5pm. So we went there again on Saturday afternoon and was really pleased with service. They produced a dairy free and gluten free cake for one of our friends which is very good. Very recommended as a place to visit, it’s great it’s dog friendly.

=== Simply Outstanding ===
Visited New Years Eve to The Salt Bar, amazing atmosphere, buzzy and service outstanding. Popped by for lunch as a solo today for quick bite and the burger was out of this world. And again super service and busy, nice atmosphere.  Will be spending lots of time here over the spring / summer! Special mention for Mike (bar manager) clearly loves his role and is outstanding at his job. Top hotel to rival The Pigs and Limewoods of the world!

=== A Welcome Return ===
A welcome return to this hotel after it reopened in Dec 2022. We stayed mid-week for 1 night in an upstairs, comfortable, quiet, newly furnished room overlooking the garden and terrace. The hotel has undergone a high quality comprehensive renovation and upgrade including IT systems yet maintained its classic character and charm. Just the conference room and terraced garden are in the final stages of completion. Many of the original staff like Emily in reception have returned and were enthusiastic about the changes. The central glass roofed central atrium was clearly popular as a place to meet and socialize throughout the day. With soft lighting, the airy dining room has glass doors that open on to the garden terrace. Given a choice, this area would be our preferred area to sit. During our stay, the dining staff were always attentive and courteous, but Samantha deserves a special mention. The menu was both interesting and tempting such that our 3 course meal which included scallops, venison, chicken and a shared dessert did not disappoint. The food was delicious, attractively plated, discreetly served and complemented by a glass or two of Sangiovese. We look forward to our next visit.

=== early evening cocktails ===
after a long late lunch nearby we came across this place while driving up the high street and parked outside for drinks in the bar which were enjoyed in very stylish surroundings with friendly attentive staff and great cocktails

=== Wonderful environment after the  invested refurbishment ===
A lovely bright restaurant, newly decorated and furnished.  Staff friendly and efficient without being imposing.
Choice of food for breakfast on New Year’s  Day both on the buffet and hot food menu was very comprehensive and ALL very good.

We are local residents, therefore unable to comment on accommodation.
This review does not give the opportunity to score the restaurant or Orangerie which are both excellent.

=== Fabulous Boxing Day Lunch ===
Following the lengthy modernisation of the hotel, restaurants and bars we decided to book for Boxing Day lunch. (3 persons). On arrival we were given the choice of dining in any of the 3 restaurants/bars……all of which looked very comfortable and inviting. We chose the Salt Bar, situated at the front of the hotel overlooking the High St of Lymington. 
The decor and furnishings are superb and we felt very comfortable. Menus and drinks were offered to us. “Mike”…….took time out to explain the menu and portion sizes and took our order. 
Service was impeccable and the food delicious. Catch of the Day was my wifes choice ( a whole sole) and it was beautifully cooked and presented. I chose the sea bass fillet which, again,  was delicious. 
The staff were fantastic. Eager to please but never overwhelming.
Overall our experience was absolutely fabulous and as residents of Lymington we are so pleased to have such an establishment on our doorstep.
A Boxing Day to remember.
Thanks to all at Stanwell House Hotel for making our visit such a pleasurable one.

=== Poor customer service ===
Called in for a drink in the afternoon and to check out menu for following day’s dinner. All looked promising. Called in just after 9.00 pm for a drink and we were made to feel very uncomfortable. We checked on last orders (10:30), so ordered a drink. They cleaned up around us then rang bell at 10. We definitely felt unwelcome

=== Lovely lunch ===
We were visiting the area and popped in for lunch mid way through a walk, intrigued by the name of the pub. We were not disappointed, great menu, friendly, knowledgeable staff, lovely tasty food and a nice atmosphere.  I had the Snakecatcher Burger and it was so delicious.  Would love to go back.  The young people who served us were excellent.  Thank you.

=== Very disappointed ===
Have been coming here for several years and had always been good .
The food we served this night was tepid and as if it had been reheated.
When we asked for extra gravy for my partners pie I was told 
It would cost extra !?
We had been looking around to complain further but no one even came to ask how the food was .
No lack of staff just completely no interest.
The pub wasn’t busy maybe 5 tables being served .
As for a manager there was no one to be seen .

=== Snakecatcher worth visiting after walking ===
Having gone on a long walk through and outside of the village. The Snakecatcher looked the best place for Friday lunch and we were not disappointed. Friendly staff and atmosphere, good old fashioned decor and a blazing fire. We had chicken pie and chips and the food was good. Cider good to. So thank you for a pleasant visit, we would return again for lunch. The Snakecatcher also has a pool table which we did not notice until the end. Will have a few games next time

=== Poor pie spoiled it. ===
Nice and warm with pleasant staff. 
Soup was hot and tasty and the beer was good. 
But, oh dear, the pie. It was barely warm, the puff pastry on top was cold and soggy. It left a nasty greasy aftertaste. The greens were dried out, cold and wrinkled.

=== Top chef with attentive staff ===
The staff were very attentive from the moment we arrived until we left. We arrived wanting the specials menu which offers the best options and despite it being a Sunday and out of hours as it was early afternoon they accommodated us. The food was amazing, you can tell it is the chefs own creations as both meals were 5 star. Big car park and a lovely atmosphere. Would 100% recommend

=== Nice, but customer service faux pas ===
Nice venue. Food and beer selection good. Customer service let them down (myself working in hospitality). Sat at a table that was free, and later staff placed a “table reserved from 5pm” sign. Fine, no issues. At 1654 I was asked to vacate the table as the booking was early. From my experience most establishments place a 15 minute window to avoid such embarrassment as I would have happily vacated at the time. Hope The Snakecatcher will
improve to avoid embarrassment of both outgoing and incoming patrons.

=== Jättegott ===
Mysig traditionell engelsk pub med jättegod mat och en unik historia. Stora portioner, trevliga lokaler och hjälpsam personal. Rekommenderar verkligen om man har vägarna förbi!

=== Lovely New Forest pub with great food ===
We stayed in Brockenhurst in October and ate and drank at The Snakecatcher. It was the best of the local pubs. The beer was excellent and the food was great, we highly recommend it.

=== Nice pub, good food but tricky parking on busy days ===
Came for Sunday lunch (booked). Food and drink really nice. No complaints. Service a little slow but they were busy so it was fine. The only negative thing I would say is that the parking was tricky - people not finding sufficient spaces and lots of shunting about as some customers double parked behind main row making it difficult for leaving customers to manoeuvre out and customers trying to come in then blocked the exit. I wonder if all the cars were actually customers or people using it as a free car park?

=== Nice decor and staff. Food not great. ===
Very friendly staff and beautiful decor, but the food was really average. less fried stuff and more vegetables would improve things.

=== Bad Service ===
I came in today with my friends and they ordered drinks. I am 18 yet i didn’t have my ID on me and didn’t order any alcoholic drinks .  I came up and ordered some chips . I was rudely asked for my ID and i said sorry i don’t have any , she framed me for underage drinking when i didn’t even have an alcoholic drink in hand . My other friends who were all of age too had their ID’s therefore went and ordered drinks . My friend ordered two drinks for herself as she also wanted another vodka and coke . The Woman bartender assumed that this was for me  . I said i don’t have ID  and went to go grab my chips . The drinks were rudely snatched from my friends at the table and they weren’t refunded  . When , she was 19 and had an ID !!!  She assumed that my friends and I had planned to sneak alcohol in for me when i ordered food . 
Really disappointed that i was spoken  to in that way  .

=== Underwhelmed ===
Food average at best. Vegetables served lukewarm warm. Pie had the feel about it that it was bought in. Not much atmosphere in the pub. Drinks average in price. Better places to go so won’t be returning.

=== poor attitude ===
came to pub this evening and a girl served us at the bar my friend asked for a vodka coke and got served it and paid for it!! sat outside in the garden turns out for to come outside and take our drinks and tell us to leave the premises, for apparently “under age drinking” and she wasn’t under age she just had no id which i get but doesn’t she can come outside and snatch our drinks off the table! the attitude was unbelievable!

=== Lovely foreat pub with a great historical and unique theme ===
Every hike must end at the pub and Brockenhurst has some of my favourite walks in the country, and if you're in Brockenhurst that place must be the snakecatcher :)

It's has a great old pub for the modern world feel with an interesting and quirky history based on a local historical character, it's a very nice forest town vibe and perfect place to get food and drink when on a visit to the NF.

The price is typical for pubs, but the staff are very friendly and were happy to make adjustments to our meal to fit our needs.

=== Good drinks, but avoid the food. ===
Popped in for dinner on the recommendation of the people at the hotel where we were staying. We had a very nice local IPA and Cider, so far so good. 
The fish and chips was greasy and the fish was poor quality, the burger was better but chips greasy too. This kind of food isn't tricky to prepare well, however the cook didn't seem to be able to follow the instructions.
At these prices that's way below par.

=== Superb in every way ===
The menu is very interesting and varied . We came in one day and just fancied a light bite between us, and had the whitebait, oh my God it was huge, the best portion of whitebait and very very tasty. I would highly recommend. So we came in a few days later to have a main meal, I had duck on the hot stone with sautéed new potatoes and garlic green beans. All three parts of the dish were amazing. My husband had the pie of the week with real vegetables and chips. He thoroughly enjoyed his as well. I would highly recommend.

=== Good food. Good service. ===
We ate here in a family group of 9.  We were served promptly throughout the meal and the staff were friendly. The food was good (we had a green prawn curry, chef's salad, mixed grill, chicken and leek pie, BBQ sharing platter, Eton Mess, blackberry and prosecco cheesecake, sticky toffee pudding etc.)  We all enjoyed our meals. There was a play area that helped entertain our children in any wait. There is history about 'the snake catcher' and interesting wall decorations inside as well as a pool table. We would recommend.

=== Poor customer service :( ===
Me and my partner planned to have a nice meal at The Snakecatcher. When we arrived we asked if there were any tables available for two. The bartender seemed uninterested when we asked where we could sit. We were not told if we had to order at the bar or if there was table service. We seemed to be brushed aside. We sat outside but soon decided to leave and go elsewhere for our dinner. We understand it may have been busy, but customer service is key.

=== Rain stops play, let’s stop for dinner ===
We didn’t book but this may be a good idea, we had our fur baby with us and luckily we were able to locate a seat in the bar area, had it not been raining seating would not have been an issue as there is loads of outside seating.
Meal was nice and staff were friendly and accommodating.

=== Great meal, good value ===
We booked a table inside on Sat night during a weekend in the New Forest. Once we got there we managed to relocate in the garden since it was lovely weather. Food (mediterranean skewer, and nachos) were both great and good value. We'd been disappointed with food in far more expensive places that weekend (The Pig especially), but The Snakecatcher was a lovely surprise. Only negatives - it was very busy and a bit of a crush at the bar, but tasty food and good prices mean I'd definitely return if in the area again.

=== Booking for large parties. ===
Website said phone to book for parties over 10. But tried to book for a party over 10 and were told that they couldn't take booking. Enough though they said there weren't busy that day.

=== Dinner after a long day out in the sun ===
Excellent lovely little pub. Superb beer garden for families and on the other side a more sedate garden if you’re not into kids. The food was lovely and came out very promptly. What was excellent for garden food was it was piping hot. Really good quality.

=== AMAZING ===
The food was absolutely fab we ordered so many options and everything impressed us!!! We will most definitely be back! The staff were extremely charming! Beers were dreamy THANKYOU!!

=== Great place for fabulous food. ===
What a fabulous place. Busy so worth booking. We had salads, the chef's salad with chicken, egg and brie and the tiger prawn with avocado and sweet chilli. Lovely, tasty flavours, great value, well presented. Very friendly service.

=== Good staff behind the bar, but poor quality food and very expensive for what you get. ===
We ordered a meat sharing platter for two, at a cost of just over £19.00 When it arrived, it was six very small wings and two baby ribs !! plus loads of chips. I'm stunned, six wings and two ribs to share between two, at a cost of almost £20.00 I asked one of the staff if it was an oversight in the kitchen...... but no, that's as it comes!! After asking the question and getting the answer I did, you'd think out of courtesy a manager would have taken an interest.... but no, sadly not. Is it just me that thinks that's hideously expensive.

=== Fantastic meal at The Snakecatchers, thank you team! ===
Had a lovely meal with my partner, shared the 2 person cote de beouf and fillet hot stone, great everything, 10/10, will come back for sure.

=== Nice staff, unfortunate evening. ===
Really nice staff, food fairly average, not amazing for the process sadly was homophobicly abused by another customer, which was very upsetting. A third customer tried to reassure us to stay. Not exactly the pub’s fault, but just be aware how some of the clientele maybe behave.

=== Lunch time visit. ===
The staff were very friendly and helpful. We went for lunch and thoroughly enjoyed it. We will definitely be returning.

=== Last night of holiday meal. ===
Saw the food coming out when we called in for a drink earlier in the week so booked a table. Fish and chips were amazing, with minted mushy peas.  My husband had the cook your own steak which comes out on a searing hot stone with chips and garlic green beans, again all amazing. We don't eat out that often preferring to treat ourselves with quality food when we do and this was quality! Will definitely eat there again when we come back to the New Forest.

=== Beautiful pub in a beautiful village ===
A beautiful pub in a beautiful village. We ate here twice during our 4 night stay in Brockenhurst as we liked it so much. Even had the same meal of Mediterranean skewer twice as it was just perfect.

=== Phenomenal ===
I have to say this is the best rural pub experience I have ever had. 

All credit has to go to the beautiful member of staff on the bar called Mercy, top quality service, quality conversation and attention to detail.

I will definitely be back and will bring many people back. 

Well done Mercy, you deserve a pay rise.

10/10 would recommend to a friend.

=== Good Honest Pub ===
Good Pub food at a reasonable price. Plenty of choice and even a specials list.

No fuss food and drink, good table availability inside and out. 

Staff very friendly and helpful

=== Very poor service and dissapointing food ===
We met at the snakecatcher for Sunday lunch and wow what a dissapointment. The service was very poor, the staff were almost totally inatentive and didn't seem to know the menu. The food was terrible, microwaved soggy veg, and chewy meat. For Sunday roast there were only two options, beef or chicken. The car park insufficient for the neads of the visitors. Will not be returning here.

=== Lovely lunch  ===
Lovely atmosphere. Lovely food. I ordered the nicoise salad and my partner ordered the prawn ciabatta. The salad was huge, I couldn't finish it.

=== A must go to place to visit ===
Visited Brockenhurst and this place became our go to place to eat and drink.  Lovely staff, well priced and great menu. 
We cooked our own steaks on the Hot Rock option and it was outstanding. 
We discovered the NEW FOREST ale which is gorgeous. 
Lovely inside and beautiful outdoor area
Very dog friendly 
Highly recommended, a must go to place to visit

=== Lunch experience ===
Dropped in for lunch after a walk with a friend. It was not busy.
There was nobody behind the bar though several staff sitting at a table talking, no attention given to potential customers waiting for service. After standing at the bar for a few minutes we had to ask if anybody was going to serve us and a ? manager then told a member of staff to.  She was pleasant and helpful and our our subsequent meal was good. However the initial poor customer service was disappointing and we felt our custom was not valued.

=== Lovely place ===
Lovely place - beautiful garden 
Service ok - not to sure if new member of staff but was unsure when ordering - also ordered tonic water - just gave us the glass bottle , no glass etc 
The prawn salad was lovely flavour 
Ordered two ploughman’s and stayed no soft cheeses but came out with soft cheese 
Family said the ploughman’s was lovely but different in requirements rather of had pickle not a jam , but said the meat selection was lovely 
Still love the snake catcher though lovely place to visit and eat despite the little errors today

=== almost fresh sandwich yesterday ===
i ordered a ham and cheese sandwich with chutney for lunch which i didn't think was to difficult. On arrival ifound the bread to be stale i called over a member of staff and asked him if the bread was fresh to which he told me he would find out. He returned a minute later and this you cannot make up he told me the bread was fresh yesterday i told him its not fresh then and he replied yesterday. I nearly fell off my seat.

=== Best steak ever ===
Came here for dinner for the wife’s birthday and was not disappointed. The food was to die for. Great selection of drinks and amazing, friendly staff. We’ll definitely be returning

=== Fabulous lunchtime meals ===
We had a great meal today and good portions. Our drinks and meals were served byTiegan. She was very attentive, pleasant and friendly. That along being very efficient made it an extremely enjoyable experience. She was an absolute delight. Thank you Tiegan, we will be back.

=== Great food and attentive service ===
The Snakecatcher never disappoints, another great meal with attentive service.
Highly recommend the steak on the stone and the Mediterranean skewer was a great change. Beer on tap was great and the malbec went down well. 
Will be back next time we are in The New Forest

=== Crap shocking how didn't deal with complaints. ===
Food wasn't cook then my son burger was burnt we complained and no money off the bill! Customer service was stocking I very disappointed and won't be going again.

=== Terrible service ===
Restaurant was very busy, however, the waiter was rude and totally uninterested in providing and kind of customer service and was so unhelpful.

=== Lovely lunchtime ===
We had a great lunch here. Friendly but not over-friendly staff, fast service and very good food served in overwhelming quantity

=== An excellent weekday lunch. ===
Four of us met for lunch at this pub, having booked in advance.  Service was low key but pleasant.  As it was a Friday the pub was fairly empty.  The menus are very varied with plenty of choice for people with all likes and dislikes.  All of us were impressed with the look of the food and the large portions.  I had an excellent green curry with a huge amount of large chunks of chicken.  My friends were also impressed by the food and the size of the portions.   We all had a starter and a main.   Strangely we weren't offered either puddings or coffee but that didn't bother us as we didn't actually have room for either!  This pub is much to be recommended and is handily close to the railway station so that one can leave the car at home!

=== Will return! Spot on. ===
After reading reviews on trip advisor, we visited this pub for a late lunch mid week. Dog friendly. The staff were so friendly, chatty and helpful. Ambience was welcoming. Menu varied. Good selection of drinks. Relatively reasonably priced. We ordered food at around 2.30pm which we were assured was no problem. Our food was delicious. No negatives at all. We loved it here and will return again and again. Thank you team.

=== Meal after a long walk ===
Some of our group had completed a 30 mile training walk so were tired and hungry. We found a table but no one came to speak to us despite there being several staff around.
I went to the bar to order drinks and ask about the pie of the day which I was told was steak and ale. My daughter ordered this but when the pie arrived it was chicken. We questioned this but we’re told it had never been steak and ale! My daughter was hungry so said she would just have it but asked for gravy as it was very dry. This we were charged for despite it being their mistake.
It took ages for plates to be cleared and again I had to go to the bar to order pudding.
Food was generally ok but they definitely need to improve their service. Plenty of staff but lack of training and/or organisation.
Won’t be rushing back.

=== Lovely lunch, friendly staff & dog friendly ===
First time trying The Snakecatcher and we were not disappointed.

Friendly and quick service from the bar staff and the waitress.

We shared a starter Homemade Ham Hock Terrine served with sourdough and mango chutney. Very tasty, but it was more like a pate.

Main courses ordered were Pan fried pork medallions served with gratin potato, peach and cranberry, finished with Jack Daniels and honey jus and the Ham, egg and chips. Both very tasty and compliments tot he chef for the pork medallions.

Tried a couple of the ales which were good.

Will be going back when in the area.

=== Birthday meal ===
4 of us went Sunday afternoon for a Birthday the food that we ordered was very nice but unfortunately let down by the poor service, first of all we had to ask after 15 minutes for someone to take our order as nobody came to our table.
Food all came out in good time and was all lovely while eating we were not asked if food was ok then after we had finished our mains we sat there for 30 minutes again nobody came to clear plates away and ask if we wanted desserts or anything else in the end we decided to go to Bar and pay as still nobody came to table it was a shame as we couldn’t fault the food.

=== So unbelievably disappointed ===
Unbelievably disappointed, and I barely ever write negative reviews, I always look for the positive. But today's visit has really not impressed me.

I walked in and found a table, to be fair I was served quickly and the interactions were friendly. Menu, especially the specials, sounded great, but the sizzling steak appealed.

The food is where it went wrong, nothing inherently inedible but, when a meal is £24 with steak and scallops you are looking forward to a feast. I got a 4oz steak (as advertised so not commenting there) but when the 4oz steak is sliced into 3 pieces and every single piece is 50% fat I got a 2oz steak.

Scallops were cooked well......because I cooked them!

The mushrooms were basically oil (though flavourful) and the sweet potato fries were the worst I have ever had, just mush. Absolutely felt like they were boiled not fried. 

The whole meal was served with 3 sauces that didn't compliment the scallops at all, at a push a couple could have gone with the steak.

And then as I was sitting by the bar I had to listen to the bar staff talk about their visit to a strip club and cafe parfait.
All in all, not a place I will revisit for food ( I am local)

=== Great pub food and service. ===
We had a great pub lunch with friends on the way too watch a show in Southampton.
Great food and great service
Will diffinately have a meal in the snakecatcher again when in the new forest area.

=== Won’t be returning or recommending ===
Pretty disappointed overall with our visit today. I understand it was Easter Sunday but our table seemed to be getting different service to others around. No table service but others were getting it, main food came out VERY quick after starters.. I’m talking less than 5 minutes- all hot and fresh but not ideal. A goats cheese salad was ordered that came missing the beans, no coleslaw for the two burgers ordered. We didn’t get checked back on to bring these issues up and no staff available to pull aside, maybe break time?? We had to keep asking for cutlery also. When it came to paying the bill at the bar we were acknowledged but the phone got answered first.

=== Fabulous meals! ===
Had two meals here in the build up to the Easter weekend, one magnificent cote de boef which we shared and then the following evening a mixed seafood main plus a rib-eye cooked at the table on hot stones. Everything was excellent,  particularly the chips!
Staff very friendly and helpful... special call out to Jake and Connor, who made our stay in Brockenhurst very memorable.  Hope to be back in the summer, when some lovely weather will elevate the experience even further! Best wishes Vidal, Diana, and Dexter the Springer

=== Fantastic Pub Restaurant...Neil Winstone Alfriston East Sussex  ===
Absolutely fantastic pub restaurant in heart of the new forest fabulous food menu and extremely enjoyable... lovely welcoming staff with great ambience throughout well done everyone involved 10/10

=== Excellent ! ===
We decided to stop on our train journey to Southampton airport. The pub is just 2 mins walk from Brockenhurst station. We weren't disappointed. The pub was clean and good menu. We had a fish pie which was piping hot and delicious, served with a side salad. I had sorbet for pudding, as they did not have the flavour I asked for, they gave me extra scoops, which was good. Not surprisingly, it got busier, but staff and manager coped and kept everyone happy. Would certainly go back.

=== A good local pub ===
We called in here on two nights during our stay in Brockenhurst. A good pub with excellent local ales.  We had a snack on the second visit which was good.  Would certainly call in again if in the area.

=== Excellent food, friendly staff. ===
We had an excellent meal on Saturday evening. 
The food was excellent, well cooked and extremely tasty. The portion size was pretty good as well as we were all hungry.
They keep a good pint if real ale as well. 

I can't fault the staff for their friendly amd helpful attitude. 
Five stars on all accounts.

=== Excellent meal! ===
Staying in Brockenhurst for two nights and our hotel recommended ‘Snakecatcher’ to us. Nice pub, good atmosphere and lovely food, portions were huge too! Great story behind the name, make sure you read it if you visit the pub.

=== Drinks ===
Had a lovely few hours in here enjoying drinks and company. Great welcome and lovely atmosphere, will
Most definitely return.

=== Quite Evening Meal ===
My husband and I were in Brockenhurst for a few days and popped into The Snakecatcher Pub for our evening meal. We were served by two young staff who were friendly and attentive. We were the only people at first maybe because it was a weekday and we were early. Our meal arrived quickly and it was enjoyable. The portions were large and the menu had a good varied selection.

=== Great pub food with excellent service ===
Came in for an early dinner, staff were very welcoming and friendly. Service was excellent as the pub filled up pretty quickly. A young blonde lady was super efficient and remained smiling even though she was looking after a number of tables. 

Food was great quality pub food, well done chefs.  We only had mains but were absolutely full. Reasonably priced too. Can’t fault it. Well done.

=== Traditional Country Pub providing excellent food and service ===
My wife and myself are currently holidaying at Brockenhurst in the New Forest (staying at the lovely Cottage Lodge Hotel - Review to follow) - and earlier this evening we had an early supper at the nearby Snakecatcher Pub.

Being relatively early diners we had the pick of tables and found a nice one towards the rear of the lounge. The staff could not have been more welcoming and were soon enjoying our respective dinners. Both our Pies (Fish and Steak & Ale) were not only delicious but were accompanied by a generous selection of fresh vegetables.

All in all, a most enjoyable evening and - as such - this will probably not be our last visit!

=== Dinner date  ===
Great food, reasonably priced with massive portions. Wonderful service by Jake. Will definitely be back

=== We enjoyed this pub ===
We enjoyed good beer (I should say ale) and good food and the service was good too. It was a Monday mid afternoon so quiet. But still worth a visit.

=== Excellent food and good service ===
Excellent food. We had steak and ale pie which was extremely tasty and contained good quality meat which was cooked to perfection, it came with lovely crispy chips and perfectly cooked vegetables. Our other meal was the fish pie which was also beautifully cooked and freshly made. The service was good and the staff friendly. Would definitely recommend a visit.

=== Walk on by….. ===
Came across this pub whilst out walking; wished we had walked on by.
Greeted at the bar by a smiling young lady happy take my order and chat, it fell apart from there; She was undermined and belittled by another member of bar staff, apparently being her brother meant he could put her down in front of customers. (She walked off embarrassed and emotional), I felt very uneasy along with a customer who was sat next to me. We received our order, Ham, egg and chips; pie of the day and vegetables.
Eggs were undercooked and warm at best, the vegetables weren't cooked and cold, the meat in the pie was tough. The food was left. The only redeeming feature was the ale which was a good pint. We won't be returning.

=== Very Good ===
A well-run pub/restaurant with plenty of staff and a very good kitchen. 
We had the ham, egg and chips along with the pie of the week - both enjoyable and promptly served. 
A choice of real ales and a good wine selection made for a good evening. 
There’s a large car park to the side too…
A sound choice if you want better-than-average pub food.

=== Just Excellent ===
Last minute decision, called and booked 30mins ahead. Friendly, very polite, on the ball staff.
Excellent menu choice, also a specials board. Large portions, hot and very tasty.
Will certainly visit again and highly recommend

=== Well worth a visit ===
Last minute decision as we were staying just up the road. 
Staff were all really pleasant, greeted us on arrival, table was ready although we were a few minutes early.
Good selection of draught beers (Snakecatcher bitter is recommended),  ciders and wines. Great choice of food plus several specials on the blackboard, including "pie of the week".
Scampi and chips with proper whole tails not 'reconstituted'. Snakecatcher burger and chips. Really good sized portions and very tasty. We also ordered the trio of bread which was probably a mistake given how much you got!!!. 
We did our best and the plates were almost clean.
Highly recommended.

=== VERY poor customer service ===
As previously mentioned by another reviewer, we too booked a table on line earlier in the day for 5 of us which was duly accepted & said 'booked'.  Arrived at 7.15 ready to dine.  Walked in and were completely ignored for at least 10 minutes until someone acknowledged we were there!!!  Not once did a member of staff say a word not even 'we'll be with you in a minute' SO damn rude.  Eventually the female staff member promptly asked if we'd received an email confirmation, with a snidey smile on her face, which we hadn't at that time but it came later after our booking time had come & gone!  Ridiculous booking system - didn't offer to squeeze us in or come back at a later time or offer a table in the garden.  Haven't received such poor customer service in a long time and having gone elsewhere, we had the best dinner at Enzee near the station who couldn't have been more welcoming & accommodating!  Suffice to say won't be returning to the Snake Catcher any time soon.

=== Superb in every way ===
The menu attracted us as there were very interesting choices. We both had the hot stone dishes. The side orders that came with the mains were extremely delicious too. Very friendly attentive staff, dog friendly and all the food we saw being served looked tremendous. Will definitely return and highly recommend.

=== Amazing ===
absolutely amazing! food was great and staff were amazing even though it was incredibly busy! One of the staff had to deal with a very tricky customer who had emailed to book an hour before not had a response and still expected the booking. She handled it really well and apologised to me for the drama! Thanks guys your amazing will be back again

=== If you book on line..don't expect to eat ===
The Snakecatcher...don't book online if you want a table
In the New Forest for a short break. Booked a table at the Snakecatcher online via there app for Thursday 31st 7.30pm two people and a dog
Turned up as planned barman can find no booking for us and they are rammed. 
He asked if I'd booked online and he said they have to manually transfer the on line bookings to the booking book...and he hadn't had a chance to do it
No apology 
No we will try and squeeze you in
NOTHING
what can one do? 
Make a scene
 demand to see the manager
Ask for a refund (except we hadn't paid anything)
None of which would magic up dinner
We opted for leaving 
vowing never to return and document our experience

=== Dishonest Staff ===
Great family meal - steak on stones and great service.

All was well until the bill turned up with a bottle of wine we didn’t order and a pint of beer. We raised this with the staff who without question took them off the bill followed by a half hearted apology. 

Unfortunately hard to believe this was an honest mistake. Ruined an otherwise very nice evening.

I wonder what would happen if as a customer you refused to pay for 15% of the bill? Because some places appear to think it is ok to add 15% without reason.

=== Definitely worth a visit if you are in or around Brockenhurst ===
Fabulous steaks on hot stones yesterday, and delicious desserts, particularly the brownie!  We sat outside as it has a bit is a play area for the children, who did not want to leave the pub.  Great atmosphere, not the cheapest, but you get what you pay for and the meals were worth it.

=== Must try the hot rock food ===
Staff were really lovely and dinner was delicious with large portions. We went for the hot rock food and were surprised how good it was. If we are ever in Brockenhurst again we will definitely be back for dinner!

=== Nice but could do better. ===
Lovely play area, some nice food. Chips, curly fries and scampi were enjoyed. Kids chicken nuggets were spicy and were not eaten by 2 out of 3 children. There were vegan options but expected to pay the same price for less food eg take the goats cheese off the salad and no sauce in the veggie burger making it very dry. Maybe could supply alternative instead or have a separate option at a lower cost.

=== Fantastic service  ===
Group of 25, pre ordered, service swift, polite and very efficient. Fantastic food enjoyed by all. Atmosphere really good, nice choice of background tunes.

=== Nice pub. Poor customer service. ===
Nice pub with nice big garden. The staff were a big let down though. No acknowledgement at the bar and waited ages to be served even though no one else was waiting - it seems finishing a conversation about not getting the days off they asked for and ‘polishing’ some cutlery take precedence over basic customer service.

=== One night stay ===
I cannot express how wonderful this hotel is. From the staff the rooms the restaurant. Everything was exceptional. We came away for my husbands birthday and honestly couldn't have chosen a better place. All the staff were friendly. The food out of this world. The leisure pool , jacuzzi and sauna were also amazing. Thank you balmer lawn hotel for a lovely experiencem we hope to visit you again in the near future.

=== Great Stay ===
We had a lovely night's stay at Balmer Lawn, a beautiful hotel, the staff were very welcoming and friendly, we had a very nice cocktail, sitting in the covered outside area with the patio heaters was lovely (even with the wind blowing outside)!  The restaurant food was magnificent, a little more expensive but well worth it for a special occasion.

=== Not a 4 star hotel. Cold & very dirty. Avoid ===
This is not a 4 star hotel! Very dirty rooms, see photos. Very used up towels (some ripped) and dirty robes with no slippers. Uneven carpets in the hallway - you can easily trip up. Upon arrival, the room was really cold and we were told the heating is on from 5:30pm but we can sit downstairs in the lounge to warm up. No heating during the night. The pool changing rooms are also dirty. You cannot swim in the pool as you will hit your legs, it’s 0.9 m and only 1.6m in one small area. The jacuzzi is a hazard, I hurt my foot when getting in as the steps are sharp. Food is ok but very overcharged for the quality. Reception adds charity donation and gratitude payments to the bill, so check before you pay. Overall, a very disappointing experience and would never come back.

=== Excellent hotel . ===
Lovely Hotel with good easy parking, spacious bedroom, very good food, staff pleasant and efficient. Right in the middle of the New Forest with easy connection by car and public transport to its towns and villages and the coast and beaches.

=== Very Good Second stay this year ===
We had the luxury of the 4 poster room again. All of the the hotel staff that we met were very pleasant and helpful. The pool/jacuzzi/sauna facilities are very good. We had an excellent evening meal in the restaurant. All this and 3 nights for the price of 2! We especially like the location in the New Forest and proximity to Brockenhurst's facilities. We were very satisfied with our second stay this year at the Balmer Lawn.

=== Fabulous experience ===
Stayed for a night with a big family group to celebrate a special birthday and had a fabulous time. The hotel facilities and dining were excellent and the staff went above and beyond to make it a truly memorable experience. Special thanks to Samantha and the team for accommodating our additional requests and making us feel so welcome and thoroughly looked after.

=== Lovely meal ===
