Four of us went for lunch. The food was good with a varied choice for all tastes. Service was good with friendly attentive staff. The only criticism was that they were very mean with the Tonka Bean Cream Anglaise got the dessert (two of us had to share a spoonful - how mean and no offer for more).

=== Lovely romantic hotel.  ===
Stayed for a 1 night romanic break and we both really liked the hitel. Lovely hotel, great decor in the main areas which was very fitting for the handsome building. Friendly staff at checkin / out, dinner, breakfast and the bar. The food was good and overall just a lovely atmosphere.

=== Not for us. ===
I was given a £600 voucher as a present to stay here for a weekend. Feedback as follows: 
1. Was charged £100 on arrival as a pre-authorisation.
2. Restaurant was OK but the steak we had was very tough. They charged me a gratuity on departure! 
3. The Spa and pool was overrun by children. 
4. At Breakfast we were told we had to pay for coffee!! 
5. It took me months to get my money refunded that they owed me. 
6. There was a wedding at the hotel on the weekend We stayed and people were running up and down the hallways all night long screaming.

We would never stay again and you can get far better hotels for £600. It felt like they were just trying to squeeze more money out of us whenever they could which probably works with some of their Rich clients.

=== Relaxed, enjoyed the delicious meals. ===
Excellent hotel made us feel very welcome. Evening meal delicious, pricy but worth every penny. Superior double very good. Shower not so good but in an old property. We will be back soon.  Set in a great location. Many visitors had their four legged friends and they were also made welcome, in fact we will bring Margot our cockerpoo next time.

=== Balmer Lawn - ‘Book with us for best rates’… and disappointments! ===
In July ‘24 I booked, directly with Balmer Lawn, a double room for Dec for us as a Christmas treat. I paid a £80 deposit. I have been contacted by them to say the booking can’t be upheld as they are fully booked. I struggle to believe that in July the hotel was fully booked for Dec. And if so, why has it taken four months to inform me of this? One wonders if our room has been resold at Christmas prices. A horrible thing to do to people and their Christmas plans. Balmer Lawn “pride themselves on great service”. Hmmmm. This doesn’t feel great! I was offered the chance to book alternative dates but we have little confidence in entrusting our Christmas celebrations with Balmer Lawn. We have booked a hotel down the road from them.

=== Passed its best ===
Incredibly tired & dated rooms. Noisiest hotel I’ve ever stayed in, from hearing word for word the tv in the room next door to hearing ever single person walking past your door, even hearing the breakfast buffet dishes being opened in the restaurant below! Don’t bother passing on your experience either, they just ignore it. Give it a miss.

=== A great place in stay in the heart of the New Forest ===
We had an excellent stay at the Balmer Lawn Hotel. It is a fantastic location and all the staff we encountered were first class especially Jane at Breakfast times who went out of her way to look after everyone's needs (A true asset)  There was also one of the waiting staff who's name I did not take down (She had a butterfly tattoo on her upper arm) who seemed to be everywhere when something was required again an asset to the team at Balmer Lawn. 
We were very well looked after.
The room we stayed in was great for 2 nights we stayed, however the 3rd night we had some neighbours who were quite loud this was made worse because we were in a room with connecting doors (understanding for larger families but sound proofing an issue) 
The room was impeccably cleaned and refreshed every day.
The food and drink were of a very high standard at all times.

Unfortunatley for us the spa was being renovated at the time of our stay but the treatments continued in other rooms and again were just amazing

=== Poor customer service, dodgy advertising & booking system ===
We intended to visit Balmer Lawn Hotel 1 - 3 November. We found the hotel advertised on the New Forest tourism website. When I called the hotel to make a reservation, they denied any knowledge of the advertisement on the website. It was a very unpleasant experience. It was also quite ludicrous in a way - to be a customer trying to make a booking and having to spend so much time explaining their own advertising. I had printed a 'voucher' (no monetary value) on the website and called the hotel to make the booking, referring to the offer advertised on the website. Reception said they would call back but did not do so. The following day, there was still no response. After much going back and forth (quite incredible really how difficult it was to take a booking),  I was finally offered a room and agreed the price and 30 seconds after agreeing the booking, I was told there were no more standard rooms. I would have given 1 star were it not for the apology call from the General Manager.  We were so messed about by the hotel that we ended up not going away for the weekend, which was hugely disappointing. I've been offered a tea 'subject to availability' in the next 12 months. I'm not sure that I would take up the offer as it doesn't address the problem I had.

=== Clear review ===
Some rooms are substandard and It’s expensive. We have stay in much nicer rooms for the money we paid.

The hotel is extremely hot. They could save a fortune with more energy efficient lighting and using less lighting and the heating off with a busy hotel you do not need the heating to be on with an open fire. You must have money to burn.! You could reduce the room rates for the energy that’s being wasted this is also an environmental issue. You need to seriously improve your green credentials!

Staff seemed friendly. I wouldn’t return due to the room not being nice, very expensive and way too hot. Uncomfortably hot.

=== Sunday Lunch ===
My family and friends enjoyed a delicious Sunday roast at the Balmerlawn's restaurant, the meat was cooked to perfection and was accompanied by seasonal, locally sourced vegetables. Whilst we eat, a live saxophone player set the tone, creating a cosy and inviting ambiance. The service was exceptional; I could not recommend more highly.

=== Lovely two night stay ===
We recently had a lovely relaxing two night stay at the very comfortable and welcoming Balmer Lawn Hotel which is in a great location in the New Forest. The reception team, waiters and waitresses, bar staff and in particular Tom the manager, were all very welcoming, friendly and helpful. Food was amazing and service in the restaurant was very good too.

=== Just what the family needed! ===
We stayed as a family of seven for three nights. Service was excellent and the staff extremely friendly and helpful. Our waitress Jane, at every breakfast, made our stay even better. She was attentive, efficient and friendly. She paid attention to each of us as we celebrated two birthdays. It was a pleasure to be served by her. Hold onto Jane Balmer Lawn, She is an asset that you would never want to lose.  We will be back!

=== First visit but will certainly be back ===
We regularly visit Brockenhurst but this was our first visit to Balmer Lawn.
This is a lovely comfortable hotel with a lovely atmosphere. We were made to feel very welcome when we arrived and every member of staff, of which there are many, went out of their way to look after us.
The rooms are very comfortable and very clean and we were fortunate to have a view over the garden from ours which was a Superior room on the 2nd floor. There is also a lift which is very handy for getting luggage to and from your room.
The restaurant offers a good buffet breakfast and dinner. 
My initial thoughts on the dinner menu was that it was expensive but the quality of the food was superb . We were there for three nights and enjoyed the most amazing food on each night. There is also a good selection of vegan and vegetarian food . They were also very thorough on food allergy requirements.
As dog lovers we were also pleased to see that there were a number of well behaved visiting dogs. All in all, this was one of the nicest and friendliest hotels we have stayed in and we shall certainly return.

=== New Forest charm with old fashioned hospitality - great place to stay! ===
Great property in the new forest, lovely welcome by the team, check in was friendly, polite and informative. Hotel manager Tom, clearly has an eye for guest service, which is a refreshing change. Lovely quiet room, very clean, and well maintained, bathroom was great, double walk in shower, very clean and well presented, water was a good temperature and easily controlled. Decor was in keeping with the property and lovely attention to detail throughout. Parking was easy and location great for surrounding new forest villages and access to Southampton, Bournemouth or the Hampshire coast.

=== Delicious Italian restaurant/puzzeria ===
Nice atmosphere, lovely design, very friendly, delicious wood oven pizzas , and home made pastas and !!! Canonili Sicilian :) desert 
Thank you

=== Fabulous Italian Restaurant  ===
Fabulous little restraunt where we have eaten twice this month. 
All courses were fantastic.  Try the Bruchetta, so tasty. The bolognese sauce, the best I've ever tasted; then there's the quarter formagi pizza - filling and tasty. All four of very happy with our selections.  By the way the house red is worth a try and value for money.
You can watch one of the chef's prepare your pizza for the oven.
Staff so friendly and efficient. Will be visiting Brockenhurst again next month and will definitely having another meal here.

=== Great Restaurant ===
Lovely restaurant, friendly staff and great atmosphere. Food was amazing. Eaten here a few times over the past year when we visit and never disappointed

=== Expected so much more. ===
We expected better. Reviews were good, looked very upmarket from outside and the menu looked good.
We had main course only. Both pastas were undercooked. The bolognaise “with a secret ingredient” was tasteless. We weren’t table checked, nor offered additional Parmesan or any additional requirements. There were three waiting staff, none of which appeared interested in their job. Expensive for what we had. Very disappointing. Will not return.

=== Fabulous  Italian Restuarant ===
In Brockenhurst for just one night so picked Albero for our evening meal as we have been before. 5 stars across the board. Staff attentive but not intrusive. food fantastic, shared a pasta and pasta dish. Price for food and drink very reasonable . Will be returning for sure.

=== Disappointing. ===
Arrived 6.30 pm. Service good. Food was very nice but the size of the portion for what I paid was very disappointing. My portion was what I would normally get for a starter elsewhere. I complemented the food but informed the waitress that I was disappointed with the size of the portion. She apologised but no offer of extra food or reduction in the bill. Paid £21 for puttanesca half a dish. Wouldn’t return.

=== Good Italian village Restaurant ===
Really good time. Ambiance, Food and Service were all top notch. 
Reasonably priced. Nice decor with no overcrowding. Wish it was our local Italian Restaurant

=== Amazing dinner - 5* ===
We visited for the first time this weekend and already cannot wait to come back. The food was AMAZING and felt so authentic and the service was great too. We also found it really reasonably priced for how big the portions were and how given the amazing quality of the food. I would highly recommend!!

=== Consistently great food and good service ===
Superb food, as always. We try to visit Albero every time we stay in Brockenhurst. The food is delicious and always consistently good. Mains are tasty and the specials are excellent. We've never had a bad experience here. The chef is friendly, and works hard to cater for all tastes. It's a great place for vegetarian food. Service is friendly and efficient. We'll definitely be back soon.

=== Lovely evening  ===
Really lovely restaurant with a nice ambience. Food was all top notch and the house wine was great. Staff were all very pleasant and attentive. Would certainly recommend to others.

=== Great food…disappointing service ===
Ate here when we were staying in the village. Food was great, however service left a lot to be desired. Service was good on arrival but got worse as evening went on.. The ladies serving were more interested in a gossip than serving us. 
All the food was beautifully cooked and cocktails were good too.
Would recommend four cheese pizza and carbonara.

=== What a find! ===
We booked late but a table was found for us and our grandchildren.  Staff and service were friendly and efficient, food delicious.  The fettuccine with mushrooms was to die for! What a find!

=== Great! ===
Great! Couldn’t get a table inside as fully booked but we could sit outside under heat lamps with cushions and blankets. Only had room for mains but absolutely great service and food!

=== Great traditional Italian food ===
Our 2nd visit to Albero and it did not disappoint, staff were friendly and attentive. The food was great, lots of choice and true Italian flavours. Will definitely be back next time we are in Brockenhurst!

=== Lovely meal! ===
An amazing little gem in Brock. We had the porchetta and calamari/prawns to start- both delicious! Followed with the wild boar pasta and a spicy salami pizza. We were so impressed with the food and service and will definitely be back. They had our favourite red wine Appasimento which we had a bottle of and a nice atmosphere. We had a cheesecake to share which was just ok ( it’s baked - which is my favourite way to have it so I’m a bit fussy about my cheesecake) but everything else was delicious!

=== Best pasta. ===
Lovely Italian restaurant, we walked from our hotel and had previously booked a table. It was busy but restaurant is airy and we did not feel crammed in or the noise intrusive. The service was first class and the portions were great, my pasta dish was the best I've had and all home made. We will definitely go back when next in area.

=== A very good Italian restaurant reasonably priced. ===
We have been here before and like everything about the place. The staff were very friendly and provided just the right level of service eg attentive but not hurrying us along. The food was very good, and we all had different dishes and pleased with all of them. The wine selection is not extensive but adequate. We chose the Primitivo and it was very good at a reasonable price. Overall our lunch was a very pleasant experience in a delightful setting and with good food and wine.  We will be back.

=== On a Hot Summers Night ===
Popped in last minute and very accommodating as pretty booked up.

Lucky for us it was 27 degrees outside so we sat on the patio tables to keep cool.

Specials as well as standard menu availability.

What we had was plentiful and reasonably priced.

Advise booking if you can as not a large establishment but well worth a visit.

=== Amazing! ===
Had a lovely meal! The staff were lovely. The food was delicious and reasonably priced. They also served the best garlic I have ever had!

=== Wedding anniversary treat ===
Another lovely lunch. Treat for our 26th wedding Anniversary. Missed Slavi, but as usual great service and the food is always spot on!! As always Thankyou X

=== Great food & service ===
Went for Sunday Lunch in the Beresfords Restaurant & was absolutely superb.  Highly recommend & the service was excellent also. We will definitely be going again & will be telling people about it.   Enjoyed it so much we are hoping to get a booking for Christmas Day

=== 3 day break ===
This is our 3rd time at the balmer lawn over 15 years, this was definitely our best. The hotel has been upgraded quite sufficiently from our last stay, our room was lovely overlooking the cricket field, breakfast was brilliant and all the staff here are brilliant especially all the young waiters and waitresses. The hotel was well decorated for Halloween no expense spared , great location for getting anywhere in the south coast and forest . Great little pool and jacuzzi and sauna .would definitely recommend this hotel very comfy and relaxing well done Balmer lawn

=== A relaxing visit ===
A return visit to Balmer Lawn, when the weather wasn't so good but the welcome was still warm. We had a lovely room overlooking the lawn. The food was excellent as always and the staff were friendly and helpful. This time we made use of the pool, sauna and jacuzzi, fantastic! 
While it was not cold, the windy weather made it feel cool, but the welcoming fire and comfy sofas and chairs made it a comfy environment to relax in.

=== Fantastic place for couples or groups 😎👍 ===
Was our 50th anniversary so had a few days there, & it was fabulous the food, service, staff all fantastic nothing to much trouble at all, complementary bubbles & chocolates, with swimming pools, sauna, hot tub, gym, & the most wonderful afternoon tea ever, highly recommended 😎👍

=== Fabulous hotel ===
We booked the entire hotel for our big 10yr wedding anniversary bash in August and we couldn’t have been happier with our choice. The staff and especially Ruth our events manager were so attentive and made us feel so special. As an event manager myself I feel that I am quite the control freak and find it hard to relinquish control so well done Balmer Lawn and the entire team. We will be booking our 20yr party with you!

=== Overnight stay ===
The restaurant, bar and staff are the biggest pull to this hotel. Outstanding care with intolerance and allergies. Such friendly staff- attentive, knowledgeable about menu, highly trained and have a sense of humour building very good relationships with guests. The menu is excellent with a HUGE range of meals and adaptations ( within reason of course) can be made. Congratulations to the chefs and their team. 
Plated breakfast  was lovely. Service friendly and efficient. 
The rooms need better cleaning and a little colour added to them! Sinks need a good clean around the drainage and overflow. Floors need a good vacuum. Towels are tired and dry and discoloured.

=== Gem of the New Forest ===
Balmer Lawn is always our “go to” hotel in the New Forest and we try to spend at least once or twice a year here.
We had a three night break this time with our little dog and it was really nice to be recognised as a returning guest. 
The staff, as always, are a credit to the hotel. 
The hotel is super dog friendly and has access to so many walks. 
The rooms are comfy and the ambiance of the lounge downstairs makes it a lovely break away in whichever season you visit. 
Thank you for a lovely stay and see you all again soon!

=== Grand Old Dame of the Forest ( the hotel - not me!)  ===
We've just spent a wonderful 3 night break at this hotel. For the past few years, we've camped at the camping site next door, and I always walked past the Balmer Lawn and wondered what it would be like to stay there. My expectations were high, and I am pleased to say that the hotel didn't disappoint. 

We stayed in room 14, which is a first-floor room, at the front of the hotel overlooking the cricket pitch. Best of all,  it has a balcony. The view from the balcony was a little obscured by the marquee above The Lodge, but we quite liked the fact that this gave us some privacy on the balcony. The room was spacious, comfy, and well equipped with a huge superking bed. We had a slight problem with the (complimentary!)  safe in the wardrobe, but within 5 minutes of phoning down to reception, someone came to our room and reset it for us. 

We loved the room and its location, but I knew we would. Leisure time is too important to me to waste if I don't like a room, so I used the hotel's on line 'look before you book' feature on their website (a great feature!) and booked direct.

 I knew from reading previous reviews that the staff were very professional at this hotel, and again, I wasn't let down. Everyone we met from receptionists to bar/restaurant staff to housekeeping were polite, efficient, and friendly. The hotel seems to attract a great clientelle too, we met some great people and although we don't have a dog ourselves, we loved that the hotel is 'dog friendly'. 

Breakfast each day was a highlight. The buffet had a great selection of hot and cold food, and you could tell that the ingredients were top-notch! The staff at breakfast were exactly the right mix of being attentive without being intrusive. 

When I'm travelling for pleasure as opposed to business, I appreciate a hotel that's full of character and  personality and feels like a bit of a treat. That's exactly what we got at the Balmer Lawn hotel. My only complaint is that this break has completely spoilt me for camping. When I next return to Brockenhurst, I'll be sleeping in the comfort of this hotel - not in a tent!

=== Afternoon tea with a twist ===
We booked afternoon tea for my birthday,  it was going well until one of the cake stands feet accidentally fell into the table gap and fell over and spilled half of the contents over my daughter who had  the jam and cream and tea all over her and the floor. I was very disappointed in the help we got to clear up all the mess. Infact my daughter was so upset and in tears she left to go home. We had to ask for there afternoon tea to be boxed to take with her, we also had to ask for new serviettes  a clean tea cup and saucer etc. I  feel all of this should have been done automatically with a bit more empathy.

=== Almost perfect break ===
We stayed in the Lodge close by and utilised the hotel facilities a few times.
A lot nicer than my visit some years ago and the staff are great..... especially in the Spa and the waiting staff. 
Sadly the trip was spoiled by leaving a birthday present clothing item in the Lodge which mysteriously vanished it seems after we left.
Still a GREAT stay and chilled venue for a break

=== Really enjoyable stay ===
This hotel provides comfortable and relaxing stay with staff who smile and very well managed. If there is an issue they sort it no fuss and still smiling. Restaurant with good menu and service. Lovely pool and gym   Excellent value and great location

=== Relaxing Break in the New Forest ===
Just returned from a short break in this lovely hotel in the New Forest.  We were greeted by a lovely friendly receptionist and quickly checked in.  Our room was lovely with a view over the lawns of the hotel with New Forest ponies roaming around.  We ate in the Beresford restaurant twice and the food was exceptional, though quite pricey.  The waiters were professional, efficient and friendly as were the bar staff.
One thing to note, our room was on the first floor above the reception area and was a little noisy when guests were arriving - worth asking for a higher floor or a room at the back of the hotel.  But that did not spoil our stay and we will definitely be returning.

=== Standards have definitely lowered this year ===
We are local to the Balmer Lawn and eat here very often and bring our friends here when they visit us here in the New Forest 
The Sunday lunches are superb with live music 
Last year the Tom Jones night was also superb with canapés , steak and dessert 
The Comedy night last night not so 
Very poor value for money 
£55 each for less than half a 125 ml glass of cheap Prosecco each 
Roast chicken  a supreme each and two  boiled pieces of potato, bland and anemic, not the duck fat roast potatoes advertised and less than a dessert spoon of tough kale 
Two mouthfuls of shop bought cheesecake 
We also have visited the Saltus spa twice this year and been sorely disappointed 
Cold area to wait for treatments in February 
We asked for coffee and were told to go to the bar ourselves to order 
The area had decorators in at the time and the smell was overwhelming 
The spa was cold too
We gave them the benefit of the doubt and returned in spring 
Again the waiting area was cold 
Having a relaxing massage we could here kids shrieking in the pool area and other guests talking in the relaxation area waiting for treatments 
We then had lunch in the bar area with bento boxes 
Why on earth would we want to eat lunch out of a cardboard bento box
We were not on a picnic in a 4 * hotel?
Losing faith in what was our go to lodge

=== Loveliest hotel ever! ===
Three nights in this beautiful hotel, the location is fab, hotel staff were the best ever - nothing was too much trouble and they were always smiling.
The indoor pool was lovely and warm and everywhere in the spa was spotlessly clean.
Breakfast was delicious - plenty of choice and always hot, good choice on the continental too with fresh meats and pastries.  Evening meal freshly cooked and plenty of choice - I’d recommend the Duck … perfectly cooked !
Our room was spacious, comfortable and warm with lovely large towels which were changed daily.
We have passed this hotel regularly over the last 20+ years and finally managed a few days here and it didn’t disappoint.  Absolutely perfect.

=== Another great stay ===
Stayed once again in this beautiful hotel for three nights. Had many visits over the years and we are never disappointed. The staff are all friendly, smiling and welcoming. Another mention to Tom Pyke who is absolutely excellent at his job  (even if he is a Pompey fan 😂) and he remembered us from previous stays.  Also a well done to Jane who was at breakfast every morning, she’s lovely, working under pressure yet remains calm and unflappable.  

The bar has been renovated since we last stay and we loved it. Breakfast consistently good and we will be back again.

=== Bulmer Lawn Hotel Brockenhurst ===
We stayed in Lawn Lodge at The Bulmer Lawn Hotel
The second time we have stayed there and we have it booked again for next year.
Bulmer Lawn hotel is Beautiful and in the most Beautiful setting of The New Forest
If you want to take your four legged friend on holiday you couldn’t wish for a better place to stay 
The Hotel staff are always happy to help with anything and everything nothing is too much trouble 
Beautiful surroundings and does one of the best breakfasts we’ve had in any other hotels we have stayed

=== Excellent service and good food ===
After spending some time considering the various hotels in the Brockenhurst area, we chose the Balmer Lawn for our 3-night break and are so pleased that we did.  We received a warm, friendly and efficient welcome and were very pleased with our room which was on the second floor and had a large balcony overlooking the cricket pitch on the famous Balmer Lawn and the forest beyond where we regularly watched wild ponies and cattle passing by. Part of the reason for choosing the Balmer Lawn was for its 2 AA rosette restaurant, Beresford’s, as good food is an important part of any hotel stay for us.  Once again, we were not disappointed as the food was consistently delicious and well-presented befitting its 2 rosettes, and the service we received was truly excellent.  While the décor in the public areas could be considered slight quirky, the bar/lounge and restaurant areas all enjoy a relaxed and comfortable atmosphere thanks in the main part to the wonderful staff. Every single member of staff that we encountered was very friendly, kind, caring and cheerful while remaining appropriately professional.  All the staff appeared to really enjoy being there and nothing was too much trouble for any of them. We would like to particularly mention and thank Chloe from the restaurant team, who looked after us so well for a number of our meals during our stay. We would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel if you enjoy good food and excellent service.

=== Fabulous anniversary meal ===
Amazing meal tonight for our 10 th wedding anniversary, from the moment we walked through the doors the staff were amazing , ruby and  the blonde manger were exceptional along with a brunette lady who was based in the lodge who got our champagne , the steak melted in your mouth the attention to detail was exceptional and a lovely touch was you got to choose your own steak knife , we recently eat at a Michelin star restaurant and this was above that, we will definitely be returning and we our local but because it’s a hotel it isn’t somewhere we would normally look to eat , but not anymore we will be back and they are dog friendly

=== Wedding Party ===
My daughter Hayley and son in law James's 10 year anniversary held over 2 days for over 120 guests was absolutely perfect.  The hotel is stunning and the surrounding New Forest is the ideal location for a celebration.  The pool party was enjoyed by all, the food was exeptional.  Thanks from us all.

=== Not a 4 star hotel ===
I originally booked the deal with dinner but changed to 3 nights for 2 deal. The room no 51 was supposed to be superior but it wasn’t. It was tired and small.  The phone didn’t work.  Nothing superior about it. The bed wasn’t very comfortable.  

I regularly stay in good quality hotels and expect as a minimum an iron and ironing board. Bathrobe and slippers particularly if a spa hotel.  Toiletries including body lotion, not just unbranded shower gel and shampoo/conditioner which didn’t smell superior.

I could not fault the staff who were all welcoming and helpful.  

When I spoke to the manager to say that I was extremely disappointed with the room he explained that they were full but could move us the following day, which they did and Room 31 was what I would have expected for the rate, but again no robes or ironing board and had to request this from reception. 

The restaurant was good and food that we had was tasty.

Breakfast ok but staff need to ensure they are monitoring the food so guests don’t have to ask when items run out.  A coffee machine which offers a selection of coffee without extra charge would have been good.

A pleasant stay after the initial disappointment but if you are stating 4* then the little additional touches make all the difference to the customer experience and unfortunately they were lacking. 

The new forest is beautiful and the location of the hotel was good.

=== Nice but a bit pricey ===
Nice food and good service. Only 4 stars as not value for money, starters & desert were small and found it very expensive.

=== Great food, delicious.  Plus the GF options are amazing. Highly recommend. ===
A family mini break in the New Forest brought us to Brockenhurst.  As someone suffering from Coeliac disease, I travel with my own food to ensure no health issues.  However, we were recommended the Albero Italian restaurant and I cannot praise them enough.  Firstly the staff were friendly and attentive without being intrusive and the food prices are reasonable for the quality of food.  The gluten free pasta is EXCEPTIONAL.  Home made and absolutely delicious.  My ceoilac condition was taken seriously but not highlighted as "a problem".  I was not made to feel like the "awkward diner" and could enjoy most of the same food as my family could without making huge changes.  The other two members of our party also thoroughly enjoyed their (non GF) pizza and pasta meals.  Nothing was too much bother and the food was delicious.  Thank you Albero team.  Fabulous experience and delicious food.  We will recommend and we will be back.

=== Expensive food and not very well cooked ===
Prices are expensive for what you’re getting. I ordered a sea bass risotto and it wasn’t cooked properly : it wasn’t reduced like a risotto should be, with no creamy texture at all. It was like eating boiled rice. Fish was nice but it was £25. I wouldn’t return

=== A must for good foodies. ===
Love this restaurant, the food is amazing, the staff are lovely and the toilets are spotless!  Very nice ambience, found this little gem last year and couldn't wait to go back again at the weekend.

=== The best! ===
Friendly staff, lovely atmosphere and the food was just amazing!!!! The prawn and calamari starter was the best starter I have ever had and the pizzas were spot on! I even thought mine tasted better than thr pizza I had when I went to Italy! Thank you! We will be returning!

=== A very average pizzeria ===
Somewhat disappointed. We went for dinner after reading reviews which seemed quite good. We telephoned to make an early dinner reservation. There was some confusion over timing and doubt as to whether they could fit us in. However they did. The mystery is when we arrived the restaurant was half empty, and when we left it was still half empty! Service was good but that is all.

=== Great food - Really good value ===
This was our second visit here and both times we have been really impressed. We dined on a Friday night and were lucky to get the Window seat - really nice ambience in here.  

High quality food and really reasonable pricing in todays day and age - It was our daughters first time trying Carbonara and she loved it - decent size portion and it was well seasoned which is a bugbare of mine in a lot of restaurants and why I don't tend to order pasta dishes when dining out. 

I had the Polpettini Pizza which was delicious followed by the Pannacotta - Pictures attached - Really good food we will certainly be back.

=== Best meal we’ve had in a long time! ===
Visited yesterday evening for dinner. This was the best meal and restaurant experience we’ve had in a long time. The food was absolutely superb. Proper Italiano food at its best. All of our food was incredible but my sea bass main has to have a special shout out! Our 2 teenagers were also very pleased and particularly enjoyed their hot chocolate to finish!! Great service (harder to find these days) and the setting and ambiance was spot on too. Thank you for a very memorable evening!

=== Excellent all round experience ===
Wife and I had dinner there for anniversary on a Saturday night. Very welcoming on arrival, tables spaciously laid out giving a relaxed atmosphere . Service  was excellent throughout .  Menu selection was very good.  Food was extremely tasty. Would certainly eat there again and would recommend.

=== Family lunch. ===
WE went to thisItalian restaurant because we had recently had poor service at the Huntsman. The servie was excellent and the food was nice. We will definitely be going there again.

=== Nice visit. ===
Efficient and friendly service, decent food - tailored more so to the family diner. Good portions. Nice decoration and set up.

=== Great dinner ===
Lovely place, great food and price meet the expectations with quality, we've spent a birthday dinner there once and since then we always go there for other friends birthdays, staff welcoming and polite, very clean place

=== Husbands Birthday treat ===
Another lovely meal, we never go away disappointed. Always lovely, warm and friendly service, we can’t fault any of the team and the cheesecake was a lovely touch, thankyou. Hopefully we’ll be back soon. Thankyou and take care XX❤️

=== Great service, excellent food, everyone should visit! ===
We booked for lunch with very little notice & I can't speak highly enough of the attitude, welcome and overall service received. The food was excellent and it was a thoroughly enjoyable experience all round.

=== Best Authentic Italian restaurant in Hampshire ===
One of the best AUTHENTIC Italian restaurants in Hampshire! Everything is spot on, service, atmosphere, FOOOD!! One of the best pizza I have had! I am Italian, and I can guarantee that there is not another place as good as Albero in Hampshire!! 5 ⭐️

=== Great Italian Food and attentive service ===
Third visit , everything has been faultless from service , the waiting staff  really care , i had a simple carbonara this time and it was fantastic , the sauce was really thick and the guanciale amazing ,  great wines  and digestives  ( amaretto to finish )

=== Yes please. Lovely. ===
Super duper! We had pizza and calzone which were really great. Atmosphere was good, and service good too. I have a problem with the fact that there was a typo in the drinks menu (lemon ‘peal’), but I think that probably says more about me and my pedantry. Good vino to drink and some crazily good ice-cream for pud. All the girls working there were very sweet.  I’d return for the calzone alone. It was the stuff of dreams.

=== Brilliant Italian in Brockenhurst ===
We thoroughly enjoyed our evening. The staff were attentive without being intrusive and the food was excellent. Portions were generous (loads of prawns in the seafood pizza and extremely generous portions of ham hock in the calzone) - the latter was the best I've experienced! Drinks are a fair price and would totally recommend

=== Birthday lunch ===
Another lovely meal. Superb friendly service, faultless food and great atmosphere. Always enjoy coming and would highly recommend. We will see you soon. Thankyou X

=== Lovely evening ===
Fabulous evening. Lovely atmosphere. Good choice of menu and excellent food. Attentive and friendly staff. Felt good value for money.

=== Relaxing mini-break ===
We’ve just returned from three nights at Balmer Lawn and felt compelled to write a review as had a super experience there. All staff were friendly and went the extra mile. The room was large with huge emperor size bed and a balcony overlooking the forest. The breakfasts were also excellent. Highly recommend.

=== Lovely night away ===
We stayed for one night to celebrate my husband’s birthday! We were welcomed by a very friendly receptionist who was very helpful and told us how to walk to Brockenhurst village.  Once checked in we were pleasantly surprised to be find a plate with “happy birthday “ and accompanying truffles!!
We enjoyed pre-dinner drinks on the terrace bar before having dinner which was really nice and again the staff were amazing.

We will definitely be back.

=== Fabulous hotel with a superb restaurant  ===
We loved this hotel. The staff were brilliant, the room was great with a huge, comfortable bed and a view over the lawn where we regularly saw groups of New Forest Ponies. It's perfectly located, just outside the centre of Brockenhurst. Beresfords, the restaurant, is superb, so after the first of three nights, we decided to dine there every night. We thoroughly enjoyed trying the excellent dishes on the menu and specials list. The desserts were just sublime. We'll definitely return.

=== A wonderful stay at Balmer Lawns. ===
A wonderful stay at Balmer lawns would like to stay longer next time ,as we were there for 2nights.
The staff were so helpful and attentive ,from the reception team to the bar& restaurant staff.
Food was consistently good and at breakfast there was lots of choices..
The setting was beautiful and central to other places to visit.
Looking forward to our next visit.

=== A nice spa break that with a little improvement could be a REALLY nice spa beak. ===
The booking process was fantastic with a quick response and lots of helpful information offered throughout by Amy. I was really pleased with the DBB package price offered and it did prove good value for money. 

Parts of the hotel and room were tired but not hugely and it made little difference to our stay. 

The outdoor pool and indoor jacuzzi could have been a touch warmer which would have made us want to stay in them for longer, but it was still a nice spa area on a lovely summer day. My treatment was nice (Indian head and should massage), and my husband enjoyed his too, but I was disappointed when he told me that his full body massage hadn’t included his head,  face, chest or feet. Maybe I don’t know enough but I assumed “full body” would have included them…could be my mistake. 

The food was fantastic - like REALLY fantastic and the wine was reasonably priced and enjoyable. 

The service in the bar area was really slow but the staff were polite and friendly. 

Overall it stood out for its food and professional staff, and we had a nice time, but in my opinion it was not 4*

=== Weekend break ===
The location was very good. It was central to everywhere in the New Forest. The staff were friendly helpful they could not be faulted. We were there for two nights B+B, the breakfast was superb, plenty of choice. The rooms however varied an awful lot. Our first night was in a small double. The bed was so hard and uncomfortable we couldn’t sleep, the pillows was next to useless.The bathroom was tiny when sat on the loo your arm was resting on the sink nowhere else to put it. The shower was working but when in its holder only pointed to the taps would not reposition. In the morning we went to reception and passed on our comments. We told them we would be cutting short our stay. The receptionist was very quick to offer another room and an upgrade which we accepted. On arrival to our new room we was surprised at how different the rooms were. The view was overlooking a cricket field with horses roaming freely instead of to plastic sheep. The bed was comfortable the quilt was a much better quality, the room was a better size, roomy and not claustrophobic and the shower worked perfectly. We felt this room should have been the price of the first room. The first room was definitely not worth £200+ per night. The rooms are starting to look dated it’s a shame really. Lovely setting, great staff but overpriced.

=== Amazing place for break in New Forest ===
To be honest, the room was a bit dated, but all very clean and the bed was very comfortable. But what impressed to much was the staff and the food. Both so good. Staff were so on the ball, doing everything before you thought of it yourself. Really impressed. Food was amazing. We had 2 evening meals and both were so good. Indoor and outdoor pools both great. Fantastic location, views and grounds. Highly recommended.

=== Our Perfect July Wedding ===
From the moment we visited Balmer Lawn for a show round with Ruth, we knew it was the place to have our special day. Visiting one of the incredible wedding showcases and seeing the space set up as a beautiful wedding setting and being able to meet and speak to all the recommended suppliers made us even more secure in this decision.
We booked the Everything But The Dress package and were incredibly surprised at the value, convenience how much we could personalize the package to make the wedding of our dreams. We came across no other venues offering such a package, and cannot recommend it enough.
Meetings and communication with Ruth and the weddings team was so easy, with us feeling genuinely cared for and listened to every step along the way. We loved being able to meet up at the hotel to chat through plans and decisions, and also being able to visit on showcase days where we knew all our suppliers would be in one place. This made planning so easy, and took so much of the stress out of the wedding preparation process.
When our big day came around, from the moment myself and my bridal party arrived at the hotel the day before we were treated with so much care and made to feel so at ease. We were able to set things up in the wedding space, and start to see everything coming together. We then had dinner in The Lodge which was second to none – special thanks to our waiter Hilton who went above and beyond to cater for one of my bridesmaids dietary requirements, and sourced me a sausage to burry to give us good luck with the weather (which turned out perfect!). Also special thanks to Kiaran behind the bar who made us all the most incredible espresso martini shots, which even now people are taking about how good they were!
Our wedding day itself was perfect in every way, even down to the rain stopping just as the bridal party were just about to walk down the aisle. The pavilion and Beaulieu Room were both stunning, and our guests loved the garden games set up to play with throughout the day. The food and the service from the banqueting team with it were outstanding, and we had so many comments about the amazing quality of all of the food served. Special thanks to Briony and Sam who waited on us and the top table – they both made us feel so special.
We cannot recommend Balmer Lawn, and the EBTD package enough. All the people we worked with, be this at the hotel or the suppliers we have through the package were beyond compare, and all helped us bring our dream wedding to life. Thank you again to anyone and everyone who was involved with The Barton Wedding – you are all superstars. We’re so sad it’s all over now, but we cannot wait to see our stunning photos, and come back next year to celebrate our 1st anniversary!
Ann-Marie & Mike Barton

=== Great hotel for all ages, even one in a wheelchair! ===
We visited recently with 3 generations of family: grandparents in their 80s and one in a wheelchair, and parents of 2 teenage boys.
Never easy travelling with someone in a wheelchair, but all the staff at Balmer Lawn were so helpful and considerate. 
We had a really lovely time. Jane and the breakfast team always had our table ready (with a chair already taken away, to accommodate the wheelchair) and were always so thoughtful.
There was a slight blip with the lift, but again, the staff worked it out to enable dad to get up/down. 
They took on board our feedback about smoother ramps for wheelchair access and we really can't thank them enough for a special weekend, to celebrate an 80th birthday!

=== Perfect stay in New Forest! ===
Stayed at Balmer Lawn for two nights while in town for a friends wedding - and wow I loved this hotel! The grounds were gorgeous and perfectly kept (with lots of horse sightings - exciting for a New Yorker like me!), the rooms were perfectly decorated and comfortable, and the food was incredible. Probably the best hotel breakfast I've ever had. We dined at the restaurant for tea time (also a huge highlight! Left absolutely stuffed!) and for dinner, and found the meals to be fabulous. Big shout out to the staff, everyone was so kind and helpful. Would love to visit again!

=== A lovely night stay in August ===
As always I always got through trip advisor and immediately worry that I've a choice! This was totally wrong with this hotel. Don't read any negative reviews we had a really lovely stay! The hotel decor and location is beautiful. Staff are so friendly. The food was 10/10 including breakfast the scrambled egg was amazing! Just like we make it at home proper scrambled egg! We had steaks the night before and these were lovely! Fan already in the room which is a bonus for us and staff arranged an iron for us to borrow. The bed was comfortable and my daughter was extremely happy with her bunk bed! We used the indoor pool which was nice! Only regret is we did this as part of a trip so only had one night so didn't feel like we got to see the hotel as much as we could! The ponies at side of the hotel were a bonus!

=== Fantastic hotel ===
I treated my partner away to Balmer Lawn near to the end of July 2024. 

The hotel looks amazing and the grounds are stunning. You quite literally have wildlife directly in front of the hotel like horses and we even had a herd of cows march through! The location and building is absolutely perfect. 

We checked in and the highlight of the visit was the staff, they were polite, helpful and clearly wanted to be there and made such a great atmosphere. 

We had dinner in the restaurant, it was a little bit expensive but we were expecting it as it is an award winning restaurant. The food was well worth the price, it came out looking delicious and the taste was perfect. The dining experience really was a 10/10. 

The bar in the evening is also a fantastic venue, lovely, quiet and the drink choice is very good, rare to see a hotel with a pale ale on tap. Again, staff were attentive and couldn’t have done more for us. 

We did change rooms which was absolutely no hassle after a slight issue. We asked for a move and it was done with no hassle, no fuss and just an easy process and we are grateful for that. 

We did have an issue which we did raise when we left via email and Tom the Ops manager called us a few days later and was brilliant and clearly cared about us, if they wanted to the hotel could’ve just brushed it off but they wanted to make it right and did so. 

Fantastic hotel, lovely venue, great food and drinks, brilliant location and the highlight were the team working there. We very much look forward to returning.

=== Wonderful place for a wedding. ===
Balmer Lawn hotel hosted my daughter’s wedding. Family and friends stayed the weekend. Fantastic hotel with beautiful views. It is very child friendly with a kids games room with loads of things for them to do, and an indoor and outdoor pool. The outdoor pool was warm so it can be used even if the weather is cool.  All the staff are friendly, helpful and approachable.

=== Fantastic stay thanks to Jane ===
Another fantastic stay at Balmer Lawns   Had slight issue with room on the first night but we arrived late and just wanted to crash    spoke to Jane first thing in the morning and by the time we returned later that day we were moved to a more appropriate room (note avoid room 42 if you are a couple lol) Jane regularly checked in with us to make sure everything was okay and she couldn't have been more helpful she was amazing

=== I love this Hotel ===
Every time we visit we are met with smiling faces, excellent service and lovely food.
We have a large nervous dog and are always seated ( at our request) in the quietest spot.
This is a proper, old fashioned country hotel, with modern outside area.

=== Pleasant impromptu stay! ===
We went camping in our camper van and on the first night ate out at the Balmer Lawn. Whilst eating the heavens opened with rain and we decided not to go back to the campsite, but instead to stay the night as a room was available.
We have 2 electric bikes which were locked on to our van bike rack, but were very concerned regarding possible theft, as the lady at the campsite had told us that it was very common in that area and locks weren’t a deterrent.
The hotel has secure locking for bikes and Tom the operations manager was happy for us to store them there, which was a relief.
Overall I found the staff very customer focussed and helpful, which to us is the number one important thing with the hospitality industry. Yes service once might have been a bit slow, but because the staff were so charming not an issue.
We ended up staying at the hotel 3 nights as we liked it so much, with good spa amenities, both indoor and outdoor pool. Food was also very good, plus location on the edge of the New Forest, with trails from the hotel. Will definitely be going back some day.

Simon & Jane alias the soggy campers.

=== Brock Primary  School Summer Party ===
Had our end of term summer party at The Balmer Lawn and it was just perfect. The food, setting and service were absolutely great and I would highly recommend. The events manager kindly continued the serving of Pizzas past the normal time to fit in with us.

=== Great hotel..lovely staff but very hot room ===
Another 3 night stay. Last time was over 10 years ago.
Our room overlooked a brick wall but we weren’t staying in the room to look out of the window so didn’t matter to us altho I’ve send complaints about the view lol
Amazing breakfast choice..too much in fact…Jane and the other lady were very very lovely.
Incredible evening meal and young Denel was so professional ..very impressed.
The only complaints..if that..we ordered drinks in the evening one day ..the drinks were not available and when the young waitress came back And apologised and took an amended order it took about a good 5 minutes for them to arrive. The young girl behind the bar seemed to be serving the main dining room and the bar areas on her own…so lack of staff I would have said.
And the room..was so hot. Must be fab in the winter but not in the summer( and it wasn’t on the heat wave days). We had all the windows open and they do supply a fan which we had running all night…in the end we had to take the duvet (10tog) out of the cover and just have the cover on us. 
A great hotel and fab location to get out and about. Would recommend .

=== Avoid this place like the plague. ===
Having stayed at the Balmer Lawn on and off for the last 25+ years, we were looking forward to another stay here, especially as the photographs on the website showed that the outside space had now become more of a drinking and eating area, no doubt an expansion on what happened during the pandemic.

We booked 2 rooms, 1 a standard room, another one of their superior rooms.

Upon arrival, we were asked to pay in full for both rooms – that always strikes me as a bit odd – do they think we would run off, or worse, leave if the rooms were not as expected?  Anyway, duly paid, we went to our rooms.  First, the standard room.  Room 1, on the first floor, just outside the lift, was very small, the view was of a brick wall, and the room was incredibly hot – and this was not even a particularly hot day.  The giant fan did little to help.

The superior room was not very superior.  Room 25, located on the 2nd floor, at the back of the hotel, overlooks the roof of the spa, and a view to a bit of the outdoor pool.  The room is very tired and does not live up to the description or photographs on the website.  Stained carpet, worn headboard where guests’ heads have rubbed there over the years (yuk!), cheap Ikea furniture with bubbling veneer, filthy window frames, a useless shower of a small bath, the bathroom shelf over the toilet (watch out in case anything falls off the shelf), terrible scratchy old towels, uncomfortable beds.

There has been a change to the carpets in the hotel, drab grey makes the whole place look corporate and cheap.  

We ordered a bottle of champagne – at £155 a bottle, they didn’t even have in refrigerated.  No thanks.

We had dinner in the main restaurants on both nights – looking forward to it with their much hyped 2 AA rosettes.  Another mistake.  A poor bistro type menu, no nods to anything remotely fine dining.  Overcooked steaks, undercooked lamb, miserable portions, under seasoned… Awful.  Breakfast is another disaster.  A bunfight with a buffet for cooked items.  Greasy bacon, and those scrambled eggs – like powdered, insipid dust, hardly yellow in colour.  Probably the very worst scrambled eggs in the UK.  A note to the chef here – have you no shame?  In fact, to the hotel owners and managers – try staying here yourselves with a view to being a guest.  

The spa has an indoor and outdoor pool.  Both heated (by a candle judging by the chilliness of the water in both) and the jacuzzi was out of action.  Again, horrible tatty towels to use.

This 4-star hotel used to be quite good, and the restaurant used to be very good.  But now it’s just another flea-bitten hole, trading on past glories, with tired staff, tired rooms and tired facilities.  Avoid this place like the plague.

=== Fantastic night at the Balmer Lawn Hotel ===
Attended the Balmer Lawn for our end of term summer party last night. The hotel hosted 25 of us. The staff bent over backwards to ensure our evening was a success and made us feel very welcome. Great food, delicious wine and a lovely atmosphere sitting in the tented eating area.

=== Great time  ===
First time here whilst staying locally . Fantastic find , food was plentiful and tasty. Service was good attentive but not in your face .

=== One of the best pizza Italian restaurants you'll find ===
Staff couldn't be more helpful when booking, we were 6 adults and 4 children with 2 of them under 4. Issue is allergies for 2 of the elder children. Staff were brilliant and couldn't be more helpful.
Lovely atmosphere, great bottle of red (Primitivo Puglia ) and some wonderful food. Got to say the Chitarra Arrabbiata is to die for. 
If you have allergies, this is the place to eat, you won't be disappointed. Couldn't recommend high enough.

=== Fantastic! ===
Wonderful lunch, the food is really good. We have been coming here over the last 6 years and will continue to return. Delicious and good service!

=== Delicious Italian Food ===
We were fortunate enough for it to be still warm in October to be able to sit outside with our dog. We had a a really good meal,  one pasta the other chicken parmigiana, and a delicious bottle of Montepulciano. Good service, friendly staff, thouroughly reccomend!

=== Good Choice ===
A pleasant room with good service and a fine kitchen team. 
Olives and a shared bruschetta made a good starter, followed by spaghetti bolognese (very good) and fettuccine with king prawns and calamari (outstanding).

Laten we positief beginnen: de dame in de bediening is super vriendelijk en je zit er prima. Maar......het eten heeft niets met Italie te maken. Geen of de verkeerde kruiden worden gebruikt. Ik zou een deurtje verder gaan.

=== We will be back ===
Authentic Italian. Immaculate everything and the food was divine! Bruschetta is two pieces of homemade bred so that is a lunch in itself. But I ordered carbonara and although I couldn’t finish it, it was lush. Really lovely staff and toilets super nice and fresh. Cannot fault it!!  Thank you for a lovely afternoon!!

=== Fresh and tasty Italian food ===
Lovely fresh and tasty food was had. Went with my mum and had a great time chilling over good food. 

Sauces were lovely and the olives to die for. 

It was very quiet as we were the only
Two in there but you could put that down to the fact it was on a Monday for lunch. Made easier as there is parking at the back. 

Will definitely return.

=== What a find! ===
Fabulous fresh authentic Italian food and wonderful service too.  We were looked after by Martina and Slavi who did an amazing job to help make our evening relaxed and so enjoyable.  Highly recommend stopping here to eat.  Great quality, tasted gorgeous and a lovely place to enjoy food as a couple, with company, friends or family.  Absolutely will return here as soon as we get the opportunity.  Restaurant was clean, tidy, welcoming and they have outside seating too.

=== Lovely Italian restaurant ===
We visited Albero's during a recent holiday in the New Forest. The food was delicious and the restaurant had a lovely ambience. The staff were all really friendly and efficient. We enjoyed it so much that we made a second visit there on the last night of our holiday. We wish we had an Albero near us!

=== SUPER ITALIAN RESTAURANT - WONDERFUL FOOD ===
This is the best Italian Restaurant we have ever been to, the atmosphere is really relaxing and the staff are really attentive and friendly and service is very prompt.
We had various dishes and each one was outstanding. Superb ingredients  and fantastic meals. So good in fact that we had our evening meal there 3 times in one week.

=== Lovely place and pizza ===
Beautiful ambience great pizza , friendly staff and dog friendly in the outside area , highly recommended… prices are also in line with the cost of life, quite fair.

=== Great pizza ===
We had a great meal at Albero.
We had the sharing platter which had a great selection of meats and cheeses. We then both had the Diavola pizza which was amongst the best I have had for a long time. The kids meals were both large and went down very well, as did the ice cream!
Only niggle was it took a long time for our main course to arrive, but this was probably due to us asking for the kids mains to come with our starter.
Would certainly recommend - and book ahead as we saw lots of passing trade turned away as it was full. Clearly a popular spot!

=== New forest Pizza  ===
I wish we had an Albero near us !! 
Such a lovely atmosphere and ambience. Food was delicious and as I could finish my amazing pizza was offered a box to take out . Seriously good pizza and pasta . 
Staff were very friendly and helpful.

=== Delicious!! ===
Lovely restaurant with a very welcoming and friendly atmosphere and service. We stumbled upon this gem and they accommodated us (table of 7) without a booking. 
Great for children and those with intolerances, checking with the chef to ensure that our needs were met. 
Such amazing food! Definitely recommend!

=== Treat day  ===
Another great visit, fantastic food, amazing service as usual. Lovely to have a chat and catch up, we will be back again soon X

=== Nice restaurant dogs allowed outside ===
We were staying at a hotel nearby and wanted to find a nice restaurant which allowed dogs. We thought dogs were allowed inside but this wasn’t the case. Luckily it was a nice afternoon so we were able to sit outside. Food was nice, served relatively quickly and the service was first class.

=== Lovely midweek lunch ===
We visited midweek for lunch so it was very quiet, but we still had a great experience. The menu is on the more expensive side compared to some places, but everything is clearly very authentic and all of our meals were amazing. Our waitress was very sweet and attentive.

=== Really bad first impression, wouldn’t return.  ===
I went on a Saturday night looking for a table for one just before 6pm. I hadn’t made a booking and asked if they had a table. The waitress went to check with the manager and then told me I could sit on a table for four but i would have to leave in just over an hour as they needed the table back. I was a bit disconcerted but agreed as I assumed they had decided they could accommodate me. I made the effort to choose my dishes quickly, and after a few minutes the manager came over to take my order. I started speaking and asked for my starter then said “and for main”, then was interrupted mid sentence by the manager saying “no. You can’t have a starter and a main. I can bring everything together if you want but I can’t do a starter and a main for you as we need you to leave by quarter to seven”. I said “Ok, don’t worry about it then, I will go somewhere else” and she replied “well it is Saturday night, its a busy night”. I responded, “I know, but if you don’t have a table then just tell me you don’t have a table”. I then left and easily found another great restaurant who had space for me. 

I was really disappointed that in the interests of money grabbing another customer the wait staff would behave this way. The menu looked great but wasn’t cheap - my starter was £10.50 and my main £20. I don’t expect to sit down to a meal in a nice restaurant and be treated like i am taking someone else’s spot and need to hurry up and leave, nor indeed that i would be interrupted mid sentence and told that I could not have my meal the normal way. I come to eat out on my own to relax. 

The New Forest is full of fabulous restaurants. I visit a nearby equestrian venue every year, and I now will never return to Albero Italian after this experience. There is no need when I can easily find another great restaurant where the staff have a better attitude towards their customers. I would have had no problem if I had been told that unfortunately they were fully booked, and might have tried again next time. Now, certainly not. It is never a good idea to make one customer feel like less than another.

=== Very good ===
We were staying nearby and the reviews looked good, so we booked the Albero.

It was busy for a Tuesday evening, but the staff were very friendly and efficient.

Loved the food and I can recommend the Pollo Dolcelatte and the Panacotta.

Most of the customers seemd to be local and repeat visitors, which is always a good sign

=== Good Italian food in a lovely setting ===
A very enjoyable and relaxing evening, with a good choice of Italian dishes and drinks. Friendly serving staff made for a relaxing evening out.

Excellent service and even better food!! The portions were more than enough (may of needed to take some home with us). The 2 waitresses were excellent, my girlfriend is pregnant and we weren't sure what she could / couldn't have but the waitress looked up every recipe and recommended which ones were fine to have. I would definitely visit again

=== Great food, great service ===
Absolutely brilliant restaurant. The food is so good, really tasty. The service is great too. Our waitress was really kind and helpful and the manageress was professional to the core as well as extremely personable and kind. The way a restaurant deals with issues is a mark of the restaurant and Albero gets absolutely top marks. Will definitely visit again.

Found this place by chance on a quick visit to brockenhurst and decided to give it a go. The food was really nice and the staff were super friendly. Word of warning the pizzas are massive (and super tasty) so only have one to yourself if you’re really hungry!

Lovely, friendly and obviously strive to make your visit as lovely as they are. Thankyou all, look forward to our next visit xx

Saturday afternoon lunch at short notice. Beautiful space, Sat by the window. Ordered the porchetta starter, pizzas and a bottle of Mascalese , very reasonably priced wine. The wine was fresh and fruity, the porchetta was tasty and had a fresh herb pesto. The pizzas were amazing, crispy charred and flavoursome crust, tomato sauce delicious and the topping were quality! The service was attentive, friendly and delightful. Great relaxing lunch!

=== Bravo on all fronts - food, service and setting ===
Our first visit to this interesting Italian restaurant. An imaginative menu with stand out salad selection which is all too rare. Tempting pizza and pasta dishes (which we look forward to sampling in the future) but we couldn't resist the pork belly special in a rich jus which was perfectly prepared and presented. This is an establishment that takes pride in the overall experience - food, service and setting. Warm congratulations to the whole team and special thanks to chef for our distinctive main course and the multidimensional fig salad, so good it will be a main course next time, not just a starter. Our pizzas were also excellent. My other half had the pizza Verde and I had a calzone - mmmm

My wife and I ate at Albero on our first night in Brockenhurst. The restaurant has a nice atmosphere and we both loved our pasta dishes - I had the carbonara while my wife ordered the bolognese. We waited about ten minutes to have our order taken at the start of the meal, and then the starters and mains were served a little too quickly for our liking, although service on the whole was very friendly. We’d happily eat here again despite a few issues.

=== Fantastic. ===
We stay in brockenhurst every few years and have never tried this restaurant so decided to try it this visit.
Very friendly & welcoming, full on a Sunday night so shows it’s popular, lovely fresh fish starter & best pizzas we have eaten for dinner. Nice to be able to get a carafe of wine too, will definitely be back on our next visit.

=== Great Italian meal  ===
Surprised to find the restaurant wasn't full on a BH Friday evening  - food and service were superb. Prices were reasonable, considering how expensive everything is at the moment. Take care in the car park  - it's quite small & not everyone parks considerately.

A authentic Italian that didn’t disappoint possibly one of the best Italian meals I’ve ever had, great atmosphere and great service, very clean and well laid out, will definitely be coming back

Always found the service friendly and the fact they open lunchtimes is a bonus. We will be back!

=== Excellent Italian ===
A delightful and friendly Italian restaurant with fantastic restaurant, food and staff -  thank you

=== Little Gem! ===

If you're in Brockenhurst & want to eat good Italian food, go to this restaurant. Highly recommended.

=== Amazing food ===
I have to say having sampled a few restaurants in brockenhurst this week.  Please please go see these guys.  Authentic Italian cuisine at its best, amazing atmosphere and friendly staff that nothing is too much.

=== Excellent meal ===
An excellent meal in a friendly and welcoming Italian Restaurant.

=== Well worth a visit ===
Excellent food and service in pleasant surroundings. Nice big garden with its own outside bar nice way to spend a sunny evening

The Snake catcher is well-known in the area for having friendly staff, a superb range of drinks and a great food menu. The efficiency of the staff, especially when clearly very busy, is admirable. Having left the Filly who had NO FOOD FOR WALKINS we walked to the Snakecatcher.  Very nice welcome . Very busy, happy staff and delicious food.Perhaps they could train the staff at The Filly.
Thankyou Snakecatcher

Sat in the pleasant beer garden.

Had a certain expectation as we had a ‘pub lunch’ previously, but sadly it didn’t live up to it. Hot starter was brought out before my wife had brought back our 2 drinks (& ordered the food at the same time I’ll add). Was looking forward to a nice pub Sunday lunch….
Beef was dry & chewy, severely over cooked (if not re-used) veg. 
Great looking pub, friendly staff - poor food.
Sorry I know the industry is struggling but if you can’t cook it - don’t serve it.

=== Terrible customer service ===
We booked a table a couple of days in advance to visit on a Sunday evening.  On arrival there were about 5 people standing around the bar, none of them seeming particularly interested in serving/speaking to us. I advised we had a booking, a chap disappeared came back and without really directing his conversation to us mentioned a table number.  As another couple of people had entered the bar I was unsure whether he was speaking to us or them, either way he did not show us (or them) to a table.  We therefore decided to go to the table and as it was empty sat down.  We waited for someone to come and at least take a drinks order, but nothing. After around 5/10 mins we went to the bar to get a drink and was advised to place our food order at the bar. I was surprised about this as I had heard a bar person/waitress take a dessert order from another table.  Nonetheless we sat back down and looked at the menu.  Another couple arrived a few mins later and were directed to a table and told it was table service.  I checked with the couple as this was contrary to what we had been told.  They were definite they had been told table service.  I queued for a bit to try and query why we were not given table service but others around us were, but by this time the place was getting busy and there were several people ahead of me.  As I'd already spent half an hour getting more and more frustrated we decided to leave.  I therefore cannot comment on the standard of the food but the standard of the customer service was extremely poor.

=== An unsmiling, unhappy experience. ===
Phoned to book an quick early dinner for me and my two children and was told “all tables reserved but you can wait in the bar for a table.” Fair enough, so we turned up to a half-empty pub (lots of tables were reserved but not until much later - they were still empty when we left). We sat down in the bar area. 

Went to order at the bar, which was also empty, and was ignored by the girl behind the bar while she idly flicked through the reservations book. She finally, unsmilingly, took my order which was later delivered by another unsmiling member of staff, who didn’t say a word, didn’t ask if we would like any sauces etc and forgot the cutlery. When I caught up with her and politely asked if she could bring some, the response was again delivered with a side-helping of misery and no apology.

A huge huge thankyou to everyone today. My partner and I visited for his birthday and stayed for lunch. The food was absolutely delicious and the staff are just so warm friendly welcoming and bubbly.

I would definitely recommend a visit

Had a really good fillet steak…one you cook yourself on a sizzling hot slate with side salad and sauté new potatoes.Would highly recommend…has two gardens and an Italian restaurant next door

The management and staff are very friendly and professional. They looked after us well and the food was delicious and wow portion wise couldn’t be faulted. We will be back very soon.

Amazing food with first-class customer service. Please ignore any negative reviews as the Snakecatcher is honestly the best gastropub we have ever been to. The menu is superb, the actual food is deliciously 5-star plus and the service is exemplary As locals, we have been using the Snakecatcher every week for the last 15 years and have only ever received excellent service and delicious food.

Worst experience ever, no customer service manager had a bad attitude, policy that a table of 8 or more cannot order from the specials! Genuinely good pub food plus specials. Well prepared and tasty food served in a friendly environment. Very popular Fridays and weekends recommend you book n advance to avoid disappointment.

=== Snakecatcher Saturday dinner ===
Went on a warm sunny Saturday evening without reserving a table. Staff were very helpful and found us a table. Food was gorgeous, well priced and we didn't have to wait long at all. Lovely evening!

=== Go out for a meal and cook yourself ===
Garden is good atmosphere but shame about the food first time I’ve been and will be the last, went on intentions of having steak to be told the kitchen can’t cook it I have to cook it myself nice novelty but if you go out for dinner I like to be the one not cooking specially what they want to charge for the steaks, I went for the pie of the day 3 measly bits of chicken in it with the smallest bit of pasty bits on the top that disappeared like candy floss when I poured the gravy, nobody came over to ask how the food was I’m guessing they couldn’t care either

=== Not a chicken breast burger but a slice or chicken breast ===
Very disappointed with the chicken burger. 
The description of the chicken burger says “chicken breast marinated in BBQ sauce, smoked pancetta, melted cheddar, baby gem lettuce, tomato & onion”
I don’t think I have eaten out anywhere that would describe this but then put a thin slice of chicken breast in the bun! 
Im well aware that it makes the burger bun quite tricky to navigate around but this is unacceptable to serve a slice rather than the “chicken breast” as advertised. 
Well I can say that we just won’t visit this venue again or I would avoid this meal as it’s not worth the £14.90. Another example of venues finding ways to stretch out food and make more money.

=== Amazing vegan food ===
We popped by the Snakecatcher on a beautiful Sunday afternoon and had a vegan tortellini and the only words to describe this is amazing. The staff were friendly and it was lovely sitting in the garden while eating their amazing food. Definitely well worth a visit.

=== Catch of the Day!! ===
Visited the Snakecatcher having reviewed its interesting menu selection on the internet. We were not disappointed. The sizzling steak cooked on a hot stone was amazing, so much so that it set off the fire alarm and the Countryman skewer from the field was outstanding in presentation alone. Suffice to say delicious food, well presented, friendly helpful staff and good beer. If you are in Brockenhurst don’t miss it!

=== Great location, lovely meal with friends and attentive staff ===
Visited as a group of 14 for lunch on Bank Holiday weekend.  Portion sizes were great, Sunday roast was delicious, good selection of beers and ciders, big garden with great play area for the kids.

=== Lazy bland pub food ===
An unfortunately poor main meal with cheap wine that we ended up leaving. 

In fairness we had a nice couple of drinks to start and a good starter and we should have left there. 

The mains were sloppily put together with burnt chips and little thought to flavours. The chicken was rubbery and the toppings were just thrown on and shown a bit of heat.
The wine was so cheap and sour we didn’t finish a glass.

Real shame.

I’d give it a miss again.

=== Good quality food ===
A very smart pub serving an excellent selection of very good quality food. The staff were very accommodating and friendly to both us and our dog.

=== Good for a sunny afternoon ===
Went here on bank holiday afternoon, really good outdoor area and great play area for kids. Highly recommend this place for drinks, not sure about food as we didn’t eat but it looked good!

=== Excellent food and good atmosphere ===
Exceeded our high expectations. Coming from America as a frequent visitor to the UK it's rare to find a steak we like. This was one of the best UK steaks we've had! Fish and chips were EXCELLENT, moist on the inside crisp on the outside. Right up there with the best fish and chips ever. Kids really enjoyed the pizza. Other members of our party enjoyed the venison and the scampi as well. Food came quickly as well which always lifts my review higher as well. Would definitely come back.

=== So good again ===
Brilliant as always and large portions . Lovely atmosphere and friendly staff. Would highly recommend

=== Great Pub ===
Dropped in for a few drinks, great selection of beer and really friendly staff, could not complain at all, will definitely be back.

=== Fantastic service ===
Came in for dessert. Beautifully presented and tasted lovely. Tables and cutlery all clean.
Staff all looked smart, professional and friendly.
Lovely place to visit.

=== What a great surprise ===
Went in for a quick pint with the wife and our 2 dogs on a Tuesday lunchtime. Decided to look at the menu and was pleasantly surprised how good it all looked. I had the countryman skewer and it was fantastic. 
Will definitely come back when in the area and would definitely recommend this pub.

=== Large Mother’s Day meal, Catcher gone down hill. ===
Have eaten here in the past and was impressed.
Having just had a family meal here, The establishment has gone down hill and hiked its prices and vastly reduced portion sizes. One meal got forgotten, Complaints were raised to the amount of fish served for the nearly £40 shared sizzler platter. More was then served. Out of our price range now despite being local all my life, Let’s hope the tourists will pay the price.

=== Great Staff! Great food! ===
I visited this beautiful establishment in the early evening of March. The staff were very polite and quick with serving myself and my partner. Everything was very clean and satisfactory. One waitress was very kind and food was splendid! Will definitely be visiting again as it is the best pub in Brockenhurst. The huntsman however, was very poor service. 

Thank you!

=== Excellent dog friendly pub with a great play area ===
Lovely place to stop for a pint and something to eat. We had a lovely sandwich and pint each. Its great for families as the play area is new and modern.

=== Perfect Country Pub ===
Was seeking a nice meal in a country pub whilst away on a work trip - lots of choice in the area but all with the same old menu! The Snakecatcher's menu caught my eye as they serve sizzling rocks - so nice to see something different! I had a starter off the specials menu and surf and turf for a main - absolutely beautiful with lots of flavour. Very quiet but it was midweek - plenty of room to sit and eat

=== The perfect date night! ===
Snakecatcher is a gorgeous little pub, with absolutely incredible food. We visited here after a walk and had the olives & houmus which were a delight. We came back for a date night to experience more. The cook your own steaks are super fun and you can tell the meat is of very good standard! The sides were so tasty as well.  We really enjoyed our time here, paired with lovely wine, would fully recommend to anyone!

=== Traditional, friendly pub with good pub classics. ===
