I visited twice for lunch while staying in Brockenhurst. The pub is comfortable and clean with good beers and good service. I just had sandwiches there, which were tasty and well presented.

=== Great pub ===
There was a large group of us including children plus dog, staff were very welcoming and friendly especially to our furry friend. Nice bar area, had lunch and portions were huge and food was tasty and well presented. Kids loved the outside play area. Recommend.

=== Very friendly, excellent menu, great place for friends and families! ===
Staff were very friendly and welcoming. Good food at affordable prices and a great choice of drinks, all served with a smile! A breath of fresh air, we will definitely visit again

=== Saturday afternoon lunch ===
Very slow service, one drink never arrived had to collect it  from the bar. Ordered a  shared starter, arrived promptly and tasted great, but arrived with some tea plates and some dinner plates, very odd! . They forgot to take our order for mains. When our meals eventually arrived. I think they were cooked and plated by teenagers, not the usual standard. They never asked if we’d like more drinks. A very large table of extremely loud  kids and adults sat next to us. They were up and down from the table knocking my chair and bag to the floor each time. Even though the rugby was on the tv and people were excited about that the next table was even louder than the cheering.

=== Legendary bore sausages ===
On a cold February day you wish for two things a roaring log fire and good simple food. In the snake-catcher you will find both, combined with fabulous photos and history of the man Brusher Mills who the name of the pub. Don’t miss the opportunity to order wild bore.

=== Disappointing! ===
Booked a table for two. Arrived @ 1345 for Sunday Lunch. The pub was busy and felt unsettling, almost chaotic! The staff were moving around like headless chickens! The only meat available was Beef! This was tough as old boots! Later I overheard that the kitchen had even run out of roast potatoes @ 1430!
The Manager “Marko”? Needs to get a grip!
Wished we had gone to Toby Carvery, Hinton for better value and better choice!

=== Best. Gravy. Ever. ===
Outstanding value. Good beers. The best sausages and mash I’ve ever had (in no small part thanks to the epic gravy!) and friendly service.

=== Judge for yourself. ===
After reading the reviews left for the Snakecatcher we almost went elsewhere. However, a sharing plate of Nachos with Chilli enticed us in and we are glad that it did.
The staff were friendly and welcoming from the moment we entered. The food was very good, as was the service.
We would not hesitate to recommend this pub.

=== Surely beat pub in new forest ? ===
Well I do not know where to start . Fantastic all round. Staff attentive and extremely friendly. We have a mildly large American Akita dog . Well you would think royalty had arrived on a busy Friday evening. Nothing was too much trouble , staff were excellent and food was more then decent for pub grub  our dog loved the place. Smashing pub and highly recommended. I will be amazed if I find a more welcoming pub than this on our trip. Well done all at snake catchers

=== MR Rob Hodges ===
Fantastic food, very good portion sizes 
Very good value for money 
Friendly staff 
Would highly recommend 👍

=== WOW! What a wedding! ===
My husband and I got married at Balmer Lawn over the May Bank Holiday this year. An unforgettable day. We knew as soon as we visited Balmer Lawn and met Ruth the wedding planner, who has supported us all the way through and always been there for us. She is an asset to the venue. We booked the Everything but the Dress Package which included the most incredible team of suppliers and the whole process was so easy we were worried we weren't stressed enough!! 
The staff at the venue who ran the day were the friendliest you could wish for who went above and beyond for us, as did the suppliers. 
We will be recommending Balmer Lawn to any couples we speak to and will look forward to coming back to celebrate our first anniversary!!

=== Amazing staff, great location,  delicious food... ===
Afternoon tea....wonderful staff,  exceptional service, delicious food....what more could you ask for....time spent with family, priceless ❤️

=== Excellent , comfortable hotel in lovely Forest location ===
We stayed last week for 3 nights. We were very pleased with everything. Our room was very comfortable and had a view looking out to the forest. We were pleased to have a walk-in shower. The breakfast's offered a good selection to choose from, which we had in the Beresford restaurant. We also ate in there on two evenings and the menu had a good choice . The team, who were there at breakfast time and in the evenings, were most pleasant and helpful. This was the case with those who were in the bar/lounge area and in the outside area, as well.

=== Excellent dinner ===
Wonderful setting in the New Forest - excellent dinner (calamari & pork belly bites nibbles plus duo of lamb & pan fried sea bass) both the food and the service were  exceptional & the strawberry mouse pudding was a work of art - 5 stars

We will definitely be back 🤩

=== Poor ===
We paid £317 for a one night stay at this hotel recommended by friends.  The room was small, filled with heavy old fashioned wooden furniture, dated and the small window allowed us a view of brick walls and a roof. There was no full length dressing mirror. We couldn’t see any grass never mind a cricket pitch. We know what time the occupant upstairs went to bed, that they got up twice in the night and rose at 6.45 on Saturday morning for a shower. We did not hear footsteps only very squeaky floorboards right above our bed. A floor tile in the bathroom, in front of the sink was broken in two and thankfully due to my quick reaction I averted what could have been a very serious cut to my foot. We covered the tile immediately with the bath mat to avoid an accident. There were no tissues no cotton wool or similar toiletries and no shaving mirror. The plug device in the sink was not working. Breakfast was not included in the room rate we paid. Premier Inn do a better job.

=== Disappointing and over priced ===
We booked a luxury room for three nights. The staff on arrival were friendly. The room was a good size with a balcony, but was drab with mismatched, tired, furniture. The bathroom was cramped and far from luxurious. It was also incredibly hot despite the cool weather. We had to keep both sets of doors open all night (one set didn’t lock anyway). The outdoor pool was closed for our entire stay - chlorine issues we were told. As the weather was cool it wasn’t an issue but would have been disappointing had it been warm. The indoor pool is small and dated with only 6 chairs. The jacuzzi was out of order. The food was good although I’ve had better breakfast buffets. All in all, we were disappointed. We have stayed in four star hotels around the UK and abroad, and The Balmer Lawn does not compare favourably. It is overpriced and needs a lot of updating.

=== Rather dated and not as described ===
I booked the Balmer Lawn Hotel last minute as a treat for my grandson. Having visited several hotels in the area, I chose this one because it was described as having individually styled and contemporary rooms, and it also has an outdoor pool. Additionally, it is close to Beaulieu, which I wanted to visit.

Upon arrival, I was informed that the outdoor pool was closed due to issues. This was disappointing, as it was the main reason for my booking. However, reception assured me they were working on it and would keep me informed.

Our initial impressions of the lobby and downstairs dining area were that the building has potential, but the decor is rather cheap-looking, reminiscent of 'The Range' or 'Dunelm.' This might be acceptable elsewhere but not for a hotel that advertises itself as a 4-star 'LUXURY ESTABLISHMENT.' A cohesive update would be beneficial.

To reach our room on the third floor, we took the lift, which was not a good first impression. The lift door was covered in rust and needed a deep clean. After dropping off our bags, we opted to use the stairs, which were much more pleasant.

I had booked a superior room and was given number 54. While the room was fairly large, it was very dated and drab. Striped dark wallpaper and worn laminate bedside tables did not scream luxury. The black plastic headboard, drab dark striped carpet, and cheap-looking curtains were not welcoming. The radiator covers were also rusted. The bathroom was clean with fairly contemporary tiles, but the fixtures were worn, with the chrome finishing worn away. Additionally, the sink was not properly attached to the stand and was coming away.

The twin beds were hard and very small, causing my grandson to worry about falling off during the night. The pillows were hard and past their prime, and the towels were thin, not indicative of a 4-star establishment.

On the plus side, the outdoor seating bar area is pleasant and welcoming, overlooking the cricket pitch with New Forest ponies wandering across. Most of the staff are lovely and very helpful. The bar snacks are good, and my grandson enjoyed his mocktail.

After returning from Beaulieu, we found the pool issue had been addressed, and it was open, so we used it for the remainder of the afternoon (approximately 1 hour from 5-6pm).

Dinner was good; I had the special of skate wing, which was fresh and wholesome but would have benefitted from a sauce to enhance its flavor. My grandson enjoyed his burger and fries immensely.

Breakfast, however, left much to be desired. It was buffet-style, with fried eggs, bacon, mushrooms, etc., all of which were cold. I asked for poached eggs, which also arrived cold. The bread was of poor quality, akin to what you find in cheap supermarkets. The only redeeming factor was the fresh fruit salad. I asked for a cappuccino made with oat milk twice and eventually gave up, asking for it to be taken off my bill.

Overall, my experience was disappointingly lukewarm. I'm glad it was my grandson and not my partner I brought here, as he is thirteen and didn’t have high expectations. I, on the other hand, believe this hotel has a lot to improve and I am unsure how it has achieved a 4-star listing. My suggestion to management is to look at hotels like 'The Gallivant' or 'The George' in Rye, both of which are excellent and where I have previously stayed. For comparisons regarding spa hotels, Carys Manor down the road and the Nici in Bournemouth are worth looking at, both of which I have also stayed at.

=== A few days away ===
We stayed in room 45 and it was perfect for us and our small dog… the hotel, the staff and the food were incredible..we couldn’t have asked for better.. this was our second time at the hotel and it’s our favourite by a mile.. the location and the surrounding countryside plus the river is a huge plus..

=== Lovely hotel in beautiful surroundings. ===
Just had a nice relaxing stay at this hotel. It is set in a lovely location and the staff were very welcoming and helpful. We stayed 3 nights in a superior room on the second floor. The room was clean and comfortable with good views across the forest area.  There was a fridge in the room which was useful plus tea and coffee making facilities. Towelling robes in wardrobe .
The room did seem to retain the heat despite having the windows open and there is no AC so we had to make use of the fan provided which was fine.
We found the bed to be comfortable. 
The bathroom has a walk in shower which was ideal for us due to some mobility difficulties. However we did encounter problems when using the shower. First of all the water pressure is quite weak but on consideration this may be a good thing because the drain doesn't seem adequate and we ended up with quite a puddle on the bathroom floor to mop up each time we showered. Also the hot water takes a fair while to come through  and getting the right temperature is definitely a skill so patience is required .
There are dispensers on the wall for shower gel and shampoo plus hand soap dispenser by the sink and I must say I really liked the smell of these toiletries.  Wish I knew what the scent was so I could buy some at home.
We used the pool on one occasion but  its quite small so not suitable for a serious swim. Husband enjoyed using the sauna. Jacuzzi was not working.
There are lockers to use for personal items while using the leisure facilities.
There are plenty of areas where you can find a comfy chair to sit and read a book while having a cuppa. 
Breakfasts were lovely. Lots of choice so its tempting to eat more than one normally would. ( back on the diet now.) Very helpful friendly staff on hand. We didn't eat in the restaurant in the evenings as we wanted to try some of the many restaurant choices in the area.  
We had a bit of trouble with our keycards unfortunately.  Two afternoons running they stopped working and we were locked out of our room so had to get them reset.  Frustrating but quickly sorted by reception.
All in all we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Balmer lawn hotel . Its a lovely hotel in a great setting from which to explore the wonderful new forest area.
Would definitely like to return sometime.

=== Lovely hotel ===
We had a wonderful stay here for my 40th birthday 
The hotel was just amazing, beautiful all round
The staff are amazing, helpful, friendly even helping my husband organise surprise flower delivery on the morning of my birthday which were wonderful, my husband asked the chef to made a birthday cake to come out after dinner which was gorgeous and a lovely surprise and the little surprise from the staff on our arrival in our room was just lovely and thoughtful thank you nothing was to much trouble, 
The room was lovely bed was comfortable but did make a lot of noise, 
The window had a mind of its own wide open or closed but we got there, 
The food is 10/10, a little pricey the most expensive roast dinner we have ever had, lol but the pianist was a lovely added bonus really enjoyed listening to him
I had a treatment on the morning of my birthday by the lovely Amy who I believe has been working there only 2 weeks but wow shes a credit to the hotel/spa, shes a keeper lovely treatment, left there floating, 
The coffee and cake is an added bonus and lovely treat mid morning
The spa is a little on the smaller side and sadly the jacuzzi wasn’t working for our 2 night stay which was a disappointment, also no steam room which I feel would be huge bonus all round, 
100% need more beds 6 just isn’t enough sadly, and I do feel you need towels available in the spa so you don’t have to walk to reception wet to get fresh towels just my opinion of course (awaiting Chris’s witty reply) lol 
The gym is small but very good and air conditioned, 
A huge thank you to all the staff for making our stay and my birthday just lovely this hotel is gorgeous, 
If only the weather had been better to use the outside pool (which was closed) and table tennis etc and explore the grounds 
And I love its dog friendly

=== Short Mid Week Break (no kids yay) ===
We found this last minute break on Secret Escapes a really good price including dinner credit.  Abit nervous of using a third party I called the hotel direct and they matched the price.

What a great find.  
Early for check in so we sat outside with a drink.

All the staff (and I mean all of them) were super friendly, nothing was too much trouble, were attentive without being intrusive.  The bar staff outside (Hilton I think) was very engaging and Donnell our waiter in the dining room was very polite and efficient.

We loved the feel of the hotel, not pretentious at all. Very welcoming,  We had a superior room overlooking the lawn, it was clean and comfortable.  The spa was lovely  (no hot tub working), the gardens were really nice, lots of seating areas, even the outside pool was bearable with our British weather.

The food in the restaurant was good, well presented, I would say you would struggle if you were staying a week or so with choice.  But quality and taste excellent.

All in all a great location, good food, comfortable beds, attentive staff, value for money.  We would recommend and return.

=== Great location but drab bedroom decor, not 4* as expected. ===
Fabulous location, lovely staff and very good food. However, our "superior" room was a disappointment and did not live up to expectations. It was just dull with very uninspiring decor. It was also quite noisy as it was at the front of the hotel above the outside terrace and bar and faced the very busy through road. The bed was not the most comfortable and had really poor quality pillows which did impact sleep quality. I did raise this with staff and I hope it is taken on board. We did enjoy our stay but felt that it was overpriced. A pity as Balmer Lawn is very local to us.

=== Excellent ===
My wife began her hospitality training at BL in the 80’s and has always wanted to revisit so a surprise stay was arranged 
On arrival reception was friendly , helpful and speedy

Double superior room was clean, good size and comfy, luckily a fan was already in the room 

Breakfast was exceptionally good with a genuine greeting by every member of the staff 

Throughout our stay all the staff were amazing in their level of service 

We will return. 

As my wife is now an national operations manger for a large catering company the initial training at BL must of been good 

👍

=== The quality continues! ===
We have stayed at the ‘Balmer Lawn’ before and unlike most hotels whose standards sadly slip the Balmer Lawn may boast that their service just gets better!
The staff who clearly enjoy their job have the right balance between professionalism and friendliness which makes the guests feel not only at ease, but very welcome!
The facilities are very good and well managed.
The hotel is as expected very clean and tidy.
Finally the restaurant….
The food was excellent and the staff again were helpful.
We look forward to our next visit!!

=== Unpleasant ===
Perfect location in Brockenhurst within the New Forest and the food was satisfactory however we had an overall unpleasant experience with poorly trained staff. The prices are expensive so a first rate service is expected not repeated errors with orders.

=== An unexpected stay ! ===
From the moment we phoned to book a last minute overnight stay at The Balmer Lawn Hotel, your staff were so helpful and so kind . My husband and I found ourselves stranded in Brockenhurst after all trains to London had been cancelled . We arrived hot , without any luggage and feeling stressed . We were given a cold glass of water , the necessary toiletries and we started to relax .  

Supper outside on the terrace with a couple of chilled glasses of beer and wine couldn’t have been better . Then, after a great night’s sleep  breakfast was equally delicious . 

We will be back to stay for longer that’s for sure!

It also brought back happy memories as I had visited once before in 1970 when I came over from the Isle of Wight as an excited teenager with my father , just for the day . The manager at the time was  selling his beautiful New Forest horse called horse Burnrew Perdita . I rode her in the area in front of the hotel and fell in love.  She came back with me to the IOW that day where she lived to a great age !

=== Retirement Holiday ===
We stayed in one of the luxury rooms with a balcony on the front elevation of the hotel providing great views of the New Forest.  The room was very comfortable, clean and well presented.  The breakfast was good with an excellent choice of food.  The hotel could have had a choice of sandwiches for lunch at the bar which used to be provided in previous years.

=== Hopefully I was just unlucky ===
Messed up the first round of drinks, forgetting one of our drinks and I had to go up and chase it.
Served the wrong drink for the second round.
Rooms look nice, although no air con so could be a tad warm.
Half the electric car chargers don’t work, but no signs on them.
Perhaps I have just been unlucky on this visit.

=== Anniversary stay ===
Stayed at The Balmer Lawn Hotel for 3 nights to celebrate our 46th Wedding Anniversary.  We had a fantastic time - the service, food and facilities were exceptional. The staff were extremely attentive, especially Tom (Operations Manager) and Jane in the restaurant.  Great location in the heart of the New Forest. We would recommend this Hotel.

=== A fabulous hotel with great staff ===
We have just stayed here for 3 nights in a standard room . We love this hotel and have stayed here many times over the past 10 years… this was our best visit  yet! 
Every member of staff that we interacted with were friendly and helpful. Maria on reception was so lovely!  Our room was great with fabulous views across the cricket green and it was really spacious.
The cleanliness was exceptional ! I mislaid a ring while in the room and had to pull out the bedside cabinet to find it… it was super clean and recently hoovered behind the cabinet … and also under the bed ( I wouldn’t normally pull furniture out but had to find my ring)! 
If I was to give one negative comment I think the shower was quite  dated but it was still perfectly functional .Also the WIFI signal was very weak in our room (46). 
The outdoor bar area and “Lodge” is THE best! The furniture is clean and comfortable and there are heaters and blankets available. Again, the service was great.
We ate in The Lodge one night to celebrate my birthday  and the food was superb. Fish popcorn and pork belly nibbles. Followed by sea bass and mussels. It really was a treat! 
We spent time in both the indoor and outdoor pool, both pools are heated and towels and dressing gowns provided.  We really can’t wait to return for another relaxing stay!

=== Our Wedding Day 01.06.2024 ===
We held our wedding at The Balmer Lawn hotel on Saturday 1st June . It was the perfect day. Ruth the wedding co ordinator has been amazing from start to finish . We booked the Everything but the dress package and would recommend all the suppliers that they use. Our actual wedding day was seamless , everything went to plan and we have had so many comments about how perfect it was including the high quality of all the food and drink. All the staff are excellent but special mentions must go to Adam who looked after us at dinner the night before and during the wedding breakfast, Lindsey Banqueting manager and Katherine who assisted us on the day. We would highly recommend booking a wedding at the Balmer Lawn hotel with Ruth and her team .

=== A wedding to remember ===
What is there to say - we attended a wedding held on the 1st June and stayed 2 nights.  The staff were fantastic, on the night before the wedding about 20 of us ate together in a separate room, food and service excellent.  On the day of the wedding our breakfast was away from the other hotel guests and then the wedding - well it was seamless, the whole event went off without a hitch (excuse the pun) and the staff were there when needed and discreet during the speeches.  It was without doubt the best "hotel wedding" I have attended and we cannot sing the praises of the hotel and staff enough.  The room layout was great, affording us both room and an outside private area. I can fully understand why the hotel has won awards.  10 out of 10!

=== Disappointing ===
How do you respond to abuse from a manager when all you did was point out his staff were inattentive using Tripadvisor. Apparently I am known to Chris and now banned even though I do not believe we have ever met or talked. The Hotel has now to be given a low rating because if the manager is prepared to talk to patrons in that fashion what on earth goes on elsewhere on the premises.  Please check out the replies to other negative feedback - quite extraordinary.

=== STAFF MEMBERS WHO STOOD OUT 100% ===
A very good first visit  made possible by 3 excellent staff members Maria (Reception) Tracey (Resturant) Samantha  Thompson (Duty Manager).
These 3 ladies are an absolute credit to the hotel very professional.
Beautiful views from our balcony over the forest.

=== Fantastic staff and location ===
Stayed here in a superior room 2 nd floor with our 2 dogs on  Sun 26 to 29th May ,nice room apart from the fan noise from the pool,this has been resolved by on our return in September 17th to a better superior room quieter.
The staff at the hotel were welcoming on our arrival,and also throughout our stay .
The breakfast was buffet very good quality,we had dinner 1 night this was amazing .
Drinks as in wine were very expensive,but seems to be the norm these days .
The hotel is in a prime location for lots of dogy walks and Brockenhurst shops .
We used the outdoor pool ,this was warm really nice.
The hotel has a relaxing atmosphere,staff were chatty,and went the extra mile ,I had forgot my phone charger , reception lent me a charger .
Thank you everyone for asking our stay so nice see you again this September.
Review was by Honest Kelv Cindy dogys Nana Pepe

=== Ok but pricey and not great customer service ===
Decent  hotel but overpriced and not good value for money in our view. Room was small and dated, staff unhelpful and made us felt grateful for being fed at mealtimes despite the high prices (which didn’t include breakfast which was a surprise given the price). Several staff are not well trained in customer service. We have stayed at better in Brockenhurst with a much friendlier and welcoming atmosphere.

=== A very relaxing break ===
Long weekend in the New Forest - the Balmer Lawn is set in a beautiful location in the heart of the New Forest.  The staff were very welcoming and friendly and nothing was too much trouble! I took the dog and the attention to detail in our dog friendly room was impressive.

=== Afternoon Tea ===
We came for afternoon tea on Monday afternoon, my friend and myself hadn't been to this hotel before and we were so impressed, the setting is just gorgeous and the hotel is beautifully decorated. The manager Michael came over to greet us and asked if we needed anything, we told him about an allergy and he arranged for separate items for my friend. The food was delicious with plenty of mini desserts, scones and sandwiches. The staff were really attentive topping the teapot up several times and offering a top up of sandwiches too. Michael popped over again later to check we had everything we wanted, we chatted about some events coming up in the future that we will be looking at coming along to. We spent the rest of the afternoon sat outside with a few glasses of Prosecco enjoying the surroundings, it was a perfect treat. We will definitely be coming back.

=== Short break with dog and EV. ===
A fine internal decor job and nicely laid gardens with a high standard of catering. Staff unusually attentive, friendly and helpful in every way you'd want. Very refreshing these days. The hotel has no air conditioned rooms so they can get very warm in summer. Fans are provided but I'd suggest booking out of season to enjoy the hotel at its best.  The prices are not that affordable but that appears to be the norm today. EV parking provided and apart from the noise from the road and spa fans, there are few negatives.  It is a shame that the original roof of the building had been replaced with an ugly mansard. Location excellent for the best of the New Forest. Dogs welcome but again, avoid warmer weather.

=== Excellent! ===
Thank you so much Amy, Mark, Tom and all the staff for a wonderful afternoon/early evening to celebrate family birthdays.  The hotel is lovely , the food just delicious and we were so well looked after throughout our visit. We all had a truly excellent and memorable birthday celebration -  THANK
YOU so much.  Looking forward to our next visit soon!

=== Cocktails in the Sun with my friends ===
Visited here on Saturday with my girls for a trip to the sunny new forest and stopped here for a few refreshments "cocktails ". It seems like a go to place for people to come and sit on their amazing terrace ; it's a right sun trap if you want a glistening tan. The service was great and we weren't waiting long for our cocktails. Our waiter Jordan recommended Aperol spritz , as apparently that's a go to summer drink for anyone who wants to relax in the sun with a refreshing drink . He was not wrong as I ended up ordering another one as it was so nice . Also the older gentleman with the nice suit seemed very happy and assertive and happy to help all the customers. We will be visiting again ! If the English weather holds up .

=== Disappointment ===
We are locals in Brockenhurst, my husband and I visited Balmer Lawn pizza bar on a lovely sunny afternoon.  After declaring our arrival to the front desk we were given the drinks menu and told that someone will come round to take our orders. Well, we waited for half an hour sitting outdoors in the heat without a drink, my husband went to the bar to order the beer himself only to be told that someone will come out for us, 15 min later we had a waiter so we ordered our drinks which took yet another 15 min to arrive; the place was not busy by the way only about another 4 tables of customers.
The pizza option were very limited too, I ordered the pepperoni pizza ; that was a disappointment too. The pepperoni were of the highly processed variety with hardly any flavour other than fat. 
While we were waiting to order I could not help but noticing how dirty the outside window were and all the cobwebs around the outside structure which is just where we were sitting also the outside lamps were just filthy, not what you want to be sitting among on a relaxing sunny day.
We still enjoyed the location of the hotel and  the walk in the forest. 
I will not visit this place again, well not for a long time at least.

=== Great location and beautifully maintained hotel ===
Great hotel. Found the staff very helpful - for example at dinner the manager gave me a link  to an  app for walking in new forest.  Room was large and very clean. Breakfast is included and was amazing. Also had dinner there with 3 friends. Reasonably priced and excellent. Would highly recommend it and I will stay there again.

=== Gorgeous hotel, lovely staff and delicious food. ===
My family and I had the most wonderful stay . We were a party of 16 ranging in age from 9 months to 86 with two dogs. The staff were amazing and made us feel really welcome and relaxed. They could not have been more helpful, always kind, and we had excellent service. We all had dinner together in the Beresford restaurant and the food was delicious and  again the service was excellent. We have been coming as a family for many years . Everyone had a wonderful time . Maria handled our large and complex booking with such skill and made sure everything was perfect for the whole family both when we arrived and throughout our stay. Many happy family memories were made . It really is a very special place indeed.

=== A large yet friendly hotel well worth a visit ===
This is a large yet comfortable hotel where you feel that you are the only people staying there by the staff. From the excellent reception and throughout the stay all your like and needs are stored and you never have to tell anyone twice. Even the most senior manager mucks in when needed with whatever job is at hand. You feel that everyone is working together on your behalf. We had an excellent stay and will certainly return in the future.

=== A wonderful family break! ===
We stayed at Balmer Lawn over the Easter break and it was so good we have booked again for May half term!

We stayed in room 18 which which was very spacious and met our family needs, it was very clean and well-maintained. All of the staff, including front desk, food and beverage and housekeeping were welcoming, friendly and very helpful. My sons (4 and 8) loved the games room and we all enjoyed the delicious breakfast. The inside pool was clean and well-maintained, we are looking forward to trying the outside pool during our next break. My older son and I spent an evening in the inside / outside bar area wrapped up in blankets reading books and were made to feel very welcome. We didn't eat in the restaurant during the visit but are planning to eat there next time

=== A lovely hotel, that offers great food, spa facilities and a beautiful location. ===
What a lovely hotel! All of the staff are so helpful and friendly. After being offered a free upgrade and a fabulous dinner bed and breakfast rate, I felt I deserved a spa treatment. Claudia is an excellent masseuse and ensured I entirely relaxed with an hour aromatherapy massage. Dinner was fabulous and I have come away feeling totally rejuvenated. I would definitely recommend this lovely hotel and am thrilled I was able to secure such a great rate by booking directly . Thanks to the whole team ! 🤩

=== A wonderful stay ===
On arrival at the hotel we were greeted warmly and made to feel right at home. The hotel is inclusive, we are both disabled but found it easy to get about and use the facilties. There are lifts and ramps discreetly blended into the layout, without imposing on the aesthetics. The hotel is excellent for pet owners who can bring their dogs with them and enjoy the restaurant without needing to mix with other guests who may not appreciate this. Those who smoke can do so away from indoor areas and non smokers without feeling ostracised.
There are plenty of facilities such as gym, sauna, play area, indoor and outdoor pools as well various private dining/meeting rooms. We did not use any of the facilties as mentioned but enjoyed the delicious and reasonably priced food and drinks the restaurant offered. The weather was fantastic and we enjoyed company on the patio area in the restaurant and even on the 'Brockenhurst beach' a few yards away. If outside when it cools down there are heaters and even blankets to allow guests to continue enjoying the environment. 
The food and drinks were excellent and we were ably looked after by Samantha in the afternoon and later Adam helped us with the menu offering advice and an excellent helpful and friendly service. 
Breakfast was a choice of continental or cooked breakfast buffet but we could have ordered off the extensive breakfast menu. 
Thanks everyone at Balmer lawn, we look forward to coming back

=== Excellent service and great pizzas ===
We were driving through the new forest and spotted this place and decided to give it a go as traffic was really bad on the Saturday . We were pleasantly surprised how nice this place was and was greeted by a man with a colourful shirt  called mark , he was very polite and gave us a warm welcome . We then sat down and didn't wait long as the young lad with tattoos was quick to take our order . We decided on ordering a few pizzas , they were delicious! The only thing I wish is that they served pizzas in the evening and not just to 6pm

=== Excellent ambiance and food, attentive staff - a great stay ===
We enjoyed a last minute two night break with dinner allowance included.
The hotel has a relaxed feel with very welcoming and friendly staff - they have got the ‘feel’ just right! 
The food was excellent - I had a fish dish with cod, mussels and prawns and it was amazing 😊the second nights chicken was also excellent. 
The grounds are attractive and although fairly  close to the main road offered quiet areas to sit. The bar area was great, again a good vibe and comfortable seats to sit out on the terrace.

=== Best food locally. ===
We love this friendly family run hotel. We have visited many times and love it’s right on the edge of the forest. The hotel has probably the best food locally in my opinion. The food in The Beresford Restaurant is amazing, I really don’t think you’ll be disappointed. We also like The Lodge where you get a wonderful pizza from their outdoor pizza oven. The hotel also has 2 swimming pools one indoors and an outside one too (although the outside pool opens end of May). There’s a spa too that my wife says is really reasonably priced. But most of all for me is the friendly staff they really make you feel special and look after you so well.

=== If travelling with a pet request a room on the lower floors! ===
Strange place, great bar area and the food is really good but when it comes to the rooms a lot to comment on. We booked a room well ahead of time and confirmed we would be bringing a dog, we were placed in a room on the top floor that even in early may was so hot in the room with windows open wasn’t pleasant for the dog or us. I wanted to speak to someone on reception but by 9pm on a Saturday there was nobody around. The room we were allocated was ok however the fridge that was supplied wasn’t working so any food we wanted to store for the dog wasn’t possible so had to ask to store the food in the kitchen which isn’t ideal. For me the charge to have a dog stay is a bit ridiculous as other hotels in Brockenhurst at least offer some treats or bed for the cost which in our room we received nothing. This is our second stay at  this hotel and not sure we would stay again which is a shame as had recommended to friends but will pass on these concerns to them with the hope they can request a room that is not at the top of the hotel especially when bringing dogs. Our last stay was on the 1st floor with the dog and was much more comfortable so would suggest anyone booking here to insist on a room as low as possible as none of the rooms have aircon or fans.

=== Brilliant we will be back! ===
Me and my husband visited the Balmer lawn hotel and are very happy with the service we received. Food was exceptional staff were lovely. However one staff member really stood out and went above and beyond for us. Jordan is an asset to your team and also makes very good cocktails. 
We will be back again.

=== Great stay ===
Great caring staff, looked after me and my wife very well. 

Nothing was too much effort! Especially Mark ( bald one ) such an attentive manner. 😀

Room was clean and tidy throughout. 

Food was out of this world 

Drinks great and spa facilities / treatments on point. 

We really enjoyed our time and will most certainly be back

=== Great Hotel ===
Great hotel in a lovely situation, a tad expensive, but you get what you pay for. Lovely food and great selection of drinks.

=== Back to Old friends ===
Back again for the tenth time . Last visited in November last. Every Season brings something different.Cambridge (the Black Lab) thinks it's her second home .Some "Dog Friendly Hotels" mean that the bedroom is like a kennel. That is far from the welcome given to both two and four legged guests at Balmer Lawn.
One drawback. Although the refurbishment of the Restaurant, Snug and Bar is good I fear the decor of the stairs and the white hall panel work needs a severe re-think.
Be back soon.

=== Poor value for money ===
Hotel upgraded in public areas since last visited ( 9 yrs ago) in public areas. Alas not in the room we were in. Admittedly a “ dogs welcome” room so while superficially clean, carpet looked grubby and room tired. We were on 3 rd floor so kept awake by running water type sound. Though we had a dog, there were several small dogs allowed to bark incessantly. Don’t go unless you love dogs. We ate in bar area, food was ok though served on the cool side. Not a menu for Vegetarians, only saw one veg option, same menu both evenings.breakfast was good and varied, though first hotel ever been to where if you chose anything “ eggy” such as Egg Benedict, you had to pay extra £6. I assume short of staff so easier to give everyone fry up. Buffett breakfast good. Main complaint and why wouldn’t return , very poor value for money. Booked direct with hotel, paid over £500 for two nights. ( Extra for other breakfasts) Plus £. 150 plus two small main courses and an ice cream.

=== Tired, grubby and dated ===
This hotel was booked as a surprise spa break for my partners birthday. First impressions in the lobby were good but we walked into a tired dated room with a view of the roof below.  Wallpaper was peeling off numerous walls and the ceiling, the light switches were filthy, plastic was peeling off the headboard, there was mould in the bathroom, grubby chair arms, a paracetamol packet was down the side of the bed.  Towels were old and hard.  
Disappointed, we visited the pool area and found that to be the same, cold, uninviting, no cushions on the plastic loungers.
We complained to reception and were offered other rooms, we refused as we were disappointed we had been allocated a room that wasn't fit for use in the first place and were put off by what we had seen already.  We requested a refund and this was duly given.  The reception/manager was helpful with our complaint and said he would speak to the cleaners.  This wasn't solely a cleaning issue, but poor maintenance and upkeep.  Certainly not what we expected from a 4-star rated hotel at over £200 a night.

=== Lovely stay. ===
We booked a room for a wedding at the hotel. We really enjoyed our stay. The wedding went well, the food was excellent and the breakfast the next morning was really great. The staff were excellent and a credit to the hotel. There are only a couple of comments. I would have expected there to be face cloths (flannels) in the bathroom for the amount we paid. The television reception was really bad. We only got a watchable signal on BBC1 and 2. We didn't spend long enough in the room to worry at the time. (Room 41). The other comment I would make is that the bed was a double bed, when it could have been a king size. A few extra inches or centimetres makes all the difference to a comfortable nights sleep. One thing you could consider in the future when you are doing upgrade work is to install a comfort hight toilet pan. They are much more comfortable to use when you are at retirement age and your legs and hips don't work so well.

=== Easter at Balmer Lawn ===
Spent Easter at Balmer Lawn which also coincided with our Wedding Anniversary and recuperation from major surgery. Can’t think of a better place to aid recovery.
We missed Maria on reception, however Jack and the other ladies were fantastic. 
Our room (no 7) has plenty of space and a lovely side view of the Forest. We ate in Beresfords each evening and the food was once  again delicious. The spatchcock chicken for two was exceptional. Two mornings breakfast was A la carte which we really love but appreciate when very busy the buffet style is probably more practical. Food and drinks service was friendly and efficient. It is very difficult to pick out one team member when everyone works to such a high standard. Looking forward to a short visit in September as part of a longer holiday.

=== Amazing meal at Beresfords in the Balmer Lawn Hotel ===
We visited Beresfords Restaurant with friends and received excellent service and a fantastic meal. The restaurant has recently been refurbished and was delightful. My friend chose to share the delicious whole seabass which was outstanding! The lamb was another highlight of the meal. Everyone agreed that the taste and the presentation of all the meals were excellent. We will definitely be visiting again.

=== Newly refurbished, excellent service and delicious food ===
Stayed at the hotel to celebrate my 40th birthday. I was a little worried due to some of the reviews, but we had nothing to worry about. All members of staff were extremely friendly and helpful. I had a massage booked at the spa and the time had to be changed due to staff sickness (can't be helped) but to say sorry for the inconvenience they gave me a gorgeous Espa gift box. Our room (room 12) was lovely with a very comfortable super king bed. We ate in the restaurant and the food and service were excellent. Breakfast was table service (for the cooked element) and buffet style for the continental etc. The cooked breakfast was really lovely. We also used the spa facilities when we were there, and we were happy with the pool/jacuzzi/sauna and gym.

=== Really really bad ===
Had a terrible stay earlier this month. Poor breakfast, which seems to be a common theme recently and an extremely dismissive and rude front of house called Poppy. Reading the reviews on here this seems to happen regularly and the owners response to every post makes it very clear that the terrible attitude comes right from the top.

My major issue I am still awaiting a response on is finding soiled underwear in my bedroom. I guess you cannot guarantee the work of an individual cleaner but it was almost like they didn't believe me. I had to threaten to bring them down and place on reception. Still no apology or compensation, a response 'we will speak to the people involved' just does not not wash with me (excuse the pun).

I'd advise guests to look elsewhere when visiting the forest. So many other options and in my experience all offer a better experience.

=== Attention to detail lacking ===
We stayed here for 2 nights and were disappointed in the attention to detail that we would expect from a 4 star hotel.
1, Robes supplied were too small and no slippers provided - We contacted reception and different robes were brought to the room, still no slippers??
2, Breakfast on the first morning was poor, dried black pudding, inedible and dry bacon. They had clearly been left under the heat lamp too long. Second morning items were missed from the full breakfast and the sauces requested never appeared. This was mentioned to the waitress who did offer to provide however we were almost finished before we could get anyone's attention.
3, The tea tray was taken away after the first night and not returned so were just left with coffee pods. My husband had to go down to reception to ask for more because the phone in the room didn't work.
4, The face cloths were also removed after the first day and not replaced.
5, Disappointed that there was no safe in the room either.
We ate in the restaurant both nights. I have to say the prices in the restaurant were very steep. £24 for a baked Camembert and £60 for a Spatchcock Chicken. 
I was disappointed not to see any locally produced products on the menu bearing in mind there is a farm shop and vineyard less than a mile down the road. Also the hefty service charge is a bit of a cheek, I prefer to tip based on what I think it deserves and not have this added.
On a plus side the beds were comfy and the views were beautiful from the bedroom.

=== Really disappointing stay. Epitomised by the response of the management ===
I asked by husband not to write a negative review of our weekend away last weekend.

However having read the response of the owner I am very glad he did. Every attempt has been made to discredit his very honest assessment of our stay and every opportunity was given to your on duty staff to try to address our issues and deal with them without the need to leave a negative review.

To confirm we stayed in January 23 and had a lovely time, we left a positive review.

We then came in January 24 and had a disappointing roast dinner. You have tried to imply this was the same trip and that our second review contradicts the first. They clearly were not.

Our disappointing experience evening meal you are correct, we should have flagged up at the time. Again my husband wanted to then and there but I told him not to. The waitress should have recognised she was taking away a plate of fat and asked if everything was ok. We did then report this to you Saturday at 10am, by Sunday 11am we had heard nothing.

The breakfast was our main issue and again you have accidentally or deliberately confused our complaint. It was not a case of plating up food, there was no fresh meats, no fresh cheese, no fruit salad, no pan au chocolate and no apple juice or orange juice.
My husband specifically asked if it would be topped up and was told it would be. Only one of the fruit juices was topped up before we left the restaurant 45 minutes later.

There was no one on the front desk to escalate the complaint and reception was busy so we emailed all the details.

With reference to paying for items in a supermarket it is a weird analogy. However if a supermarket had empty aisles we wouldn't spend any money. We would also take our business somewhere that could service us properly. It a supermarket sold us an item which was unfit for consumption we could take it back and get a refund. In the case of your food it was not acceptable but you still expected us to pay full price.

The meeting my husband had at the front desk was not with a receptionist but with a member of management. Your team had 24 hours to look into our complaints but neither hadn't bothered or had dismissed them. 

We had booked this stay in November at allegedly best rate but you were selling the same deal £20 per night cheaper through March which rubs things in the noses of guests who had paid more. That you needed to reduce costs is no surprise after our experience.

Rather than being quick to jump on our genuine review and disappointment please take things on board so that future guests do not feel short changed.

=== Sadly not what it once was ===
Makes me very sad to write this, having had so many great experiences at balmer lawn over the years. However this weekend the food, the service and front desk's response was well below our expectations.

We ate a roast in January which was considerably worse than previous visits but we put this down to bad luck. However our very pricey evening meal and then our breakfast the following morning was simply not what you would expect from a 4 star hotel.

Pricing has risen sharply, which you would expect from inflation but it's so important that standards are upheld. We found both main courses extremely disappointing... the lamb 'rack' especially were 3 lamb chops with more fat than meat.

However it was the breakfast that really disappointed. The buffet was completely depleted even though the breakfast hours had still 45 minutes to run. I specifically asked if they would be topping up and they said they would but I sat for remaining 45 minutes and nothing was replenished! My cooked breakfast came out wrong and there was nobody on hand to report it to.

I reported my disappointment to reception but felt really robbed of with their response. In 24 hours I'd heard nothing so when I followed up at check out I was told to pay by balance and then the manager would speak to me. In other words, we are not removing any charges for the sub par food. If it was a independant restaurant you simply wouldn't pay for what was not acceptable.

I told the receptionist we would not be back, she said if we do come back she would upgrade our room! I'm afraid that is a worthless offer because I wouldn't book with them again.

Very disappointed

=== Excellent ===
I have never written a review before but after having one of the best meals ever I feel the hotel should have some praise. The menu offers a fantastic selection and the quality and service was excellent. I Will booking another visit in the near future

=== Wonderful Stay ===
From the moment we arrived we had a warm friendly welcome from the receptionist (sorry didn't get your name), who was very efficient in booking us in.
We were treating my parents for one night, and a few weeks previous I had called to ask if they could have a room with a nice view, and they weren't disappointed. The room was lovely, looking out over the front lawn with the forest. 
We can't fault our rooms, very clean and lovely comfy beds.
The hotel is very clean with lovely decor throughout.
All staff were so friendly and efficient, and couldn't do enough for you.
We didn't have evening meal, only breakfast, but there was a lovely hot and cold breakfast selection. The only small fault is the buffet breakfast, could be a lot hotter,  apart from that all good. 
We had an amazing time, from the minute we got there, until the time we left, we will definitely be returning.

=== Hit & Miss ===
Stayed here for one night as was bought as a Christmas present. We arrived early for the Sunday lunch as the reviews said the food was good. When we went to sit down they were very disorganised & could not find our reservation, we eventually got sat in the bar area as we had our dog with us but had pretty bad service from there with the 2 people serving acting cold towards us, as if we were putting them out.
The food when it arrived was fantastic & I can see why the reviews are so good. Think there was a shift change & a manager served us at the end who was lovely. The room was nice & the hotel in a lovely location. All other staff we encountered were very friendly.
Overall nice hotel with great food  just some hit & miss service.

=== Mother’s Day Spa Day & Overnight Stay ===
I arrived at 0930 as my treatment was booked at 1030 (I have an email confirmation which proves this). Unfortunately it had been rescheduled to 1500 with no reason or warning, but I imagine to make space for group bookings. Luckily my room was ready though as it had been unoccupied the night before.

The room was okay, apparently an upgrade (?), but it had no fridge, no air con or working radiator so no way of drying anything, just 2 plug in heaters that you can’t put anything on, the bathroom wasn’t cleaned properly, there was no milk (found this out around 6am unfortunately), TV remote or hotel info leaflet/pack so I had to make my own enquiries about breakfast. The furniture was all basic Ikea, there was peeling wallpaper, marks on the table & carpet…

I went to use the leisure facilities (small pool, jacuzzi & sauna) and found 2 unaccompanied children in there, bombing, splashing & shouting. One repeatedly sniggered  at my pregnant belly which made me so uncomfortable I went and sat on my bed until lunch. There were no staff in the spa area to raise this with, there was a queue at reception and I was so humiliated I didn’t want to traipse round the hotel in a dressing gown to make a bigger deal out of it. I also later overheard a member of staff telling a guest that the door to the facilities should have been left open without the need for a key, so really anyone could have walked in off the street and into the changing rooms too.

Lunch that came with the spa day was tasty & filling. I had the chicken option, the meat was tender, the spring rolls were crispy & the fruit salad was fresh. Unfortunately the ‘tomato & peanut salad’ came with half a warm cherry tomato and 3 or 4 smashed peanuts. 

The treatment itself was amazing & the therapist was wonderful, polite & professional. It was a body scrub with massage & facial. My skin felt wonderful after.

Dinner was excellent, I was sat immediately and the food came promptly, good portion size too. I would definitely eat at the restaurant again - note, the restaurant is just off reception, not a separate room. 

Breakfast was also lovely, a good variety of hot & cold food as well as juice. If you want a ‘proper’ coffee it is extra cost. 

Check out was quick & easy, the reception staff are friendly.

Overall I had a nice stay but considering it’s a 4 star hotel unfortunately it didn’t really meet expectations. .

=== Consistently excellent ===
Just stayed a night this time, second visit of the year. Once again the staff we spoke to were excellent, nothing is too much trouble. Our breakfast was delicious.  At the moment there’s a redecoration going on in the bar area which we’re excited to see how it looks on our next visit which hopefully will be sooner rather than later.  Top notch again 😊

=== Great staff and food! ===
We stayed for a birthday celebration mid March 2024, really nice time, really lovely staff and I also met the owner while watching England beat Ireland in the 6 nations so that was a great little bonus!  We had a fantastic dinner there and a great breakfast the next day.  Bed was creaky! but it was an antique 4 poster bed so kind of to be expected.  Comfy mattress, warm room, very quiet with a great view of the lawn.  Didn't check out the spa.  All in all a very lovely stay :)

=== Welcoming Team, Lovely Location! ===
Thank you so much to Jack and team at Balmer Lawn Hotel. you all made myself and my pup so welcome and comfortable during our two night stay. We both felt very well looked after. Your staff are truly kind and caring individuals. Food and drink was excellent, and location stunning, and perfect for dog walks, relaxing with a beer al-fresco in the sunshine, whilst staying warm with fluffy blankets and heaters.....and music. Would 100% recommend for breaks away. Spa treatments also very good. Thank you! :-)

=== Management are rude, incompetent and out of their depth. ===
I booked a valentines weekend. A room, meal and spa treatments. It was a complete disaster and I left and moved into a nearby hotel which was excellent. This place is old, dirty and needs some updating. The management could not accept responsibility,  were very poor and had no idea what customer service means. Very poor and never again.

=== A pleasant stay ===
From the time we arrived for our 3 night mini break the staff at Balmer Lawn were lovely very friendly & couldn’t do enough for you. Was put in room 4 only a roof top view but very quiet. Breakfast was buffet on the first morning which was plentiful.. second morning was to order, was really quiet not many people about. The pool was a bit of a let down very tired, & beds were squashed on the side with not much room.. needs updating to make more room to relax.. We pulled our bed sheets up in the morning but on our return no attempt had been made by room service to the bad being made properly & no milk left as a top up either, although fresh towels had been left. All in all with minor issues we had a lovely stay & maybe will return again.

=== Perfect Hotel ===
Perfect hotel and staff, warm welcome, friendly throughout our stay at all times.  Very good for gluten and dairy free, no issues at all, nothing was too much trouble and I was spoilt for choice. Very comfortable and clean. Room 27 is outstanding.

=== Glorious winter 2 night break ===
We stayed here for 2 nights with my parents and dog, the staff were fabulous and went out of their way to help my slightly frail parents; food was exceptional; rooms were excellent (the dog was very pleased with its own bed!); and location was perfect - out the gate and straight into New Forest. I will definitely be coming back!

=== A weekend to  remember ===
We arrived on the Friday and my  wife was going into hospital for an operation which will disabilitate her for the next 6 weeks on our return home. The food was amazing and your restaurant manager, Samantha was extremely helpful. The rest of the team were very professional and made our stay one to remember.  We relaxed, laughed and went home ready for what was to come. Thank you all so much ❤️

=== Lovely family lunch ===
More details and family-friendly reviews on my blog 'The Frenchie Mummy' and on Instagram @thefrenchiemummy. So Google it and have a look there too. Merci!

What a beautiful place! We saw it from outside with the impressive building and once we were in, I fell in love with the decor, very chic!

The food was very good and both waitresses who served us were very friendly, happy to talk about the local area and things to do etc.

We did not stay at the hotel but the spa looked good too.

=== Worth every one of 5 stars for the hotel, the staff, the food, the location, VFM... ===
I don't often give 5 stars, especially for a stay at a hotel as there are so many things that can be just not quite right. However, the Balmer Lawn was one of those rare experiences where every single thing was just about perfect (well, apart from the weather on the last day!)

The hotel itself is impressive, has a bit of a thirties "feel" about it and is stylish, well-appointed with a lovely dining area and lounge bar. 

The staff are universally fantastic - everyone was so attentive, friendly and helpful and welcoming. There's also plenty of people around, which is rare in these days where the hospitality sector are still struggling so the owners must be getting something really right!

Food was great, Sunday lunch a real treat (the cheese souffle was particularly stupendous). Breakfast was either buffet (one day) or prepared to order and absolutely lovely, can't fault any part of it and so much to eat you could easily skip lunch. 

I had my first spa treatment and it was so relaxing, I nearly dozed off and the therapist was really professional and clearly had trained hard to deliver the perfect massage.  Pool, sauna and jacuzzi all helped with the overall relaxation and it's a nice touch that it is adults only from 11.30am to 3pm. 

If I had a minor niggle, it would be that the bedroom was next to the door leading into the bedroom corridor so it could be a bit noisy with people passing to and fro, but then the view across the fields from the balcony terrace made up for it.

Very highly recommended if you are going to stay and explore the New Forest.

=== Superb ===
The dinner was superb, breakfast was good as was the service. We also enjoyed the spa and loved the gardens at the back. Staff were excellent but if I had to give "the douze points" it would go to Tracey who went out of her way to give us a good stay. Well done!

=== Valentines stay ===
Superb short one night valentines stay. Room more than adequate, food and drink amazing. All staff could not do enough for you. Hotel packed but the service remained as good as ever. Balmer Lawn never lets you down. Thanks again Mark & Janice.

=== Amazing ===
Well what can I say. I had the best time here at Balmer Lawn Hotel, the staff were so friendly, great atmosphere, beautiful family room. Had a lovely relaxing swim with my young Son,We loved it!!  Didn’t want to leave as it was amazing.
Thank you
Hopefully we will be back.

=== Mixed ===
Very mixed really, some excellence and some below expectations.
The food was excellent, none of us had a bad dish. The waiting staff all friendly and attentive.
Breakfast was chaos, Buffet that could not be restocked quick enough, but I gather they are reviewing that. Standard coffee only, Latte an extra £4.
Nice covered outside bar / dining area but closed when we visited.
A little disappointing more wasn’t made of Valentine’s Day.
Room comfortable, nice to be able to adjust temperature.
Very dog friendly.
Didn’t try the spa.
Location perfect for forest.

=== Great Stay ===
Just returned home after a lovely stay here. All the staff were wonderful from checking in to leaving. Room was comfortable and quiet, if a little small. Hotel situated in a lovely position in the New Forest, one of our favourite places. The food really was superb from evening meal to breakfast. We would definitely return. Thank you to all there for making our stay a memorable one.

=== A divine dinner in the beautiful new restaurant ===
We went to check out the newly refurbished restaurant this weekend and wow we weren’t disappointed! The decor is beautiful and attention to detail everywhere. The food was delicious and we loved the new menu, the duck in particular followed by sharing puddings cheese and a cocktail in the bar! Despite it being full service was attentive and excellent. We had a wonderful evening and would highly recommend.

=== Balmer lawn hotel ===
On first impressions balmer lawn hotel is very nice check in was good and the rooms are a good size.
However we booked our restaurant reservation weeks in advance and were even told that our reservation was for the same time we booked, when we went to the restaurant they told us a totally different time and didn't have our booking for the next day. When we inquired about this we got a don't know shrug of the shoulders " must be the system" and that was from a duty Manager. The following day we both ordered stake it took 45 minutes to One hour to arrive when it did it was cold, thankfully the restaurant staff are very helpful and in particular Samantha if it wasn't for her professional approach I would be rating the hole experience a 1.
The pool is small and so is the suna,
Plus not cleaned on a regular basis there was a tissue on the side of the Jacuzzi that had been there for at least 2 days.
All in all a lovely but management totally lets it down. Almost a don't care attitude, and needless to say we won't be going back there.

=== What a memorable experience. ===
Wow. What an experience. Last night we dined with four friends in the Arden room, the newly created private dinning room at the Balmer Lawn Hotel. The room has a real luxurious feel and where we enjoyed  the amazing  7 course Valentine Tasting menu. The service was first class and was the icing on a very memorable night.

=== A short break away ===
Excellent service by all staff, friendly and providing great suggestions off the menu.
The hotel was warm and the spa maybe a little dated but adequate. The food in the restaurant was amazing, especially the toffee apple dessert. I'd prefer some soap in the bathroom for those who want to have a bath rather than a shower.

=== Stopover heaven ===
We just stopped on the way to the Isle of Wight  for a pint and a bite. The welcome was very warm, the ambience eclectic yet soothing and the service excellent and the beer ( brewed at the hotel) was marvellous, and the shortbread biscuits to die for,
I’d thoroughly recommend it as a short or long stopover.

=== Go for the food, not the spa! ===
On the positive, food was exceptional. Both dinner ( wonderful steak) and breakfast were faultless. But the spa was both small and odd. Jacuzzi could maybe squeeze in 3 people but the pool was both a strange shape and varied depth. So at one point the depth was reasonable, but swimming in a straight line you would bang your knees the other end as the depth was far shallower. Really just a lounging pool. 
Room a little on a small side and definitely needs an upgrade. But lovely and quiet.

=== A very special treat! ===
We had a 2-night stay at Balmer Lawn for a special treat and were delighted with our experience. Everything was perfect... beautiful clean room with super comfy large bed and a balcony overlooking the front lawn. All the staff were exceptional... friendly, attentive, courteous and efficient (this is quite a rare treat these days in other places sadly!). The food was delicious and beautifully presented. They obviously have a very creative chef! The Sunday Roast dinner in the Lodge was perfectly cooked.. & with crispy potatoes & tender meat! Buffet breakfasts had plenty of choice & regularly topped up on every area so kept fresh and well presented (even towards the end of the breakfast session!). The new decor in the restaurant/lunge areas was lovely. Spa treatments were a real pamper treat, professionally done & a relaxing experience. Well Done Balmer Lawn! We will be back!

=== A mixed experience ===
We stayed in early February for 2 nights. This was our fifth stay at the Balmer Lawn and we were pretty excited to be returning. However on this occasion we were left underwhelmed.

First the good points. 
The staff are fantastic and a huge asset to the hotel. All were very attentive and courteous.
The hotel itself oozes country charm. The main bar and restaurant areas are well presented, comfortable and full of character.

We did not use the spa on this occasion or have dinner in the restaurant so I cannot comment on those.

Less good. And admittedly these are niggles…

We stayed in room 20 which we knew would not be one of the larger rooms, but it really was basic. There was no wardrobe and we had to hang clothes on a rail fixed to the wall.  The hairdryer was so ineffective I swear my wifes hair would have dried quicker by leaning out of the window. The bed was comfortable but we have stayed in better rooms at budget hotels.

Breakfast was buffet style which was different to our previous stays. And it was not good at all. When staying at a 4 star hotel I prefer to order from the table. I am no longer at school and I don’t like queuing for food. Ensuring there was food at the buffet appeared to be too much of a challenge. On both mornings there were several items of food that had run out. Eggs, hash browns, black pudding and mushrooms seemed the most difficult to get right. So while half a plate of food was getting cold, the rest arrived 5 minutes later. It did not make for a good experience.

Overall the positives outweighed the negatives and I was told the buffet breakfast is being scrapped and they are going back to table service, which is good to hear.

I expect we will return. The location, the hotel and staff are great. But next time we’ll pack a hairdryer and book a better room.

=== Pleasant enough ===
Lovely friendly staff and in a beautiful setting with walks over the forest out the back gate 
Dinner in the resaurant was delicious also 
The room was small with rather tired decor and no view. The leisure facilities were also very tired . A small pool, an odd added on sauna and the jacuzzi with fermented looking bubbles!
I think it would be better to visit in the summer months when the outdoor pool could be used and the terrace for drinks.

=== A ladies group lunch ===
A group of twenty five ladies enjoyed a delicious lunch and fabulous afternoon . The room looked beautiful, crisp , white table linen, warm and light. The food was excellent, piping hot and beautifully presented. The service was amazing, speedy, friendly with nothing too much trouble.
We would like to thank everyone concerned and intend to return.
Sandra Hockings on behalf of Ladies Probus

=== Relaxing hotel in nice location  ===
This is without doubt our favourite New Forest hotel. It is clean, comfortable and welcoming.  They are obviously doing a great job with the upkeep and it is a place we like to return to whenever possible.  We had a room on the second floor looking out over the grounds and could see the ponies outside.  The indoor pool is small but nice, the restaurant food was excellent.  Nice breakfast.

=== Our wedding ===
We booked our wedding with the everything but the dress package. Everything about this package was customisable and we were able to make a day that was completely ours. It was beautiful. Ruth, Charlotte, Lindsey, Emily, Adam, Luke, Briony, Ashley and Kathryn all worked so hard all day to make our day gorgeous. Everything went so smoothly, and even when we had to make changes during the day, the team seamlessly supported and arranged accordingly. Us and our guests loved every single detail. Special thank you to Ruth who co-ordinated everything to perfection.

=== Honest review ===
Booked through secret escapes as a Christmas gift. Pros and cons of our visit here: 
Pros 
▪️Lovely location amongst the beautiful new forest 
▪️Spacious rooms and comfy bed 
▪️ Bar area is great and staff fab :) 
▪️ Majority of the staff are lovely and can’t do enough for you (expect one) 
▪️Lovely  cocktails 

Cons 
▪️Rooms are rather dated (superior room)
▪️TV doesn’t work 
▪️Spa- very small and limited sunloungers compared to the amount of people in there. Jacuzzi was cold and brown. Bath robes - fit a size 6-12 max no options for plus sizes. 
▪️Restaurnt- very disappointed- fish we found 3 bones in and when handed back to member of staff she didn’t even offer another option and then attempted to charge for this when it hadn’t been eaten. Her customer service was atrocious and really put a downer on our evening! 

Would we come back- def not! (And we aren’t ones to moan!)

=== Balmer Lawn provided us a beautiful wedding ===
We had our wedding at Balmer Lawn in December 2023. We and our guests loved the venue and my husband and I stayed an extra night after the wedding. It was their 'Everything but the dress' wedding package which cinched our decision and we did not regret it.

Before we got to the wedding, we were forced to change dates for health reasons but the Balmer Lawn team were amazing. They were very understanding and flexible to meet our needs. Ruth Mundy, the Wedding Executive kept in touch with us throughout the journey and reduced any stress which the changes would have made.

On the day, they made sure that all of our needs were met. Ruth came up to my room a couple of hours before the ceremony to check in with me and during the wedding, her team also checked in with me a couple of times to make sure we were happy. It was a fantastic day.

The venue is beautiful with a separate wedding wing so that you and your guests are separate from other hotel guests but still have access to the facilities. They also have a gate close to the wing which gives access to the neighbouring field which is perfect for photos.

During our extended stay the next day, the staff were friendly and the restaurant and bar staff provided a lovely touch for us. We received a few extra chocolate truffles on a plate with 'Congratulations' written in chocolate sauce. We also made use of the Spa the next day. The Spa is beautiful and the treatments were great.

With the package comes a Lifetime Upgrade for future bookings and we can't wait to stay there again. We might not wait for our anniversary to stay there again.

=== Great stay ===
What a lovely  place  for a romantic  night away,  lovely  room wonderful  food , staff very professional and polite, great food excellent  chef, swimming  pool nice and warm,   jacuzzi very warm, would  highly  recommend  this hotel, very  close  to village with  some nice pubs, we walked  about 15mins

=== Poor for the price. ===
Staff nice, good location. Given the price £220 per night per couple the rooms are basic and very tired looking. Ripped wallpaper, headboard needed replacing, scruffy bathroom. One room had bath robes one did not so no consistency. Bar prices extortionate. Breakfast was ok, layout a bit weird and long queues. Unless there was an offer on would not return.

=== Lovely hotel, excellent staff ===
Fabulous hotel with more than fabulous staff. Every single encounter with a member of staff was excellent. They couldn't have been more helpful. It was good to see them all helping each other too, without needing to be asked, they seemed happy and had good banter between them. The evening meal in the restaurant was delicious. The only slight downside for us was the breakfast, even though heatlamps were used for the food in the self-service hot buffet, when we sat down to eat, it was all cold,maybe hot plates would have helped. Overall thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

=== Nice Hotel - Good Food - Ridiculous drink prices ===
Stayed in Jan 24, for one night, and very nice hotel with good service and excellent food, in particular the breakfast. Rooms are well maintained with tea/Coffee provided. My only negative comment would be the really ridiculous price of drinks and then another 15% service charge when you check out. 
However overall recommended hotel

=== Very disappointing had been looking forwards to a luxury stay. ===
Room dark, dreary and cold. Bed so hard it hurt to lay on it for the night.  Food poor particularly breakfast ( didn’t know eggs could become rubber) First dinner wine ordered not in stock x2. Steak off, soup off and the main ordered was also unavailable.In all a very poor dining experience. Staff not interested in our disappointment. Room not serviced properly the bed wasn’t made. Are people who book through Secret Escapes given the worst room in the hotel. By far the worst hotel (of many) that we have stayed in. We didn’t use the pool as some other guests told us not to bather as the water was very cold.

=== Wedding 31.12.23 ===
After getting engaged at the Balmer Lawn hotel in December 2022, we loved the idea of getting married at the place we got engaged. From the moment we met Ruth, she instantly put us at ease, & we knew we wanted her to be a part of our special day. She is an asset to the Balmer Lawn hotel, & really does go the extra mile. This is something we will never forget from our big day! 

Ruth & all the wedding team were incredible in the lead up to our big day, all the phone calls, meetings, answering questions & generally offering advice & support really put us at ease. We opted for the Everything but the dress package for our wedding, & this was invaluable taking all the stress out of finding suppliers, especially as we got married on New Year’s Eve. It’s a fantastic package with amazing suppliers who also work really hard to make sure your big day goes without a hitch! We appreciated them all reaching out to us after booking the wedding to tell us what we needed to do next, which made the process so much more enjoyable of planning a wedding. Each time we visited the hotel before the wedding we were always welcomed with open arms which really made us fall in love with the charm & magic of the Balmer Lawn Hotel. 

We loved adding the gin bar addition - our guests loved this as we have vouchers as a favour for the bar! Along with the special effects (dry ice show & indoor sparklers). This made our first dance unique which we loved! 

The wedding breakfast was coordinated beautifully with choices for each guests pre ordered before the big day. Table wine & champagne was also the perfect accompaniment. Our wedding evening food was the bbq, & everyone commented on how delicious this was, with a wide selection. 

All the staff were incredible the weekend of the wedding making sure the bridal party were looked after, & all our families. The bridal suite was beautiful, & we got ready in a room in the hotel the morning of the wedding which was lovely to have a big space as we had a large bridesmaid party. 

Everyone at the venue was so kind & wanted to hear all about the big day before & after with how it went. A special thank you to Lindsey, Charlotte, Adam in addition to the lovely Ruth for everything they did on the big day! We honestly couldn’t recommend the hotel anymore for a wedding & we will definitely be celebrating there for years to come! 

Katie & Dan 31.12.23

=== Fantastic Place , great service! ===
Had a wonderful couple of days , we had a problem with the radiator in the room we were allocated , Maria (hope we have her name correct) from reception tried to resolve it ,but unfortunately couldn’t , we were moved to another incredible room , it was beautiful.
Maria was so helpful & very officiant.
Great food & great service , we would definitely go back.

=== New Year  Celebrations ===
Extended New Year break. Once again we were welcomed back as if we were family. The hotel was beautifully decorated for the festive season. The New Year’s Eve gala event started with an excellent tasting menu. My wife wanted something slightly different for her main course and this was catered for with no problem at all. This was followed by a party which had a fantastic atmosphere. Service throughout our stay was fantastic, with all the staff irrespective of department friendly and professional. Another perfect stay( except for the weather) and looking forward to returning at Easter when we celebrate our wedding anniversary.

=== Fantastic afternoon tea! ===
Had a fantastic afternoon tea for our friends birthday.  Hotel is really lovely & they still had the Christmas tree up which was nice. The food was lovely with plenty of savoury items which was a nice change from sandwiches. Scones & pastries were delicious & we were asked if we wanted more. Service was really good with staff polite & friendly. Can honestly say it’s one of the best afternoon teas I’ve had & would definitely recommend coming here & will be back!

=== Great short break between Xmas and New Year.  ===
