Came 2022 for Xmas and had an amazing experience. This year, many of the family were unavailable so decided to go between Xmas and New Year. What a good decision. Still very Christmassy inside and staff were still on top form. 

The good was exceptional and the friendliness is unrivalled. Managed to meet Alison the owner again and was delighted to be able to share our experience with her. 

Definitely coming back and a great place for dogs. Our big Labradoodle Heston met so many new friends.  

Please keep up this amazing service and special thanks to the whole Team.

=== Siberian Christmas  ===
Siberian Christmas lunch in a garden shed laughingly advertised as a ski chalet all within a cold draughty marquee serenaded by a noisy vibrating heater.  A very expensive and highly uncomfortable experience with mediocre quality food including a chewy microwaved Christmas pudding. Never again!!

=== Fantastic service from great staff! ===
I am delighted to provide an excellent review for the Balmer Lawn Hotel following a recent 'long, lost family' meeting. Whilst reserving a table in a quiet area, I explained our circumstances and the response was warm and understanding. 
When we arrived, the area around the table had been cordoned off and the staff had been briefed to ensure privacy, whilst also maintaining an attentive service.
The emotional event proved to be fantastic and the hotel and friendly staff played a huge part in making the meeting a success. Thank you.

=== Hotel and Beresfords dining ===
Rooms were very nice but on a few occasions the heating wasn’t working! Service for food and drink could be improved, quality of food in Beresfords was very good but just could have been served quicker!

=== True experience ===
We booked for a three day break and arrived after a horrendous journey.  I desperately needed to use the toilet but there is no disabled toilet in reception and had to climb three steps.  Only one disabled parking space although plenty of empty spaces for electric vehicles.  When we got into our room it was cold and there was a member of staff on the hallway so asked if he could look at heating.  They didn’t speak English so had to speak into his phone and it then translated into their language.  They disappeared down to reception and was then told the heating was on a timer from 5.30 until 11 in the morning and the same in the evening.  Complained at reception the following day because we were still cold and and a portable heater was supplied.  We found the whole hotel totally cold.  There were no comfortable chairs or settees in the lounge to sit on and the log fire seemed only to be lit late afternoon. The lounge was used as the restaurant if you brought dogs with you.  Tried to get a coffee and a coke after dinner but waited for well over 30 minutes.  The following night we could not get near the bar or find seats.

Our bed was very comfortable. We were asked each morning before 9 if we wanted our room serviced  that day.  This was new to us as we had expected this would be done automatically but obviously not as the hair in shower when we arrived was still there when we left!  

We we decided not to stay for our third day as the weather was just awful and we couldn’t find anywhere to sit.  

We checked out and management kindly refunded one days stay but the break we were so looking forward to was certainly not what we expected of a nice countryside hotel.  The menu for lunch and dinner was the same with just one variation of a special for dinner.

=== Yet another amazing festive stay ===
We returned again this year for the 3 night festive stay and had an amazing time. The hotel was looking as festive as ever with just the right balance of activities to keep us occupied. The food as usual is absolutely first class. 
Service this year was also outstanding, with special thanks to Jane and Dineal who were attentive and friendly whilst looking after us in the restaurant. The house keeping staff also did a great job of keeping our room fresh.  All overseen of course by Major Tom, who was also on hand daily ensuring our stay was as good as ever. 
Can't wait to return.

=== Fabulous couple time away  ===
Omg amazing loved  every minute from check in till our departure. Room with a view lovely spa and gym facilities. We ate at the restaurant which offered a variety of meal options. Already booked to go again

=== Siberian Christmas lunch experience! ===
Booked for Christmas lunch but on arrival
discovered we were to be seated in the marquee outside. Titled the Lodge aka a ski resort the temperature rivalled the mountains and we found a garden shed was somehow alpine!!  The noise of the heaters drowned out the screaming of the lunch guests but sadly did very little to warm the place up. We only moved tables three times in an effort to find some warmth on the warmest Christmas Day for years!!  We shall never forget sitting in our coats eating lunch!   However food was good but could have been hotter. Service was slow - 40 minutes to get one coke. Wouldn’t recommend the lodge at Balmer lawn during the winter months

=== Lovely afternoon tea ===
We had a festive afternoon tea for a friends birthday and everything was just perfect from the moment we arrived to when we left. The tea itself was delicious with everything very fresh and plentiful. The waiting staff were great , attentive but discreet without being too much. Ellie who served us drinks when we arrived as we were a little early was lovely too. I would love to return for an overnight stay one day.

=== Lovely stay ===
We went there for a wedding and we spent two nights there. We all loved the location and the hotel. It was a gem! Restaurant was delicious with many veg/gf options.
Briony was exceptional, I am coeliac and she was taking care of me, making sure there was no contaminations in my food. I felt comfortable to eat there and I will come back to stay there for sure!
Thank you and well done!
Highly recommended :)

=== Highly recommend ===
What a fab hotel and excellent experience. The staff were first class from checking in to the restaurant staff. Excellent customer service skills. Our bedrooms were of a good standard with lovely views over the first and a sunset too! Breakfast was plentiful and good quality.

=== Disappointing. ===
Lovely hotel, staff excellent and food generally excellent but our room - 37  (Superior) was disappointing. The en-suite  bathroom was designed for those with mobility issues which is great of course but it is in need of a major upgrade. For example, the chrome bars to assist the aforementioned are rusty and the light pulls over the basin are thin bits of string that have clearly broken and now have no pull handles. It was warm so we wanted the windows and curtains in the bedroom left open overnight but couldn't do so as immediately outside our room was the fire escape with lights blazing, understandable of course but not great for us. There were stains on the quilt and one of our towels had a wad of sellotape stuck to it. On our last evening in the restaurant my Pork Belly, generally very nice appeared to have been overcooked with the bottom impossible to cut so inedible. I had to leave this bit and pointed this out to the waitress, very nice girl, who asked if I wanted something else. I said no as I had finished the rest of the meal at this stage and didn't need any more food. I was disappointed that no-one from the kitchen came out as it would have been obvious from what I had left that it was not good. We booked through Secret Escapes so wonder if those doing so get put in the less favourable rooms.

=== 90th Birthday Dinner ===
We have visited before for Birthday Party Dinners but this time was for a 90th Birthday Party and some of us stayed overnight.

We had our own room for a meal and the whole evening with 11 adults and 3 children could not have gone off better - all was excellent. 

Food was exceptional.

The children had their own area for colouring and amusing themselves etc. etc. which was great.

The Balmer Lawn Staff were very attentive and professional and our Main Waitress for the evening looked after us all very well.

Very well recommended and we would definitely go again.

Cheers,

Malcolm

=== Best hotel experience  ===
Love love love! Everything about this hotel staff absolutely fabulous such a family comfortable feeling 💕 from checkin to housekeeping every aspect was impeccable 👌  from front of house reception to restaurant quality

=== Enjoyable stay  ===
The hotel is lovely inside made even better by the Christmas decorations. Our room was very comfortable with a view across the forest. We had a delicious cream tea on arrival. Dinner in the restaurant was good, we had the lamb to share which was very tasty. The rice pudding dessert however was not good, it had no taste whatsover. Breakfast was a real letdown, the dreaded hot buffet. No warm plates,  the food was luke warm, undercooked bacon, soggy hashbrowns & the rubbery fried eggs that had been there an age. Why put so many out because I am sure these must have all had to be wasted. Better to keep bringing out four or so fresh ones at a time. It should have  been so much better from an AA rosette restaurant. I would however certainly recommend the hotel for a relaxing break & we do hope to return at some point.

=== Another great stay ===
Another fantastic stay at this beautiful hotel. The staff are so friendly and welcoming, we bought our dog along again and he was treated like royalty. We had a cozy room on the top floor overlooking the forest. 

Breakfast is very good, high quality and plentiful. We ate in the bar one night and the food was excellent (mussels and burger).  The bar is very comfortable and welcoming with a log burner fire roaring away. 

A special mention to Briony and (sorry I was told to say this 😂) the budget James Corden (slimmer) Tom, both such lovely staff, very friendly and a credit to the Hotel. 

We were sad to leave but will be back again. This was our third visit of the year. Thank you.

=== What a great restaurant experience ===
We had two friends staying at the hotel to celebrate a 60th birthday and two of us joined them as a surprise for dinner.
The food was fabulous the Restaurant Manager and his assistant went out of their way to make it a great evening and join in our fun, we just had a wonderful evening.
Living close i will definitely use this restaurant again when eating out.

=== Great place. Great staff. Great time ===
Fabulous afternoon tea with family. Many thanks to everyone at the Balmer Lawn for making our afternoon and my Son's Birthday tea absolutely fantastic!!! We cannot fault the hotel and staff for their service, kindness and attentiveness!!

=== Everything was perfect 10 out 10 ===
Me and my boyfriend had an amazing time in The Balmer Lawn Hotel and Spa.
Everything was perfect I can’t fault it, from the arrival, very friendly staff, Maria at the reception is very lovely. I had an amazing birthday, thank you all we will come back. The food was delicious too. It’s 10 out of 10

=== BalmerLawn hotel, Brockenhurst ===
The whole experience from start to finish was exceptional, Jack who we dealt with mostly couldn’t do enough for us and made our stay even better followed by some exquisite massages and relaxation time. Highly recommend the hotel, staff food and delicious cocktails. Matt & Clare

=== Retirement and significant birthday ===
This was our third visit this year and was made to celebrate my retirement & a special birthday. As always we were made very welcome from the minute we walked through the door to the time we checked out.  Each time we visit the restaurant meals seem to improve and this was no exception where they were exceptional. Would highly recommend the lamb to share. 
Our room (12) was spotless and it was good to see refillable dispensers in the bathroom. 
Can’t wait to join you for New Year’s Eve and Easter already booked for next year.

=== Overnight Escape in The New Forest ===
Just back from a Relaxing stay at The Balmer Lawn hotel .We booked through Secret Escapes as an offer which certainly disappoint. Staff very friendly ,helpful and professional. Our room 37  was very comfortable and  had a nice view to the side of the hotel and the river beyond , Food and service at The Beresford Restaurant was very good if a little pricey for us ,couple of niggles with the room on décor front but didn't spoil our stay ,we would recommend and return if in the area

=== Ideal Wedding Venue  ===
The Balmer Lawn team were so informative and supportive throughout the whole wedding experience. As well as loving the beautiful setting and adoring the hotel, Ruth’s calm and informative approach fully sold the hotel to us as our wedding venue. Ruth was always readily available whenever I needed her on emails and via phone.

The day before the wedding I was able to head down to the venue and add all our personalised items for the day. The team were on hand if I needed anything! 

We felt the day went so smoothly and just as we had hoped. Overall, we loved our wedding day and couldnt be happier with how it went. I would definitely recommend this venu, and cannot wait to return!

=== Our stay  ===
We had a fabulous 3 day stay and have to say that we couldn’t have wished for anything more.  The hotel staff were so friendly and so efficient nothing was any trouble.  Our dog Bertie enjoyed his stay especially his breakfast sausage : we will definitely be back. 👍

=== What a fantastic stay ===
We stayed here for my husbands birthday (as a last minute booking).  We booked a luxury balcony room which didn't disappoint.  The staff were excellent in both the bar and the dining room - very attentive.   The food in the restaurant was 'to die for' and very tasty.  My only criticism is that the bottles of wine have shot up in price. £48 for a bottle of wine which can be purchased for £13.79 is in my opinion a little excessive, especially when the hotel wouldn't have paid even this price for bulk purchases!  The breakfast the following morning was excellent.  We will be back soon.

=== Halloween Wedding.  ===
I had my wedding at the Balmer Lawn and it was better than I imagined. Ruth and the Balmer lawn team were lovely made me feel comfortable every step of the way. My husband and I are so pleased we chose The Balmer Lawn.

=== Birthday weekend for my wife. ===
Thank you so much for delivering on every level. Room was superb. Staff could not do enough. Food was amazing, particularly the lamb in the restaurant on the Friday evening. A particular thanks to the lads who looked after us on Saturday evening when 11 members of our family joined us, you made it a night to remember. Thanks again Mark & Janice.

=== 80th birthday lunch for Jim ===
80th birthday lunch for about 30 people. This event was skilfully organised by Charlotte, and she was supported by an extremely attentive staff. It really couldn't have been better. The food was beautifully presented and served and was absolutely delicious. When one of us took a tumble the staff rushed to her assistance and looked after in the most sympathetic way. When she returned to the table her meal had been re plated and served beautifully. I cannot speak too highly of the Balmer Lawn Hotel this occasion.

=== Everything But The Dress Wedding! ===
We had the most wonderful wedding day which surpassed our expectations!  We had the Everything but the Dress package which made life so much easier!

Throughout our wedding planning journey, Ruth has been exceptional. Everything from start to finish was easy, and taken care of. All the suppliers that work with the hotel do so regularly and all know each other well which also added to the ease of planning. Everything that we discussed on was recorded and followed through accordingly, and the day was truly fantastic! 

We had many compliments on the quality of the food, and the staff were absolutely exceptional in their patience and attentiveness.  The cocktail bar was also a huge hit! 

We'd like to also say especially that Anthony (photographer)has been fantastic, also Adam (bar supervisor) Bryony and Lindsey were all brilliant. 

If you are looking for an easy wedding planning experience with wonderful results, my husband and I 1000% recommend the Balmer Lawn hotel, they offer excellent value for money, and the customer service is second to none. Initially we worried that it was out of budget for us, however when you compare to other venues who do not offer anywhere near the same level of service and quality, it was a no brainer for us. Nothing was too much trouble, despite some of our unusual requests! 

We selected the BL as we had been there a few times previously and it felt like a special place for us. They did not let us down and truly made us feel special. They personalised everything to us, and even went out of their way to sign a card from the team!! Honestly such a wonderful atmosphere and we truly had the most special day. Thank you Ruth and team!

=== A place to revisit. ===
Amazing hotel in an ideal location for the New Forest. All the staff were really friendly and helpful. We had requested a walk-in shower and our allocated room had a bath with overhead shower. I spoke to a very helpful receptionist who couldn’t apologise enough and allocated us a beautiful suite for our 2 night stay.  Room was very clean and tidy and even had a 4 poster bed.
Restaurant was beautifully decorated and the menu was excellent . It was a tad expensive but we felt it was worth the extra cost. Delicious food nicely presented. The restaurant was well used which says something about the food and service.
Breakfast was buffet style with a good choice of hot and cold food. Dogs are allowed in the hotel  but not in the restaurant. All in all we really enjoyed our stay and would recommend to anyone without any hesitation. We will certainly be staying again.

=== GREAT VENUE FOR A VERY SMALL WEDDING WEEKEND ===
M and I are getting on a tad so it seemed a good idea to “formalise” ourselves and get married. Having previously enjoyed family breaks here, we enquired as to whether they would do a mini-sized wedding. Ruth, their Weddings Coordinator, confirmed that they would and so we went ahead - just ten of us in total. Their planning was superb and the outcome, on the day, was a relaxed family occasion which was great fun. === Great staff, average hotel ===
We came to this hotel as an alternative to our usual venue in the New Forest and won't be returning.  

First the good points - the location is great, easy stroll into Brockenhurst and lovely surroundings.  The outside areas in summer are really nice for eating and drinking.  There's plenty of parking.  And the staff are friendly and helpful - particular shout out to the 2 Marks here - the bar manager and the hotel deputy manager respectively both of whom provide excellent service.

The rather less good points - rooms are really variable.  Avoid the rooms in the middle of the hotel overlooking the inner yard with plastic sheep - the outlook from room 23 is onto a wall a foot or so away.  These rooms are dark, small and airless with dark cheap furniture - and unacceptably hot in hot weather to the point of being not fit for purpose - don't get excited about the air-con unit on the wall because it won't work.  Choose the rooms with the outside walls reached by the main stairwell - you'll get a bit of noise but not much and your room will be much larger and more comfortable - still decorated in a rather dull and depressing way - but bearable.   

The commnal areas are similarly dark and old fashioned.  In winter there will be a shortage of areas to sit as most of the inside is laid out with tables for dining with only one sofa and a couple of easy chairs around the place. There's no light space where you can sit and read and relax for instance.

The outdoor pool area needs a bit of tlc but overall it's okay - the fresh water on tap is very welcome.  The indoor pool is fine but very shallow with the only area you can easily swim properly being along one edge - it was maybe designed with children in mind.  The jacuzzi is nice.  The indoor pool is not an area suitable for simply relaxing in winter.  

The gym is tiny so hope you're the only person in there.  It is however the only place in the hotel with air-conditioning so you might want to spend a long time in there in a heatwave.  

The food was variable.  The Old Spot pork chop was tough to the point of being barely edible.    The sharing dish of lamb shoulder was nice - the lamb cooked beautifully.  The pollock dish was fine.  Breakfast was good but nothing special- the usual standard buffet, no smoked salmon, no bread other than sliced white and brown - but it was all fine. 

For the price paid - which was around £300 per night, there are far better places in the vicinity.
