=== Food and drink are the crowning glory ===
We stayed at the Balmer Lawn Hotel for a week in July. Overall we really enjoyed our stay and want to give a balanced review of our experience. Firstly, the good points. 

The hotel is in a lovely location situated in the heart of the New Forest within easy reach of Brockenhurst village centre. It is quiet and peaceful and you only have to walk through the side gate of the hotel to be amongst the wild ponies - perfect for walkers and cyclists.

The facilities are excellent - two pools, both clean, a small sauna and a jacuzzi. Plenty sun loungers, gardens with a zip line and outdoor games for kids. Iced lemon water is provided FOC outside for users of the pool and sunbeds. They also have a secure bike shed which is great for anyone wishing to store their bike (remember to take your own lock).

There are two restaurants with different menus and two bar areas. The food and drink really are the crowning glory of this hotel, both were excellent. We ate in the restaurant most nights as it was part of our package and weren’t disappointed. Food and cocktails were fantastic, beautifully presented and delicious. We also had champagne afternoon tea which was delicious.
Breakfast was great - hot and cold buffet, lots of food, all tasty and plenty of choice.

The staff - really lovely, polite and were as helpful as they could be during our stay, particularly the restaurant staff.

Now onto some items which needed improvement. Upon arrival the welcome was rather underwhelming. No one told us about breakfast times or gave any other information than our room was on the first floor. In the room there was no welcome note or folder with any hotel specific information in it either - breakfast times, pool opening/closing times etc.

The bedrooms (well certainly ours was) are tired and need updating. There were paint splashes in the bath, the headboard was peeling and the wallpaper was coming off the wall in places. There was very little storage space in the bathrooms for toiletries and the ones provided were in cheap looking plastic bottles attached to the wall. There were 4 coat hangers in the wardrobe - fine if you’re staying for one night but not ideal if you are staying for longer. The rooms do not have a safe or a fridge though they do have tea & coffee making facilities and complimentary biscuits and water. The towels/robes were stiff and cardboardy.

The first night of our stay we were told we were eating in the Lodge. We entered to find a DJ playing dance music at a volume high enough that there was no way you could have a conversation. There didn’t seem to be any escape as the music was blasting through the speakers even in the side room. As a young family we found it quite bizarre that anyone would want to eat their dinner in what was basically a club minus a dance floor. Apparently this is a thing on Friday and Saturday evenings. We saw numerous people enter the Lodge only to turn around and walk out again on hearing the music. We opted to eat in the restaurant for the rest of our stay which was much more civilised.

On the second night the fire alarm went off at 2.30am. Granted I’d rather have a false alarm than no alarm and there be a fire but there was no explanation about why it had happened and no apology from anyone. 
Overall we enjoyed our stay, would we stay again? Probably not.

=== Great venue for small family celebration ===
Great trip to the Balmer Lawn for a small family celebration. Without exception the staff were helpful & the food really tasty. We had a private dining area in which we were looked after by a named member of staff, which suited us perfectly. Location is great with lovely walking on the doorstep.

=== Terrible experience ===
We booked afternoon tea for 2pm, we had lots to celebrate as a family. When we arrived we were told that afternoon tea wasn’t being serve until 2.30 & they didn’t know how I’d booked 2pm!! They took us to our table & was told someone would come & get us some drinks, 35mins later we had to ask if we could order our drinks!! Service was VERY slow & when we came to leave we could have just walked out the door because they brought the bill but never came back to take payment we had to go to reception to ask!!! Will never go again, extremely unhappy & it ruined our celebration. When I complained they said sorry they were very busy which was a load of rubbish!!! Certainly no customer service

=== Busy but relaxed, welcoming, attentive, and very enjoyable. ===
A special family celebration here, stayed for just one night, would have loved to stay longer. The staff throughout were engaging and very helpful without being false or overbearing. The hotel was busy but had a relaxed and easy atmosphere. Our evening meal was enjoyed by all the party, and were even offered the room the following morning for breakfast. Rooms were good clean and comfortable. Thank you to all that made our stay enjoyable.

=== Excellent, delicious food, wonderful staff and brilliant location ===
Lovely location for a family event which we had in the club room. The food was delicious and beautifully presented. The most important thing for us though was how lovely the staff were, really friendly, kind and really helpful. Sitting in the sun watching the cricket on the green in front of the hotel was another plus as was the river complete to New Forest ponies grazing beside it. I thoroughly recommend having an event at this lovely hotel.

=== Balmer Lawn Hotel and Spa ===
The hotel no longer lives up to its former reputation as a first grade 4 star hotel.  
There may be some small excusable factors such as staff difficulties, cost of maintaining standards and post pandemic difficulties that all relate to a disappointing experience on some levels. 

1: Firstly the bedrooms. 
The trainee reception staff member could not have been more friendly welcoming and informative. 
The room I had been allocated was small dark and looked onto a roof and wall. I had hoped for a bath but not requested one when booking. The staff member suggested moving me as another room that was available. She carried my luggage and brought me to a much brighter room with both bath and view. 

2: The standard of decor in the room. 

This was Faded and dreary. The curtains  had a rip in the lining and dark plain  green walls did not display any pictures or decoration. 
There were no water or tissues in the room nor shower cap or any individual soaps etc. 
In the bathroom that was very clean were only large wall mounted pump action soap and shampoo dispensers. 
When I asked about the above I was just provided with a bottle of tap water and a box of tissues. The shower water pressure was very poor. 
The bed was very clean and comfortable but the black leatherette headboard had  scratches and scrapes on both sides above the bed. 
3: Breakfast

The worst part about breakfast were the arrangements and planning of service. 
There was a signing in unit opposite the main reception desk. This unit was obviously multi functional and moved about as required. This was confusing for guests checking out and those waiting to be seated. 
In spite of a notice attached to it, asking guests to wait to be seated, guests coming down stairs could not immediately see the unit so naturally gravitated  towards part of a continental breakfast self help table. 
The staff member seating guests had to stop guests and ask them to queue to be seated. Once seated,  inadequate instructions were given regarding how the service system worked. 
No one told me that hot food ordered from the menu on my first day was a self service hot buffet in an alcove on the second. When I ordered poached eggs with other items from a waiter all that came after a considerable wait were two eggs on their own. When I asked where everything else was I was told it was served separately in a hot buffet alcove. 
A really helpful waitress came and carried my plate and took me to this side room where a large range of other items were indeed available. 
So by the time I had returned to my table my coffee and breakfast were stone cold. 

In summary, the staff were very friendly and courteous. However, the layout for breakfast was very confusing making the staff’s job difficult. One also had the impression that there were mixed messages regarding instructions to staff. 
The hotel needs considerable work done to bring it back to its high standards of the past.

The separate Spa and leisure facilities were excellent and totally worthy of 4 star status. Well done to them all.

=== Wedding ===
We got married here on Saturday and it was just amazing. 
We stayed the night before, as did many of our guests, and the hotel itself is great. All the staff are so friendly and helpful, we were made to feel very welcome. The rooms were perfect for getting ready in and there was very efficient room service. The food the night before was excellent. 
The wedding itself was also of course amazing and I would recommend it to anyone as a wedding venue. We had the most perfect weekend.

=== The most amazing venue in New Forest ===
The most amazing venue. We had our wedding here and it was more than we've ever wished for. We stayed at the hotel the night before, alongside our dogs and let me tell you, the staff bent backwards for us. Once we got to our room there were 2 fluffy dog beds laid on the, dog towels, bowls, treats, toys and doggy breakfast vouchers. Then our wedding day came and we couldn't have been more at ease with everything planned. Everyone involved was amazing and we felt like royalty. The staff at the Balmer Lawn really made sure that everyone in our wedding party was having a great time and everything we asked for, we got, never feeling like we were being a pain for them. Could not recommend this venue enough and we can't wait to go back!

=== Von Pool bis Service - alles erste Sahne! ===
Der Hammer. Selten so schnelles und hilfsbereites Personal und so eine hochwertige Ausstattung gesehen. Die  Matrazen sind hervorragend, auf dem Zimmer Tee und Kaffee zum zubereiten. Das Frühstück von kontinental bis englisch sehr abwechslungsreich. 10 Minuten Fussmarsch von der nächsten Stadt, ein Cricketfeld mit den hier typischen Ponys vor dem Gelände. Besonders hervorzuheben: der Spa und Fitnessbereich. Sogar ein beheizter Aussenpool. Sehr empfehlenswert.

=== A very disappointing visit.  ===
An awful experience. Senior staff members rude and argumentative. Very limited menu choices. When I asked at the reception for a staff members name as I wished to complain I was told that he was the bar manager but the receptionist didn’t know his name. I felt that I was paying 5 star prices for 1 star service. I will not be returning.

=== Could be amazing, but isn’t! ===
Ok I’m not sure where to start here! 
We went to this hotel after taking our cars to a  Super Car show for an impromptu  lunch.  The sun was shining, the atmosphere where we were sitting outside was charming, and there was a live singer performing an array of songs-   - so all in all a fabulous atmosphere.  
As business owners with chaotic lives this was a much needed escape from reality.
 
We then waited well over 30 mins for anyone to even take our drinks order which was frustrating.  When they finally came they promised to come back and take the food order but never returned.  

After another  15 mins waiting, our drinks finally arrived and we asked the waiter who delivered the drinks if we could please order food with him.  It wasn’t overly busy so we were unsure what the delay was.  

The food was ok.  Our son ordered a medium rare steak which arrived well done and it took another 30 minutes+  for the new one to arrive by which point the rest of the family had finished eating.  

Regardless we were having a lovely chilled out time so decided to throw caution to the wind, book a room and have a few more drinks, snacks etc. 

On initially entering our rooms (which cost £450) I was stunned - as an avid traveller, the room was nothing short of tatty, there were bits falling off the divan bed, the toilet roll holder was hanging off and the furniture was out of Ikea and very old and tatty.  I regretfully went to reception to see if we could change rooms.  
Reception were lovely and professional and gave us another 2 room options (there were 4 of us - 2 adults and 2 children). 

To be fair the new rooms offered were marginally better, but still very poor standard when paying almost £500.  There were no lamps or any finishing touches at all and our children were in an adjoining room which was no better.  
My partner again said he was not impressed but the only other option was a room for us on one floor, and for our children to be on another floor which was not acceptable (we were told the hotel was very empty that evening, so we are sure there were other options available)..  I have stayed in hundreds of hotels worldwide and the furnishing etc could be so much improved for very little outlay, they really let this hotel down.  

We continued our afternoon sat outside eating, drinking and playing board games which was fantastic.  Real credit to some of the waiting staff who were professional and friendly, but others were abrupt and very standoffish.  

I really really want to love this hotel as the location is fantastic but it’s lacking that personal touch, attention to detail and warmth that other hotels in the area have in abundance.  

The outside and bar areas are lovely, drinks/wine list very good (we racked up a very large bill), but the rooms are extremely poor and desperately need upgrading if the owners want to charge such high rates.  
Would I return?  Not at the current charge rate with substandard rooms.  There is so much choice in the area and competition is high.  We could have spent £200 less and got a much better standard of room.

=== Wedding  ===
We had our perfect wedding day at Balmer Lawn. Ruth was very helpful with the planning, answering all our questions promptly. On the day the staff were very professional and ensured everything ran smoothly. All the food provided was delicious. Our guests all said they had a great day too. Thank you!

=== One to repeat ===
We stayed in room 4 which was not brilliant as there were pet hairs all over the sofa and bed throw. I did view an empty luxury room during our stay and would definitely be booking one of these next time. The food overall was very good, especially fish and lobster, but avoid having the steak as tough (which was the overall consensus by many). The location is perfect. The staff in all areas was very friendly and professional. The terrace bar was comfortable and gave a good ambiance. Outdoor pool area is good. Would definitely go back but opt for the luxury room. We had a great time.

=== Somewhat disappointing stay. ===
Stayed a Sunday night to celebrate our wedding anniversary. Our room was clean but had a few minor shortcomings - on opening wardrobe handle ring pull came away, nice tissue box cover but no tissues, one of the bathroom lights not working. Enjoyed the indoor pool and jacuzzi. We had booked a table for dinner so went to the terrace for a pre dinner drink. After sitting at a table for 15 minutes we managed to attract a waiter and ordered gin and tonics, These arrived after another 20 minutes and contained cucumber instead of lemon as ordered. Instead of a leisurely drink we were now in a rush to make dinner. Maybe more staff required at weekends? Dinner in Beresfords was average, but expensive (steak somewhat tough), although the service was good. Prices of all courses, particularly starters and desserts, excessive. Breakfast was buffet style and excellent - couldn't fault it at all.

=== Anniversary Break ===
We stayed at Balmer Lawn for our 33rd wedding anniversary and had a great time.. our room (31) was overlooking the cricket field and gave us the benefit of waking to horses grazing! It was very comfortable. The food was exceptionally good and the hotel was very relaxing with staff being very helpful.. our only slight gripe was our dinner on the Saturday of our stay, whilst being very good, was quite a long time in coming and after we’d asked for dessert menus nobody came back to take our order so we decided to leave..that said, I would still give the hotel top marks for our stay

=== Mainly, very good ===
I have just had very 3 pleasant nights in the Balmer Lawn Hotel. I read in other reviews about the staff being rude. I did not encounter any if this. They couldnt have been more pleasant or attentive. The facilities here are very very good. The outside pool is lovely and warm and very welcoming. Lots of outside games to play with (croquet etc). The cleanliness is top notch.
A couple of little niggles. Breakfast is fine when they are busy, if not, it tends to sit for a long time causing rubbery eggs and very tough bacon.
My real gripe though is with the maid service. The bed making was really awful, bathroom simply had bath mat hung up and slip mat removed from bath. That was it!!!! Nothing else done in my room! I did report it, but nothing changed. It was really not good. I felt some recompense was due for this.
However, I definitely would go back because everything else was very satisfactory

=== The dangers of internet booking. ===
In all sincerity I made a recent six night online booking for the Balmer Lawn Hotel. The website clearly showed the four room categories as luxury, superior, family and standard. I have a screen shot to prove this. I chose standard and paid the deposit. I made a mistake by not checking the confirmation email properly which stated "small" standard. Unbelievably this hotel charges the same for small standard as for standard. It is beyond me why anyone would book a small standard for the same price. On arrival we were informed that the full balance was due!! We then went our room No 1 which the hotel had allocated to us and yes it was small, very small. Nowhere to put suitcases, no wardrobe, a clothes rail with no hangers, a very poor view over hotel internal walls, a poor fan and stifling hot, and a tiny shower room with a miniscule sink. There is no way this room should be charged at the same rate as a standard. After a rather unpleasant battle we were moved after three days to a family room No 23 where we had to pay extra. This room was much larger and had air conditioning which didn't work. When we queried this at reception this we were told people steal the remotes. The loo seat was loose and some screws were sticking out at the side of the bath. The room was well furnished but the view was non existent and even worse than room No 1. A member of staff told us that room No 1 was not suitable for a six night stay. A letter to the owner will be on its way shortly. The whole debacle could have been handled in a professional manner but we were passed from pillar to post. We checked the hotel website and booking.com on a daily basis and more suitable rooms were available every day. There are some very nice features to this hotel. Nice pools, nice restaurant and bar areas and the staff were by and large pleasant but everything seemed rather uncoordinated.

=== Nice hotel but little things could make a big difference. ===
The hotel is in a great location to explore the New Forest and Brockenhurst. The outside terrace is beautiful and looks over the cricket pitch. There are also lots of the famous ponies roaming around. In fact they acted as an alarm clock one morning - a lovely way to wake up. We arrived early and our room wasn’t ready so we asked for directions to do the pub walk as listed on the hotels website. Unfortunately the reception desk didn’t seem to know what we were referring to and although she asked someone else she didn’t have any luck. Not really a problem because we found it ourselves anyway. The outdoor pool is lovely and although relatively busy on the Sunday was really quiet on Monday. The food in the restaurants was nice but it was all a bit fussy  (nice if you wanted to go somewhere for a one off celebration meal) and quite expensive. We had lovely service everywhere at the hotel. Breakfast was buffet style but everything tasty and fresh. My only criticism would be the facilities in the room - very basic coffee making facilities and toiletries. Floorboards were pretty creaky but probably to be expected. Nice walk out of the back of the hotel to the Pig which is worth a visit. Overall we had the rest we were so desperate for.

=== Rudest staff ever ===
Stayed at the campsite next door and called for a drink. We paid for our drink after it eventually arrived and the waiter took ages to bring back the card machine. Most of the tables were empty at 1 .40.  Another member of staff then walked past our table and rather abruptly informed us that the tables were reserved at 4’ o’clock   as we had already paid our bill we were rather taken aback especially with the tone he used, and then he started placing reservation signs on some of the tables around us. I have never been so rudely treated  and we felt so unwelcome we hurried our drinks and left. We decided we would never ever use this hotel again and we could only conclude that maybe they only want guests buying meals.

=== Refused to be served 2 coffees ===
My son and I were staying at the campsite next to the hotel. As it was a wet Sunday afternoon at 4o’clock we went to the hotel for a coffee. Despite there being many empty tables we were refused to be served as it was Fathers Day and we did not have a reservation. We were appalled and felt it was not acceptable for such a large hotel to refuse customers. Thought times were difficult for the hospitality industry. Won’t recommend or go back.

=== Bliss ===
Another fantastic stay here, we brought our dog who got a lot of fuss from the lovely staff. We really love this hotel, the staff and the location. Breakfast as always excellent, room was clean and he little doggy extras were appreciated.  We had a very tasty dinner outside one night and it was just bliss watching the sun go down, the ponies going by with a glass of wine. Already planning our next visit. Thank you 😊

=== Birthday stay ===
We booked a dinner bed and breakfast deal via Secret Escapes for a big birthday.  We were a little bit tired when we arrived late afternoon and it had been hard to find a parking space due to a commercial event there.  But the welcome there by Maria was first class, altering our dinner reservation, offering and bringing tea for 2 to our room, opening the lower windows which had been locked for safety, later bringing us a little chocolate birthday surprise.  
The restaurant experience was very good.  The staff levels picked up a bit once the aforementioned event had finished but apart from our main waiter, a restaurant of that quality should be married with sufficient staffing and a tiny bit more finesse.  But we were in no hurry and enjoyed our meal there.  Very happy with the breakfast buffet experience too.

The room was a good size with a large comfortable bed.  The 12 o'clock checkout deadline was a bonus.

Not sure we solved the bathroom shower controls entirely but not a major problem.  I personally felt that the shaver point being set facing downwards on the top of the mirror fitting was not right and hard to use.

But we were very happy with the overall experience and would recommend it to friends.

=== Atrocious service and food at afternoon tea ===
The service at the afternoon tea was atrocious. The food was inadequate for the price. We asked for more sandwiches and the wrong ones came twice. We were not offered more drinks. The egg sandwiches had shell in them. We asked for more water and it never came. One of our party was penalised for not drinking tea or coffee and was told the soft drink was not included in the price of the tea. £26.50 per person!  DO NOT GO FOR AFTERNOON TEA

=== Our fabulous wedding day ===
Had our wedding at Balmer Lawn on Monday. The whole thing was seamless from booking it at the wedding fayre, to the actual day. The room looked beautiful,  the food outstanding and Adam and his team served us all faultlessly.  Thanks also to Ruth, the wedding coordinator and Charlotte who had the job of helping me with all the dietary requirements. Thank you all.

=== Perfect ===
This was our third stay, only for a couple of nights this visit, and we all enjoyed a wonderful time. Everything was perfect, our rooms were clean and comfortable beds, the staff were so helpful, we had a dog as well, and she enjoyed a complimentary sausage at breakfast. 
We decided to eat dinner each night from The Lodge menu, as there was something for all our family, and everything was delicious.
The hotel is located in a beautiful setting, the New Forest on the doorstep, also the swimming pools are a bonus.
Can’t thank everyone enough for making our short visit “Wonderful “. Looking forward to our next stay, perfect just to relax and enjoy.

=== A GOOD LOCATION HOTEL NEAR TO BROCKENHURST  ===
The Hotel is in a good location for touring the New Forest and a 20 minute walk from Brockenhurst.  We booked a Superior Room through SECRET ESCAPES  at a very good promotion price.  At this price we think is about the right amount to pay but not worth paying the scheduled rate.
The Hotel were very good in changing our allocated room to a suite with no extra charge, when we discovered the room wifi was not working. 
This is an historical hotel and the interior has this ambience. Good indoor  swimming pool.  
The suite was very spacious but the bed was disappointing being only a small double four poster. This should be a King size or two twins together. 
Breakfast was ok: the buffet section had a good choice but the cooked section was
precooked, and it would be better if you could order freshly cooked, but maybe due to the number of guests this is not possible.
All the staff were very pleasant and welcoming.

=== Absolutely fantastic stay. Lovely hotel, great service and food was wonderful ===
We stayed two nights and had an absolutely fabulous stay. We had a superior room and it was really nice. Plenty of storage space, very comfy big bed. Coffee etc

We had a room at the top at the front overlooking the cricket pitch which meant that we got to see loads of ponies.

The restaurant was really excellent. A little pricey at £30-35 for mains and £15 for starters but it really was top notch.

Breakfast was surprisingly good for a buffet. Delicious eggs and mushrooms especially. Croissants were great as were pastries and minor quibble would be boring breads, sliced brown or white.

100% we would come back. Easy 15 minute walk from station.

The staff could not be more helpful.

And one bonus. They have their own beer brewed especially for them and its great.  Totally confused by some previous reviews as the bar is so nice too and the service excellent again.

=== Hotel 5/5, spa 2.5/5 ===
Hotel 5/5, Spa sadly 2.5/5 

The hotel and room were lovely and hotel staff excellent always there to help, unfortunately my spa/massage experience was extremely poor. 

I had a massage booked on the 24th, which was then rearranged for 13:30 on 23rd due to staff sickness, understandable and not an issue. I arrived at the spa at 13:15 no one was around and had to call the reception to find out what was happening, it was 13:40 before my masseuse entered the room to start my massage and they then finished it at 14:20?! I didn't realise until putting my watch back on I paid £80 for a 40 minute massage, feel a bit ripped off.

=== A Lovely Couple of Nights! ===
We had a great couple of nights at this friendly and pleasant hotel in the New Forest. You couldn't ask for a better location to explore the forest. Ponies roam outside the hotel and a river is almost in its garden. The room was small, but clean and comfortable, the food was excellent and the bar buzzy.

=== Lovely spa weekend. ===
I was treated by my lovely friend to a spa overnight stay for my 50th birthday. We had an amazing massage treatment on arrival by the skilled therapists with great firm pressure (at my request). Products they used were lovely and smelt so good. Relaxation area is really nice. Pool, sauna and jacuzzi area is separate and quite small but relaxing. But be warned there can be children there at times. We had a huge, delicious afternoon tea - definitely recommend this! Dinner was very good and room was comfortable and quiet. Buffet breakfast in the morning we very good too. All in all a lovely stay with excellent service and would recommend.

=== Excellent Sunday Roast ===
Excellent meal on the Coronation Sunday weekend,  its one of the best Roast dinners I have had in many a year with the beef cooked to perfection ! Highly recommend would advise anyone to try you won't be disappointed !

=== Make sure you book ahead otherwise you are treated like scum ===
We were in the local area and decided to pop in for a drink and potentially some food. The lady who greeted us was friendly and said no issue with us having a seat on the terrace and if we decided to have food it wouldn’t be an issue. 

The lady waitress was friendly we had to ask for a drinks menu but this did come quickly we also asked to see a food menu just in case we decided to eat. Drinks took a while to come out with one being wrong although this was quickly changed. We then asked a couple of other staff for a food menu. The restaurant menu then came over and asked if we had booked which we hadn’t he then in a very dismissive and condescending manner explained that there was no room for us to eat on the terrace and the only option was to go into the restaurant and that we should book in advance because they only had enough food for the people booked and it that we would be stealing someone’s food if we went in the restaurant. I then sharply said well can we at least have a menu so we can decide what we want to do. 

He then came back with the menus having already made it clear we were not welcome to stay. We all decided we didn’t want to have food due to his obnoxious attitude. He had also only given us the menu for the Sunday lunch and we clearly saw other people having a varied menu on the terrace. As an aside there were plenty of empty tables on the terrace so it in no way seemed extremely busy! 

We did have some drinks and might have stayed longer but overheard the restaurant manager telling the waitress she needed to move on those just having drinks as if we were second class citizens. 

Such a shame if he had of been polite and explained best to book ahead we may well have returned we are also currently looking for wedding venues but this is one that is certainly not on that list.

=== Average stay ===
Very average stay. Rooms are average at best. Service is patchy (with the exception of the restaurant where it was excellent. Anna was particularly good.). 
Beresford restaurant was very nice and I would
Recommend booking a table there. But overall I’d avoid it in favour of another hotel nearby.

=== Beautiful hotel and restaurant but no service. ===
The setting is beautiful and the hotel has undergone a tasteful refurbishment since the last time I visited.

This time we stopped to enjoy a light lunch, dressed crab, with drinks.

If the service matched the hotel then this review would have been 5 out of 5. However, the service was worse than non-existent.

The chairs are supposed to have cushions.    Consequently, guests were perched uncomfortably. I asked for cushions and sat in comfort. However, it was evidently too much hassle to put the cushions out for the other guests.

The table behind us was complaining about being forgotten. Another table went and got their own drinks from the bar because there was no service.

I would have ordered more food and drinks, and had originally considered returning to the venue for the King's Coronation event. We went inside to pay as there was no service.

Sadly, I will give this beautiful hotel/restaurant a wide berth. The hotel and its customers deserve better.

=== Wonderful Break with caring Staff. ===
We have stayed at the Balmer Lawn Hotel on a few occasions before making the huge decision to book our Wedding here.  The staff have always been so very helpful and care that we are having a lovely stay. The food has always been delicious and plentiful.  We made the perfect choice.  We had the loveliest of Weddings, all planned by the Hotel. Totally recommend this Hotel for a Break away in the New Forest of for a Special Occasion.

=== Great location and fabulous gin choice! ===
Booked this stay for the bank holiday weekend for a birthday treat. Welcome was amazing- kudos to Zara and Maria who really helped when I felt our room (number 4) might be too noisy above the kitchen and pool. I got to see 3 other rooms but decided to stay put after Maria said she would ask night porters to turn off the fans (worked a treat on night one, but had to call down for night two). Room (with a King bed) was comfortable with a refreshed shower-only bathroom that suited us. Drinks on first night were lush so was Pimms on the patio on day two. Breakfast is pricey £20 per person per night but comparable to other similar hotels In the area.  We opted out and found a local cafe.  Dinner in Berefords was a mixed bag. Head Waiter was attentive but food was super slow (70 mins between starter and main course) so be prepared to ask to chase it up if you are a couple or be leisurely. Enjoyed the nibbles and the cheese board the most. A nice stay but speak up if something is bothering you and they will help you.

=== Treat to myself ===
I had never stayed at Balmer Lawn before, and my visit was a late decision. I phoned and booked two hours before I arrived. Everything was handled so well, and with such easy charm. On arrival, the receptionist set the tone for every other member of the team that I would meet during my stay. Calm, friendly and efficient. My room was a good size, well set out, and the view was out across the forest. I had arrived with enough time to enjoy a swim and sauna, in the pleasant spa, before dinner.

There does seem to be a pre-dinner drinks bar missing, or maybe I missed it, but I enjoyed a pint in the corner of a dining room before going through to the main dining room, which was definitely one of the prettiest dining rooms I have ever seen. The room is long and lean and so very well designed and decorated. A joy in itself. The food was well cooked and presented. The hotel clearly has a very good Head Chef on board, and I enjoyed my meal. Breakfast the following morning was equally as well presented. (Slight moan - self serve/buffet breakfasts can never produce great eggs, - moan over).

I stayed as a treat to myself at the end of the week away, and because I didn't want to face the traffic back into Kent on a Thursday evening, and what treat I got! Now I can't wait to o back for a longer stay.

=== A great birthday treat ===
A wonderful 2 night stay.  The breakfast was great, and the service was friendly and attentive.  Our room was very clean and comfortable.  We used the pool area.  Not a big pool, but fine to relax after a full day in the Forest.  We will definitely be staying there again.

=== Rude comment by staff member ===
Place is nice enough but the spa is basic and had cause to complain about a member of staff who upset my daughter with remarks that she made with reference  to her size. Although I asked for the general manager to contact me regarding my complaint, he didn’t bother and I was contacted by a female member of staff. Obviously he didn’t think that upsetting paying customers is something he should be bothered with. Will not be returning

=== Amazing! ===
The friendliest hotel we’ve stayed in! The staff were so warm and welcoming from the moment we walked in and they were truely dog friendly. Jack and Adam were particularly attentive. Fantastic location, you literally walk out the hotel and you’re in the new forest. Food was great too, delicious, well presented and plenty of variety. We will be sure to stay again!

=== Somewhat Disappointing Overall ===
We stayed at the Balmer Lawn Hotel in March in Room 15 which, although a Family room, was decorated in varying shades of Black, Dark and Pale Grey with several mainly Black pictures/prints? which did nothing to lighten the room.  There was a lovely view but obscured partially by the roof of the outside eating area shaped as a tent.  Altogether draining light away though we had good weather.  The evening meals were lovely and we ate in the Lounge area as no one was in Beresfords restaurant on any of the 3 nights we were there!  The food was delicious and the Cretan Maitre D' particularly efficient and ensuring exceptionally fast service indeed.

However, the breakfasts were something else!  On only 1 morning were guests accommodated in the Beresfords restaurant - when we received a full choice of all foods offered on the menu and could make our own toast, therefore, hot and fresh.  On the other 2 days toast came semi cold lying on a plate somewhat folornely ( have Balmer Lawn no toast racks)?Eggs were served semi raw and availability of foods not explained at all so that One had no idea of choice!  

A particular problem for my husband and myself (and other guests One assumes) was nowhere did we have access to any information as to various features of the hotel e.g. Indoor Pool, towels, possible hire of Spa slippers etc etc.  Overall, a stay somewhat disappointing.  We would not return again.

=== Dog friendly ===
Great  place , been a few times with our dog Rosie 
She loves it  will  definitely  be going again 
And taking Rosie  with us again
Food was very good and the room very spacious  for the dog to roam about
Lovely  log fire to sit next yo in the evenings

=== The team that became part of our big day ❤️ ===
Ruth and the team at Balmer Lawn Hotel were amazing from the first moment we met them to the morning after when they were helping us pack up the car. The Everything-But-the-Dress package seems a lot of money at first glance but the day they delivered felt like we got a bargain! The team were friendly and helpful - even the young members of the team were mature in their attitude and initiative in their service to us. The sun shone but plan B was there in case of rain. The partner companies included in the package were just fabulous (hair/makeup, cake, disco, photography, table/room setup) and even last minute requests were met with understanding smiles, quiet activity so as not to disturb the day and a “consider it done” ethos. 
They were calm, happy, hard working, organised and professional in a setting to die for! Classy all the way! Thanks team BLH for making our day unforgettable xx

=== Easter in the New Forest ===
This hotel always delivers great staff, great room (12), great food and great ambience.
This visit was over Easter and was no exception.  Welcomed back when checking in by Maria and lovely to see lots of staff from many previous visits. For us what makes this hotel our happy place in the forest is that it is family owned and the staff in all departments are friendly and professional. The best in any hotel and cruise ship we have encountered all over the world. This is why we return time and time, with the next visit planned for June.

=== Amazing! ===
Had a lunch here with my family and throughly enjoyed ourselves.Great attentive service, amazing cocktails and food was really delicious. Probably the best pork belly I ever had. Cannot recommend it enough.

=== Lovely stay can’t wait to come back ===
Lovely stay! Lovely food! Lovely location and helpful staff! Massage was absolutely amazing! 
Very happy customer we will be back (room 7 could do with a bit of heating) 
The afternoon tea was lovely the staff could have been briefed on what sandwich’s they were! But nice all the same! Breakfast was great too! And the evening meal was out of this world 😍

=== Birthday Trip  ===
The staff were excellent.  All very friendly, helpful, polite and professional.  We had a Secret Escapes deal which had a £30 per person dinner credit.  On the very limited menu this did not completely cover most of the main courses.  A small glass of wine was £7.50.  Breakfast, which was included in our deal, was buffet.  Whilst not normally a fan of buffet breakfast it was reasonably good.

=== Terrible hotel, good people working there ===
The hotel is dated and abhorrently expensive, but there are good staff - Maria on reception is especially good.

We were in room 8, two adults & two children and were charged £405 per night.

If you love the decor and feeling of 1994, then this is the right place for you. How they can charge this amount for such an out dated and cheaply furnished room is a scandal. 

The room itself was in the atrium and not in a corridor and the noise from the communal areas was to the level that we couldn’t sleep - to be clear, the noise was not inappropriate, it was people responsibly enjoying the bar and then the staff cleaning and setting up breakfast. But the room is poorly soundproofed and it was very loud. 

After raising our concerns, we were told that the next night we could go to a better room and would get £50 off our bill - but we decided to check out instead. The staff refunded us which shows a great awareness of customer service which I’m grateful for, but also a sense that this is an ongoing problem.

My suggestion is to either substantially reduce your prices to reflect the quality of the hotel, or significantly improve the quality of the hotel. 

Matt

=== Perfect! ===
The staff can't do enough for you, they cater for everything you could need. Our wedding day was perfect thanks to the excellent staff, venue and food! Guests that stayed comment on how lovely the rooms are as well 👌

=== Wedding anniversary stay ===
My wife and I stayed over on the night of our wedding anniversary.  We started off with a great lunch, while we waited for our room to be ready. The room had an enormous bed , and a large balcony overlooking the fields ( and cricket pitch)and forest.  Slightly obstructed view due to the per mana type marquee structure below.
A relaxing afternoon in the spa facilities, and then a lovely dinner at the Beresfords restaurant.  Thank you to Bryony, for the service in the restaurant, excellent, and also to Maria, who provided almost instant service to resolve a very minor housekeeping request. I suspect we shall be back in the near future.

=== Currently should not be selling itself as4 star  ===
Absolutely disappointing - unfortunately we had booked 3 nights at this hotel - we had driven passed on several occasions and from the outside thought it would be a lovely 4 star hotel!
I’d highlight the following:
Parking - plentiful 
General areas - Average but tired and in need of attention, decoration and cleaning in places
Staff generally - Polite and helpful
Restaurant - Dinner was average and breakfast was poor with substandard ingredients 
Room - Appalling; we had 2 rooms during our visit and both were shocking for different reasons such as being excessively small, tired and unclean, excessively hot, mis-match of furniture, very noisy from above, etc.
Recommendation - the hotel knows that there are problems with some rooms so they should offer a discount on these problem rooms until they are rectified!
We were not the only people who were staying and experiencing quality and room issues - this is not good business as I said the hotel is aware of issues and yet continues giving people bad experiences for what is certainly not a cheap stay! 
So disappointing!

=== Relaxed and happy ===
Started the day with a couple of Proseccos in the bar. We then checked into our room which overlooked the lawn, where we saw pony's and deer.
In the afternoon we used the pool which isn't too big or too deep, sauna and Jacuzzi. 
In the evening we had dinner in the Lodge with cocktails and wine, all very delicious. 
Lovely hotel, staff exceptionally good and friendly.  Would definitely go again.

=== Enjoyable and relaxing stay. ===
Enjoyable and relaxing stay.
Nice room , good facilities and hearty breakfast.
Pleasant evening meal and varied menu choice.
Good location for visiting local villages and places of interest.
Certain staff could have been more welcoming and approachable but generally most of the staff were friendly.

=== Sadly a very uncomfortable night’s sleep ===
We had booked a superior room for one night B&B as we were visiting the area for a function. I knew of the hotel from someone I knew who married here a few years ago!
I cannot comment on the spa, bar or evening restaurant facilities as we were only there to sleep and have breakfast, but unfortunately we left quite disappointed with the room - the bed specifically. 

The old style wooden bed meant every single small movement from sitting to lying down and rolling in our sleep was met with a loud creak, loud enough to wake one or both of us up throughout the whole night. The mattress was very hard (I am aware this is to some taste) but combined with the severe lack of sleep didn’t leave us feeling great in the mornjng. the room
Itself was quite dated and mismatched and for a 4* surprised to see bright red school pencils and what looked like food order pads in the room. 

Breakfast was nice and staff were polite and appeared to be enough people around during the shift. Maybe a niche preference but thought maybe again as a 4* there would be an offer of a speciality coffee (just a flat white would be lovely not a pot of ground coffee with floaty bits). 

Overall I wouldn’t want to spend the money again for what we offered.

=== Birthday treat ===
Another fantastic stay at this lovely hotel. Amazing spacious room overlooking the cricket pitch with extra large bed. Very peaceful. Excellent food eaten in the bar - highly recommend the cod. The staff are always great as is the breakfast.

=== Excellent the night stay. ===
Stayed for three nights under a deal including dinner each night. Had a great room on the first floor at the front with a large bay window, settee, easy chairs and large bed facing the window. The bathroom was rather cramped.
There was a good choice at the breakfast buffet with hot food to order. For dinner we had booked into the restaurant rather than the bar area. There are two menus and we chose off both. The food was excellent and service was very good. Occasionally there was a slight delay between courses.
The hotel is well situated and we were able to meet up with family at Hengisbury Head and on another day visit Lymington.

=== A perfect hotel for luxury and friendliness. ===
Our family of 5 adults and two children stayed for three nights to celebrate a few birthdays. Couldn’t fault the hotel. It is on the edge of the forest. Staff very friendly and welcoming. Breakfast was of a very good standard. Hotel is honest and feels homely whist luxurious. The leisure suite was clean and spacious. It was a great happy and fun few days. Only a tiny negative I didn’t like the tea tray being in the wardrobe.

=== Lovely Stay ===
After a few days of hard sailing in the Solent, this is just what we needed. Lovely feel as you walk in, great welcome by very attentive staff and the rooms are a delight as are the grounds. We will definitely be back to this wonderful place to rest your head.

=== Perfect Sunday! ===
Fabulous Mother’s Day lunch. The staff were friendly, attentive and polite, nothing was too much trouble. Food was exceptional , and I have to say it was the best Sunday lunch we’ve had for a very long time. 
Thank you for looking after us, and the glass of fizz brought to our tables. A perfect touch to celebrate Mother’s Day!

=== Great Lunch, highly recommend ===
We went to the Balmer lawn for mothers day lunch.   We had a great lunch the the 2 hosts Were so attentive.    There were loads of staff and all were good.  Thank you for making my wife lunch such a pleasure.   kind regards  Sean Willson

=== Very bad experience ===
If I could only give minus 5 stars. On entry you could see this venue was very nice. We were made to feel like second class citizens, seated in a side room out of the main dining area, with a walk way to a door that was marked  private, staff kept walking by (no-one asked if it was ok, or did we need anything. 
It was a champagne afternoon tea, we had to remind them about the champagne, we needed more jam and cream, but staff did not come near us. As my wife had been gifted the afternoon tea we were hoping this would be a great experience, unfortunately we will remember this for all the wrong reasons.

=== Great food attentive staff very clean ===
Amazing food!! Best meal in years 
Great food, helpful attentive staff, very clean , would def recommend, 
Very relaxed good location, peaceful and welcoming. Not buzzing as a Monday! Beauty treatment great

=== Perfect New Forest getaway ===
My partner and I had a lovely stay. The rooms are very cosy and clean, and the food in the restaurant was excellent. I particularly enjoyed the bar area which had a lovely atmosphere. 

The staff were very friendly and really made it a very enjoyable trip. 

I would definitely recommend!

=== Wonderful Stay ===
Lovely stay at the hotel in February. We stayed for two nights with our dog. Our dog (who is very much part of our family) was welcomed throughout the stay and was able to be a part of the trip. Breakfast was lovely as was our evening meal in the lodge on our second night. We also enjoyed having a chill out in the hot tub in the spa! Even though it is dog friendly, it still felt like a luxurious hotel throughout our stay. It’s such a cosy hotel and we loved sitting in the lounge in the evening playing a game by the fire. Staff also very friendly. Can’t wait to return.

=== Perfect wedding venue. ===
Beautiful venue with lovely staff, fantastic food and comfortable rooms. My partner and I had our wedding here and whether you’re looking for a venue too, or simply a small getaway, this is perfect. Nothing was too much to ask and the staff went above and beyond for us. Beautiful spa too.

=== The most amazing wedding venue! ===
We had our wedding at the beautiful Balmer Lawn. From the moment we contacted Ruth and met her at the hotel, we knew it was the place we wanted to have our special day. Ruth couldn’t do enough for us throughout the whole process. All the staff were amazing and really made our day feel super special. The food on our wedding day was brilliant and our guests loved the amount of choice as well as the taste. We stayed the night before the wedding and the night of, and all the rooms we had were comfortable and nicely decorated. The hotel has a really lovely atmosphere and feels like a home from home whilst still being luxurious. 
We have been back many times since and are so happy that it’s going to hold a special place in our hearts for the rest of our lives. Massive thank you to Ruth and all the team. We couldn’t recommend Balmer Lawn highly enough for a meal, stay, special occasion or a wedding!

=== Perfect for visiting the New Forest ===
Lovely hotel with excellent service from very friendly, competent and helpful staff. I was surprised how reasonably priced it was.  The swimming pool was very warm and pleasant but although rather shallow in places.

When we were there, the restaurant was rather cold; we found it much more comfortable to dine in the lounge, in front of a blazing log fire.  The same menu was offered in both areas.

=== Great staff ===
Spent a 2 night family stay here
Lovely friendly hotel with great staff 
Food was excellent in the Beresford restaurant 
Hotel is right in the New Forest so easy to go for walks directly from the front door 
Also just a few minutes drive to the sea and cliff walk at Barton on Sea

=== Wow! ===
We have just had a wonderful 2 night stay here. The staff were all lovely without exception, we were watching how they get on with each other and their camaraderie was lovely and it reflects well onto how they do their job. We had a lovely clean comfortable dog friendly room, we were given bowls, treats, a dog bed and vouchers for a dog sausage at breakfast which was very much appreciated by our furry friend.  The food at breakfast and dinner was exceptional, we honestly couldn’t fault any meal we had.  The location is exceptional and at the back of the hotel is a gate to take you into the forest. The attention to detail is amazing, I travel a lot for my job all over the world and this hotel would be up in my top 3 of hotels. 

We are already planning our next stay. Well done to everyone and we will definitely see you soon 😊

=== Small, inadequate, dirty and not relaxing ===
Hugely disappointed by the 'facilities'. Although the treatment was lovely. The staff  service was inadequate

Only communal changing rooms. 
The pool is tiny, one end is only 90cm deep. 
The sauna can barely fit 3 people in it
The jacuzzi was dirty and we refused to use it. 
To top it off kids from the hotel are allowed to use all the facilities too so really not relaxing. 

We just sat in a room and chatted for 3 hours, complete waste of money. 

After complaining about what they were charging vs what they were delivering, told nothing could be done. 

I will not be returning.

=== Some great, some not so great ===
We arrived at The Balmer Lawn for a one night stay to celebrate a birthday. The first thing to say is that the staff were lovely, extremely friendly and polite without exception. Our room was a superior room, although very clean and generally well equipped we were on the first floor and could hear music from reception all day and into the night which wasn’t great. Dressing gowns were provided to go down to the pool/spa but no slippers of flip flops for our feet. The main disappointment was the indoor pool. We went down to have a look after check in, walked through the door where a guy was changing a babies nappy and the pool was full of children so you couldn’t really swim at all. We went down to the pool twice more and it was exactly the same. I appreciate we were there during half term but perhaps a couple of designated times for adults only would have been a good idea. In the evening we decided to go down for a cocktail before dinner. We walked into the bar and were told to sit down and we would be served. Twenty minutes later no sign of staff so had to go and find one who did apologise and gave us a cocktail menu. Nobody came back to take an order so we just left and walked into dinner. The food was excellent although a minor irritation was on five occasions staff came up with either drink or food that we hadn’t ordered. Surely they must have a system for knowing which table has ordered which food or drink. Amusing on the first couple of occasions by the fifth time it was annoying. All that being said we did enjoy our stay but wouldn’t necessarily return.

=== Not quite the spa weekend planned ===
Spa weekend booked for my wife’s birthday. 

We knew the spa was intimate on researching but didn’t expect it to feel like your local swimming pool, rather packed and a lot of kids jumping in, splashing & shouting (but we have have two young kids ourselves and we know half-term has just started, so it’s no deal-breaker) just not the relaxing start we were after. The few poolside beds were naturally full and the jacuzzi out of order so only the sauna to use to relax. That’s ok, my wife has a spa treatment booked for following morning as a bit of luxury. No, unfortunately that gets cancelled as the therapist calls sick (these things happen!). 

Later that evening, we have dinner booked in the Beresford restaurant. Food & drinks were very good, but service, at least for us, was poor. We were left to our own devices in the corner of the restaurant. Our theory being they were paying attention to the Valentines taster menu guests and larger groups. However being forgotten about more times than is acceptable was a kick in the teeth. By the end we just got up and left (not hanging around for the dessert menus that never came)… hearing the table next to us have a little grumble as they up departed suggests they may had a similar experience. 

The pros: room was comfortable, the food and drink very good and general atmosphere/setting very nice, and actually can’t fault the staff we interacted with. 

Sadly however next year, I may just run her a nice bath, light some aromatic candles, get an M&S dine-in for 2 meal and even fluff the bed pillows…  save myself a few quid and a 2 hour journey.

=== Birthday visit ===
We come every January and are never disappointed!

The Black Friday offers make it outstanding value too!

Ate from both beresfords menu and the lodge bar restaurant, both were superb (although sharer pork belly and the chocolate red velvet pudding were the 2 absolute standout!

Roll on next January!

=== Very  Mediocre. ===
I was invited to a pre booked afternoon birthday lunch for 7 in your restaurant. 
On arrival  we were informed  that there was very little choice left on the restaurant menu.  
On sitting down  we were told  that they  could only offer  5 chicken roast dinner s 
(  not on the menu) plus one other selection.  
Then offered the bar menu to choose.  . 
So all roast and other options taken up.so I choose from the bar menu.  
Which the was informed they didn't have either.  So had to have a  Mediocre burger and chips  which had burnt bacon on the top.  As a guest of the birthday hosts felt it  not my place to make a fuss.  If I was the hosts,  I would of walk out. 
Hence will not be returning  or recommending  your restaurant.  
Message to the management. 
I your are willing to take bookings for you restaurant.  You should provide food that on  your menu.  Instead of  the disappointment  you served up.

=== Lovely classy and friendly hotel ===
2 nights here in the depths of January. Arrived in thick fog to see the friendly twinkling exterior lights, so welcoming. Asked for a room with a fridge which the staff organised immediately, so, where to start with all the good we experienced here. The staff are welcoming and nothing is too much trouble. All areas of the hotel are spotless and immaculate. The pool is warm and inviting. The showers are hot and plentiful. The decor is tasteful and looks new. The bed ( room 7) is huge. Carpets thick and luxurious. Best if all, that scrambled egg, brilliant. We had a really super experience here, I’d thoroughly recommend and we will definitely be back.

=== A Great Place to a Weekend Break ===
The moment we walked in and saw the log fire and the cosy ambiance we started to relax. Every member of staff were warm and welcoming and very attentive. They welcome dogs to stay too although you are required to eat in the Lodge lounge rather than the dining room (which is understandable) but we still had the same attention and service from staff, and the bonus of the cosy fire. The breakfast was plentiful and set us up for our day , I all in all, we would definitely like to return in the warmer weather.

=== Excellent comfortable stay with great service ===
I stayed for 1 night when attending a dinner dance. My bedroom was huge (!) and very comfortable, although the fridge/minibar was a little noisy. The food was excellent and I was given vegetarian sausages at breakfast when I asked. The staff were very eager to please.

=== Perfect break ===
Another stress free stay. The staff as always are not only efficient but friendly and helpful. We were upgraded to a lovely spacious first floor room overlooking the front paddock with a balcony. Clean bright bathroom with a refreshing shower. The huge bed was comfortable and we had a restful night's sleep. We love the real fire in the lounge. A comprehensive choice suiting all tastes at breakfast and we enjoyed the bar menu in the evening. The pool, sauna and hot tub were  the icing on the cake. Dogs are allowed and added to the relaxed country house feel. Looking forward to our next visit.

=== special occasion ===
Booked lunch for 50 at BLH for my Dad's 90th birthday party. We were looked after very well. Comfortable spacious rooms to stay in that night and a great breakfast. the whole party had a wonderful time.

=== Excellent operations manager ===
Excellent service from Igor the operations manager. He was brilliant and deserves full recognition. He brought sausages for my dog and provided us with second to none attention. Great food we had a simple burger that was well priced great service will return. Rooms and spa good.

=== More a high 3 star than a 4 star hotel.  ===
We stayed here over the Christmas period of Dec 2022. Very nice cozy hotel in a great location. 

Pros: 
Great location, friendly staff, heating very good, nice restaurants

Cons: 
Need herbal tea options in the bedrooms. We had to go to the local Tesco. Need Camomile, Peppermint and Green tea as a minimum. Only had traditional tea, which we do not drink. 
More fresh vegetables are needed for breakfast options: tomatoes, beetroot, cucumber, avocado etc. The breakfast was very simple and traditional with English breakfast and then a continental option. For a 4 star rating hotel, breakfast vegetables are a must. 
Shower head in the bathroom was quite weak. We like a strong power shower, and did not have it with this one.. 

Restaurants are nice but very expensive - £4 for 5 slices fo Sourdough bread? :(

If they made these above changes hen it would definitely rate as a 4 star. Right now, it is more a high 3 star hotel.

=== excellent new year ===
This is a hotel in a fabulous location and a gorgeous building. We stayed one night for the new year dinner and evening, and it was fabulous. The hotel and staff put a lot of effort in, not just for the evening but before and after, it was a lovely stay. Thank you very much

=== A Superb Experience. ===
Many years ago I trained as a hotel manager but our stay at the Balmer Lawn Hotel was an unexpected experience. We had booked two nights including a gala dinner on New Years Eve. My room was small but adequate since I was on my own. The evening of the gala dinner was superb. We were addressed by Michael Clitheroe, the general manager, who was very amusing. One thing we noticed was the staff were all smiling and happy in their jobs. They all just did what needed doing with a smile, wonderful !
All the food we had was excellent and the service was without question. 
I had a slight problem with a strange noise in my room. I discussed the problem with Jake who, within ten minutes, moved me to another, upgraded, room. It seems to me that Mr Clitheroe knows exactly how things should work in a hotel such as this and has managed to get all the staff to respond. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay and will go back.

=== A fabulous New year ===
Three of us visited this hotel over New Year. What a fabulous place. 
From the first welcome from Maria to the last goodbyes, the experience was wonderful. It seems a bit unfair to mention a few people by name because the compliments apply to every member of staff but special acknowledgement is justified too. 
We booked the New Year function and stayed over for New Years Day and what a good decision that proved to be. 
New Years Eve was brilliant. A high quality 6 course dinner, music and dancing provided great entertainment and each member of staff was excellent. 
After a day at leisure on New Years Day, sloshing around the water and mud in the New Forest, we chose to have dinner at the hotel again. Another wise decision and delightful Briony looked after us with charm and enthusiasm. Food was again excellent with my turbot outstanding. 
Michael Clitheroe, the General Manager, is clearly a quality individual. Very happy, highly motivated and efficient staff (all of them), high standard food and every appearance of a well run hotel would seem to be testament to his managerial skills. 
An outstanding stay and we shall return
